symptoms.name: 心下滿 / epigastric fullness
symptoms.description: 心下或膈下感覺脹滿不適，常見於中焦鬱熱或水飲阻滯。 / Fullness beneath the heart/epigastrium, commonly due to stagnation in the middle burner from heat or fluid accumulation.

symptoms.name: 痰水積聚 / phlegm-fluid accumulation
symptoms.description: 體內痰濁與水飲互結，濕痰凝滯不化，表現為胸中痰飲壅阻、心下痞硬或胸腹積水、組織間或體腔液體滯留；黏滯不散，難以運化。常因外感邪毒化熱、感染或內臟急性炎症（如急性胰臟炎）造成水液內結並生痰濁，因而可在影像學（如CT）見到腔隙或組織間的水腫或積液。臨床症候可包括胸悶、胸脘脹滿、心下痞塊（xinxiapi）、咳嗽痰多或痰黏難咯、尿少、舌苔膩、脈滑或沉緊等。痰水積聚阻滯氣機、閉阻胸中，可致急重病變，對應《傷寒論》大陷胸等證，影像學所見的edema或積液與此病機相符。 / Pathological interbinding of phlegm turbidity and retained fluids (phlegm-fluid). Damp-phlegm and water congeal and fail to resolve, presenting as phlegm-fluid stagnation obstructing the chest, palpable epigastric obstruction (xinxiapi), thoracic or abdominal effusion, or interstitial/cavitary fluid accumulation; the fluids are sticky and refractory. Common causes include pathogenic invasion transforming to heat, infection, or acute visceral inflammation (for example acute pancreatitis) leading to internal binding of fluids and generation of turbid phlegm. These collections may be visible on imaging (e.g., CT) as edema or localized fluid collections. Clinical manifestations can include chest oppression, epigastric/distension, a palpable mass under the heart (xinxiapi), cough with copious or sticky sputum difficult to expectorate, oliguria, greasy tongue coating, and a slippery or deep/tight pulse. Phlegm-fluid accumulation obstructs qi movement and may close the chest, producing severe presentations; imaging findings of edema or fluid in conditions such as pancreatitis correspond to the Daxianxiong pattern described in Shanghan Lun.

symptoms.name: 水腫 / edema
symptoms.description: 水腫：指周身或局部組織因液體滯留而出現腫脹，或影像學可見體腔積液（如胸水、腹水）。中醫認為多由水濕內停、脾失運化、陽氣不足或衛氣不固，或痰飲互結、經絡壅滯所致。臨床表現可為浮腫（按之呈凹陷）、肢體沉重、面目或局部腫脹、尿少或尿清長、舌胖苔膩或白滑、脈沉緩或細弱；若痰水壅於胸下、心下痞滿者，可屬大陷胸證，影像上可見胸腹腔大量積液，提示病情可能嚴重、危急，需速辨證處理。 / Edema: swelling due to retention of fluid in tissues or body cavities, or fluid accumulation visible on imaging (eg pleural or abdominal effusion). In TCM it is usually attributed to internal retention of dampness/fluid from spleen failing to transport, yang deficiency or impaired defensive qi, or to phlegm-fluid congealment and channel obstruction. Clinical features include pitting edema, heaviness of the limbs, facial or local swelling, reduced or clear frequent urination, a swollen tongue with greasy or white coating, and a deep slow or thin weak pulse. When phlegm-fluid obstructs the chest with epigastric/fullness symptoms (the classical da xian xiong pattern), imaging may show large pleural or abdominal effusions; such findings can indicate severe or critical disease and require prompt pattern differentiation and treatment.

symptoms.name: 胸中痰飲積聚 / phlegm-fluid retention in the chest
symptoms.description: 痰飲阻滯於胸膈之內，導致胸悶、咳嗽、氣機阻塞或心下痞等臨床表現，為胸中閉阻的主要病機。 / Retention of phlegm-fluid within the chest, causing chest oppression, cough, obstruction of qi movement, or epigastric obstruction; a key pathomechanism for chest blockage.

symptoms.name: 影像學見體腔液體積聚（CT） / imaging-detected cavity fluid accumulation (CT)
symptoms.name_zh: 影像學見體腔液體積聚（CT）
symptoms.description: 指在影像學檢查（如腹部或胸部電腦斷層CT）上可見體腔或組織間液體積聚的客觀發現，常提示痰水、積液或水腫等病理狀態。 / An objective imaging finding (e.g., abdominal or thoracic CT) showing fluid accumulation in body cavities or interstitial spaces, often indicating phlegm-fluid, effusion, or edema.

symptoms.name: 咳吐黃稠痰 / expectoration of thick yellow sputum
symptoms.description: 咳嗽伴隨排出黃色、黏稠之痰液，常提示內有熱邪與濕熱痰濁。 / Cough with expectoration of thick, yellow sputum, often indicating internal heat with turbid phlegm or damp-heat accumulation.

symptoms.name: 氣不得下 / inability of qi to descend
symptoms.description: 氣不得下，指氣機下行受阻，病邪或內外傳變阻滯中焦、胸膈或氣機的清降功能，致使氣不能向下運行而上逆。臨床表現為胸悶、脘悶、噯氣不順、氣上逆、呼吸短促，重者見嘔逆、咳喘或上焦脹滿。從六經傳變的病機看，當外感病邪由表入裡（如太陽傳入陽明、少陽等）或正氣失常、寒濕熱邪阻滯，使本應順時針運行的氣機被擾動，降濁不暢，即成氣不得下；治療上需疏通氣機、助其下行、調和中焦，並依六經辨證定方藥。 / Inability of qi to descend refers to obstruction of qi's downward movement: pathogens or internal transmission block the middle burner or chest, impairing the normal descending (clearing) function so qi fails to move downward and instead rebels upward. Clinical manifestations include chest and epigastric oppression, belching, uncoordinated eructation, upward-flowing qi, shortness of breath, and in severe cases vomiting, coughing or wheezing and upper‑burner fullness. In terms of six-channel (liujing) transmission, when an external disorder moves inward (e.g. from taiyang into yangming or shaoyang) or when the upright qi is disrupted and cold, damp or heat block the course of qi, the normally clockwise circulation of qi is disturbed and descent is impaired. Treatment focuses on unblocking and directing qi downward, harmonizing the middle burner, and selecting formulas according to six‑channel pattern differentiation.

symptoms.name: 胸痛 / chest pain
symptoms.description: 胸部疼痛，可能是刺痛、脹痛或悶痛，伴隨心下痞或胸中積聚等證候。 / Pain in the chest, which may be stabbing, distending, or oppressive, often accompanying epigastric obstruction or chest accumulation.

symptoms.name: 腹部影像可見痰水（腹部CT示） / abdominal imaging showing phlegm-fluid (abdominal CT)
symptoms.name_zh: 腹部影像可見痰水（腹部CT示）
symptoms.description: 腹部CT等影像學上顯示腸周或胰周有液體或黏稠物，常見於急性胰臟炎伴隨的局部積液或膿性滲出。 / Findings on abdominal CT showing fluid or viscous material around the intestines or pancreas, common in acute pancreatitis with peripancreatic fluid collections or exudates.

symptoms.name: 惡寒發熱 / chills and fever
symptoms.description: 表證常見，外感寒邪攻表，表現為畏寒伴或不伴發熱。 / An exterior sign commonly seen in external cold attacks, characterized by aversion to cold often accompanied by fever.

symptoms.name: 頭痛 / headache
symptoms.description: 頭部疼痛，可見於多種外感表證或裡證轉變過程中。 / Head pain that can occur in many exterior disorders or during transition to internal stages.

symptoms.name: 項背強 / nape/back stiffness
symptoms.description: 項背或肩背肌肉緊張、僵硬，常見於太陽表證。 / Stiffness or rigidity of the nape and upper back muscles, commonly seen in Taiyang exterior patterns.

symptoms.name: 脈浮 / floating pulse
symptoms.description: 脈浮：脈形浮在皮表，輕按便可觸及，為外邪在表的脈象，主表證。臨床上須合併其他脈象與證候判別病位與寒熱，並以此決定先解表或兼治裏證。常見辨別要點：浮而緩——表示表在皮表且裏略有熱或太陰夾表，若手足自溫則胃氣足，病在太陰；浮而緊——浮表兼實，屬表實（表熱裏實）；浮而遲或脈遲兼浮——多見於脾胃虛寒，胃氣不足，表現為食少、腹滿、小便不利等；浮而數則多示裏熱或炎證。脈浮常出現在太陽證傳入少陽、太陰或陽明的過程中，提示需要先解表或在有表證時謹慎攻下，勿盲用寒涼攻下藥以免耗傷胃氣。簡要注：脈浮即表證之脈，指示外邪在表，臨床以此為解表與否之重要依據。 / Floating pulse: the pulse is felt at the superficial level and is palpable with light touch; it is a primary pulse of exterior (biao) pathogenic presence. Clinically it must be read together with other pulse qualities and signs to locate cold/heat and organ involvement, and to decide whether to release the exterior or to treat interior disorder simultaneously. Key distinctions: floating with moderate (huan) — indicates an exterior pulse with slight interior heat or Taiyin involvement; if the hands and feet are naturally warm, stomach qi is abundant and the disorder may be Taiyin; floating with tight (jin) — indicates combined exterior and interior excess (biao shi), i.e. exterior heat with interior repletion; floating with slow (chi) — often seen with spleen–stomach deficiency and cold, presenting as poor appetite, abdominal fullness, difficulty urinating; floating with rapid (shu) suggests interior heat or inflammatory process. The floating pulse often appears when disease transmits from Taiyang into Shaoyang, Taiyin or Yangming, and it signals the need to first resolve the exterior or to be cautious about purging treatments; purging while exterior signs persist can damage stomach qi. Brief note: floating pulse = pulse of biao (exterior), used to indicate an exterior pathogenic presence and to guide whether to解表 (release the exterior) before attacking interior pathology.

symptoms.name: 往來寒熱 / alternating chills and fever
symptoms.description: 指寒熱往來交替，為半表半裡的少陽證特徵。 / Alternating chills and fever, characteristic of a half-exterior half-interior Shaoyang pattern.

symptoms.name: 胸脅苦滿 / chest and hypochondriac fullness
symptoms.description: 胸脅部脹滿不舒，常見於少陽病的氣機不和證候。 / Fullness and discomfort in the chest and hypochondria, commonly seen in Shaoyang disorders due to constrained qi.

symptoms.name: 口苦咽乾 / bitter taste in the mouth and dry throat
symptoms.name_en: bitter taste in the mouth and dry throat
symptoms.description: 口中帶苦、咽乾不適，為少陽病的典型口症。 / Bitter taste in the mouth with dryness of the throat, a classic oral symptom of Shaoyang disorder.

symptoms.name: 脈弦 / wiry pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象緊張有力呈弦狀，常見於肝郁或少陽病等氣機不和之證。 / A tight, forceful pulse with a wiry quality, often seen in liver qi constraint or Shaoyang patterns.

symptoms.name: 高熱 / high fever
symptoms.description: 明顯的高體溫，多見於裡實熱證如陽明病。 / Markedly elevated body temperature, commonly seen in interior excess heat patterns such as Yangming.

symptoms.name: 大渴 / great thirst
symptoms.description: 強烈口渴欲飲，多為裡有熱邪消耗津液的表現。 / Intense thirst with a strong desire to drink, reflecting internal heat that consumes body fluids.

symptoms.name: 煩躁 / irritability/restlessness
symptoms.description: 情緒煩亂、躁動不安，可見於熱證或心神受擾之情況。 / Agitation and restlessness; may be seen in heat patterns or when the mind/Spirit is disturbed.

symptoms.name: 實滿便秘 / abdominal fullness with constipation
symptoms.description: 腹部實滿伴大便秘結，多為裡熱實證所致。 / Abdominal fullness accompanied by constipation, typically due to interior excess heat and stagnation.

symptoms.name: 脈洪大 / large flooding pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象洪大有力，常見於熱盛實證如陽明熱勢。 / A large, flooding and forceful pulse often seen in vigorous heat-excess patterns like Yangming.

symptoms.name: 腹滿 / abdominal fullness
symptoms.description: 腹部脹滿不適，為太陰病常見表現之一，與脾陽虛或痰飲有關。 / Abdominal distention and fullness, common in Taiyin patterns often related to Spleen yang deficiency or phlegm-fluid retention.

symptoms.name: 嘔吐 / vomiting
symptoms.description: 反胃嘔吐，主因為中焦不和或痰飲上逆。臨床上嘔吐可為外感太陽病進入少陽（嘔吐為少陽證）或因中焦（脾胃）運化失常、痰飲濁滯上逆所致。書中並特別指出：常喝酒者（酒客病）因酒傷胃、胃陽失常，遇甘膩藥物（如桂枝湯中之紅棗）易反胃嘔吐；凡屬“吐家”者（平素易噁心、嘔吐、胃隱痛者）恐有胃潰瘍或胃內腫瘤，忌服桂枝湯，因桂枝芍藥發陽、促血行，可能誘發吐膿血或吐血。若舌苔濁膩、黃厚常提示濕熱或痰濁；舌苔薄白則胃氣較健。治法除調理中焦、化痰、降逆外，酒客或吐家應避免用桂枝湯，可用如葛根芩連湯以清化濕熱，或在兼咳喘、黃痰時酌加厚朴、杏仁等藥。臨床警語：出現反覆嘔吐、吐血、或服桂枝湯後嘔吐者，應懷疑胃器質性病變並慎選方藥。 / Nausea and vomiting resulting from disharmony of the middle burner (middle jiao) or upward movement of phlegm-fluid. In TCM vomiting may indicate that an external Taiyang pattern has progressed into Shaoyang (vomiting is characteristic of Shaoyang), or it may arise from impaired spleen-stomach transport with retention of dampness/phlegm that rises and counterflows. The text specifically warns that habitual drinkers (“jiuke”/alcoholics) have damaged stomach function and often react with nausea or vomiting to sweet, sticky herbs (for example the jujube in Gui Zhi Tang); such patients frequently dislike sweet tastes. People prone to vomiting (“tujia”)—those with chronic nausea, epigastric discomfort or occult gastric pain—may have peptic ulcers or gastric masses and should avoid Gui Zhi Tang, because the warming, dispersing action of guizhi and shaoyao can accelerate circulation and provoke vomiting of pus or blood. A greasy yellow thick coating on the tongue suggests damp-heat or phlegm-damp; a thin white coating indicates relatively intact stomach qi. Management focuses on harmonizing the middle jiao, transforming phlegm and directing rebellious qi downward. In alcohol-damaged or chronic-vomiter cases Gui Zhi Tang is contraindicated; alternatives include Ge Gen Qin Lian Tang to clear damp-heat, or adding herbs such as Hou Po and Xing Ren when cough/bronchial phlegm and yellow sputum are present. Clinical caution: recurrent vomiting, vomiting of blood or pus, or vomiting precipitated by Gui Zhi Tang should prompt suspicion of organic gastric disease and careful selection or avoidance of formulas.

symptoms.name: 食少 / poor appetite
symptoms.description: 食欲減退，常見於脾胃虛弱或太陰病。 / Reduced appetite, commonly seen in Spleen-Stomach deficiency or Taiyin patterns.

symptoms.name: 體倦 / fatigue
symptoms.description: 全身乏力、倦怠，與中氣不足或脾陽虛有關。 / Generalized tiredness and lassitude, related to middle qi deficiency or Spleen yang deficiency.

symptoms.name: 便溏 / loose stools
symptoms.description: 大便稀薄不實，為脾運不健或太陰病的典型表現。 / Loose or watery stools, typical of impaired Spleen transportive function or Taiyin pattern.

symptoms.name: 畏寒肢冷 / aversion to cold with cold extremities
symptoms.name_en: aversion to cold with cold extremities
symptoms.description: 怕冷、四肢冰冷，多見於少陰陽虛或陽虛證。 / Sensitivity to cold with cold limbs, commonly seen in Shaoyin patterns of Yang deficiency.

symptoms.name: 心悸 / palpitations
symptoms.description: 心神不安或心動過速不規則，少陰病可見心下悸或心悸症狀。 / Uneasy sensation in the heart or irregular rapid heartbeats; palpitations can be seen in Shaoyin disorders.

symptoms.name: 睡不安 / restless sleep
symptoms.description: 睡眠不寧、多夢或難以安眠，心腎不交或虛擾常見。 / Disturbed sleep with restlessness or excessive dreaming; common when Heart and Kidney are not harmonized.

symptoms.name: 虛熱 / empty-heat
symptoms.description: 陰虛虛熱，表現為午後潮熱、盜汗、口乾但無大熱勢。 / Heat due to yin deficiency presenting as tidal fever in the afternoon, night sweats, dry mouth without high fever.

symptoms.name: 四肢厥冷 / cold extremities (Jueyin)
symptoms.description: 四肢冰冷、厥逆感，為厥陰病或重症的常見表現。 / Coldness of the limbs with a sense of reversal, common in Jueyin pattern or severe disorders.

symptoms.name: 嘔逆 / rebelious vomiting
symptoms.description: 胃氣逆上引起反胃噁心與嘔吐，厥陰、太陰等可見。 / Upward reversal of stomach qi causing nausea and vomiting; may be seen in Jueyin or Taiyin patterns.

symptoms.name: 躁擾 / agitation
symptoms.description: 精神躁動、焦慮不安，常見於熱擾或營血不和之證。 / Mental agitation and restlessness, often seen with heat disturbance or disharmony of nutritive-level and blood.

symptoms.name: 惡寒 / aversion to cold
symptoms.description: 感到寒冷、發抖並畏寒不暖，常見於太陽表證及傷寒。 / Sensation of pronounced cold with shivering and aversion to cold, commonly seen in Taiyang external presentations and Shanghan.

symptoms.name: 發熱 / fever
symptoms.description: 體溫升高，可為低熱或高熱，為表裡熱證的一般表現。 / Elevated body temperature, ranging from low-grade to high fever, a common sign of internal or external heat patterns.

symptoms.name: 汗出 / sweating
symptoms.description:
汗出（可自汗或他汗）提示營衛、腸胃津液、肺胃等的津液與衛氣變動。發汗後常見的證候與機轉：
- 發汗後仍然身疼、脈沉遲：為汗發過度傷津、孫絡乾耗，屬表已解但裏虛，應以調和營衛、補回津液為要（如桂枝加芍藥生薑人參新加湯調理）。
- 汗出而喘、無大熱：表虛而邪入肺，需宣肺而不再發汗，以麻黃配石膏、杏仁、甘草下降清熱、祛痰（如麻黃杏仁甘草石膏湯變方）。
- 發汗過多導致心下悸、叉手自冒心或臍下悸奔豚：為發陽過度或津液被動上衝所致，視病位用桂枝甘草湯以化水氣、回陽或茯苓桂枝甘草大棗湯以利水導下、補回腸胃津液。麻黃類發汗傷肺多見心下悸；桂枝類傷腸胃多見臍下悸奔豚。
- 發汗後腹脹（虛脹或實脹）：虛脹多為腸胃虛、腸氣停聚，用厚朴、生薑、半夏、甘草、人參調和降逆開氣；實脹多為實邪積滯，當攻下。
- 吐下後心下逆滿、氣上衝胸、起則頭眩、發汗即抽搐或震顫：為中膈水飲晃動，宜以茯苓、桂枝、白朮、甘草以利水、健脾、安中（如茯苓桂枝白朮甘草湯）。
- 發汗後煩躁、手足厥冷（四逆）：如兼見煩躁為水上凌心、陰陽兩虛或陽虛者，當以人參、附子、乾薑、甘草、茯苓等補扶陽氣並利水（如茯苓四逆湯及其加減）。
- 發汗後惡寒為虛故；汗後僅覺熱則屬實，需和胃或攻裡（視證如調胃承氣湯等）。
- 大汗後胃中乾、煩躁不眠、渴欲飲水者，應少量分次給水以和胃氣，勿一次大量飲入以防氣機逆亂。
臨床要點：查脈（沉遲、浮滑、微弱等）、辨有無發熱、喘咳、噯氣、腹脹、臍下悸、煩躁、四肢寒冷等，依證屬虛實與病在肺、胃或下焦選方扶正兼導水、兼顧和胃與止驚。常用方劑（中文名）示例：桂枝加芍藥生薑人參新加湯、麻黃杏仁甘草石膏湯、桂枝甘草湯、茯苓桂枝甘草大棗湯、厚朴生薑半夏甘草人參湯、茯苓桂枝白朮甘草湯、茯苓四逆湯、調胃承氣湯等。 / Sweating (spontaneous or induced) indicates changes in the interaction of ying and wei, body fluids (jinye), and functions of lung and stomach. Common post-sweating patterns, mechanisms and management principles:
- Persistent body aches with a submerged and slow pulse: excessive sweating has damaged fluids and the collateral network (sun luo), producing interior deficiency after the surface is released. Principle: harmonize ying and wei and replenish fluids (e.g. guizhi jia shaoyao shengjiang renshen xinjiatang).
- Sweating with dyspnea but without high fever: the pathogen has entered the lung while the surface is vacuous. Do not continue to induce sweat; instead open the lung and clear lung heat, resolve phlegm and harmonize the stomach (e.g. mahuang xingren gancao shigao tang pattern or its variants).
- Excessive sweating causing palpitations under the heart (xinxia ji), ‘hands crossed over the chest’ feeling, or periumbilical palpitation/ben tun upward rushing: caused by over-dispersed yang or passive upward rush of water. Treat by vaporizing or restoring water qi and supporting yang: guizhi gancao tang for rapid drainage/return of vaporized fluid; fuling guizhi gancao dazao tang to drain damp and restore gastrointestinal fluids. Note: mahua n-type over-sweating tends to injure lung fluids and produce xinxia ji; guizhi-type overdispersal tends to injure stomach/intestine fluids producing periumbilical symptoms.
- Post-sweat abdominal distension (xu or shi distension): xu distension (likes pressure, excessive intestinal gas) calls for aromatic descend and spleen/tone support using houpo shengjiang banxia gancao renshen tang; shi distension (rebound pain, fullness) requires purgation (chengqi-type treatments).
- After vomiting/diarrhea with heart-substernal fullness, qi rushing to the chest, dizziness on rising, sweat-provoked cramps or whole-body tremor: indicates middle-jiao water accumulation (water drink) affecting the diaphragm. Principle: promote water transformation, tonify the spleen and stabilize the middle (e.g. fuling guizhi baizhu gancao tang).
- Post-sweat vexation with cold extremities (si ni 四逆): indicates yang collapse or combined yin-yang deficiency. Use warming and supporting formulas that restore yang and guide water downward (e.g. fuling sin i tang and its modifications; where human ginseng containing formulas are used if both yin and yang are weak).
- Post-sweat aversion to cold denotes deficiency; no aversion but heat denotes excess—treat by warming and nourishing if deficient, or by harmonizing the stomach and addressing interior excess if real heat/retention is present (e.g. tiaowei chengqi-type differentiation).
- After profuse sweat with a dry stomach, irritability, inability to sleep and thirst: give small frequent sips to harmonize stomach qi rather than large boluses.
Clinical approach: differentiate pulse and signs (e.g. chen chi, floating, faint), presence of heat, wheeze, belching, abdominal distension, periumbilical palpitation, vexation or cold limbs; determine whether the pattern is lung, stomach, or lower-jiao and whether it is xu or shi, then apply principles of supporting the correct qi, replenishing fluids, harmonizing the stomach, and guiding water. Representative formulas (pinyin): guizhi jia shaoyao shengjiang renshen xinjiatang; mahuang xingren gancao shigao tang; guizhi gancao tang; fuling guizhi gancao dazao tang; houpo shengjiang banxia gancao renshen tang; fuling guizhi baizhu gancao tang; fuling si ni tang; tiaowei chengqi tang.

symptoms.name: 惡風 / aversion to wind
symptoms.description: 不喜風吹拂，遇風則症狀加重，為表邪作用的表現之一。 / Dislike of drafts or wind with symptom aggravation on exposure, a common sign of exterior pathogenic influence.

symptoms.name: 脈緩 / slow/relaxed pulse
symptoms.description: 脈緩（脈象緩慢、節律放慢）：指把脈時脈搏跳動減慢、節律舒緩。臨床上一方面屬病理性脈象，常見於中風（中風證）、外感感染或氣血陽氣虛弱者感染時；另一方面在少陽、陽明等證漸解或病勢好轉時，脈一緩下來常被視為病情將愈的吉徵。辨證時須兼察脈力、脈形及夾帶的症狀：寒證多呈緩而有力，虛證多呈緩而無力；若脈本正常但僅伴惡心等症狀，應警惕妊娠等非病理原因，勿輕率用藥。治療以辨證論治——病欲解者宜保護、扶正而不妄施重藥；若因虛寒或感染致緩，則以補益溫陽或清裡解表為主。古籍於少陽證解時亦言脈自寅至辰上，脈緩為可喜之徵。 / Slow/relaxed pulse (mai huan): a pulse with reduced beats and a more relaxed rhythm when palpated. Clinically this can be either pathological—commonly seen in windstroke (zhongfeng), in debilitated patients with infection, or with qi/blood and yang deficiency—or a sign of recovery: in Shaoyang and Yangming presentations a pulse that relaxes/slow down often indicates the disease is resolving. When assessing, note pulse strength and shape and accompanying symptoms: cold patterns often show a slow but forceful pulse, deficiency shows a slow and weak pulse. If the pulse rate is otherwise normal but only symptoms like nausea occur, consider pregnancy rather than disease and avoid unnecessary medication. Management depends on pattern: when the disease is resolving, support the patient and avoid aggressive treatment; when the slowdown is due to deficiency, cold, or infection, treat by tonifying/warming yang or clearing the pathogenic factor as indicated. Classical texts also record that in Shaoyang resolution the pulse moves from yin to chen (from yín to chén) and a relaxing pulse is an auspicious sign.

symptoms.name: 脈緊 / tight/tense pulse
symptoms.description: 脈來緊張有力，按之緊束，常見於寒邪束表或傷寒時脈象。 / A tense, tight pulse felt bound under pressure, commonly seen with cold constraining the exterior or in Shanghan.

symptoms.name: 自汗出 / spontaneous sweating
symptoms.description: 非運動或發熱時出汗，多因津液耗傷或衛虛所致，常見風溫或氣虛。 / Sweating that occurs without exertion or fever, often due to fluid loss or deficient wei qi, seen in Fengwen or qi deficiency.

symptoms.name: 身重 / heavy body sensation
symptoms.description: 全身覺得沉重乏力，常與水濕或脾失運化相關。 / Generalized heaviness and lethargy often associated with damp accumulation or Spleen dysfunction.

symptoms.name: 多眠睡 / excessive sleepiness
symptoms.description: 嗜睡、睡眠時間延長且精神不振，見於津液不足或中毒性表證。 / Oversleeping with prolonged sleep and lethargy, seen with fluid depletion or systemic toxic exterior patterns.

symptoms.name: 鼻息必鼾 / snoring
symptoms.description: 睡中呼吸鼾聲，提示呼吸道或氣機不利且多見於表熱耗津後的沉睡狀態。 / Noisy breathing during sleep (snoring), indicating airway or qi dysfunction often seen after exterior heat with fluid loss.

symptoms.name: 言語難出 / difficulty speaking
symptoms.description: 言語減少或發言困難，反映神志或肌肉運動受影響。 / Reduced speech or difficulty articulating, reflecting impairment of consciousness or motor control.

symptoms.name: 小便不利 / scanty urination
symptoms.description: 尿量減少或排尿困難，常見於體內津液不足或水濕內停。 / Decreased urine output or difficulty urinating, commonly due to fluid depletion or internal damp retention.

symptoms.name: 直視 / fixed gaze
symptoms.description: 眼睛凝視不轉，可能為失血或嚴重虛損所致之危急表現。 / Eyes fixed without normal movement, a possible acute sign of severe blood loss or profound deficiency.

symptoms.name: 失溲 / urinary incontinence
symptoms.description: 無法控制排尿或尿失禁，屬嚴重津液或腎氣衰竭的表現之一。 / Loss of urinary control or incontinence, indicating severe fluid depletion or kidney qi failure.

symptoms.name: 面色微黃 / slightly yellow complexion
symptoms.description: 面色偏黃但非典型肝膽黃疸，常見於津液耗損顯露血色。 / A mildly yellow facial color not typical of hepatobiliary jaundice, often due to fluid loss exposing blood hue.

symptoms.name: 抽搐 / convulsions
symptoms.description: 肌肉不自主收縮或抽搐，見於嚴重津液喪失或中風發驚癇。 / Involuntary muscle contractions or seizures, seen in severe fluid depletion or acute convulsive states.

symptoms.name: 身灼熱 / burning body sensation
symptoms.description: 全身呈灼熱感，常伴體表有熱但內津不足之候。 / A burning sensation of the body, often with exterior heat and internal fluid insufficiency.

symptoms.name: 體痛 / body aches
symptoms.description: 全身或四肢酸痛痠楚，多見於外邪束表或水濕停滯所致。 / Generalized or limb aching commonly seen with exterior pathogenic confinement or fluid stagnation.

symptoms.name: 脈陰陽俱緊 / both pulses tight
symptoms.description: 寸尺脈同時浮而緊或俱緊，常為傷寒之脈象，提示病在表而束。 / Both inch and cubit pulses are simultaneously tight and tense, often a Shanghan pulse indicating exterior-constraining pathogenic influence.

symptoms.name: 脈陰陽俱浮 / both pulses floating
symptoms.description: 左右寸尺脈同時浮出，表示病在表且為表熱或表證之象。 / Both inch and cubit pulses are simultaneously floating, indicating an exterior pattern affecting both sides or an exterior heat presentation.

symptoms.name: 脈數急 / rapid and urgent pulse
symptoms.description: 脈來數且急促，為病勢傳入裏者之警示脈象。 / A rapid and hurried pulse indicating that the disease is transmitting into the interior.

symptoms.name: 精神萎靡 / mental lassitude
symptoms.description: 表現為精神不振、意識模糊或提不起精神，常見於表證解除後恢復未全的情形。 / Manifested as low spirit, poor mental alertness or lethargy, often seen when exterior signs have resolved but the patient has not fully recovered.

symptoms.name: 身大熱反欲近衣 / hot body but desires to wear clothes
symptoms.name_en: hot body but desires to wear clothes
symptoms.description: 病人體表感覺很熱，但主觀上卻想蓋衣保暖，為真寒假熱的表現之一。 / The body feels very hot while the patient paradoxically wants to cover up; a sign of 'true cold, false heat'.

symptoms.name: 身大寒反不欲近衣 / cold body but desires to undress
symptoms.name_en: cold body but desires to undress
symptoms.description: 病人體表感覺寒冷，但主觀上卻想脫衣物，為真熱假寒的表現之一。 / The body feels very cold while the patient paradoxically wants to remove clothing; a sign of 'true heat, false cold'.

symptoms.name: 鼻鳴 / noisy nasal breathing / nasal flaring
symptoms.description: 鼻腔有明顯響聲或阻塞感，呼吸時有鼻鳴聲，常伴鼻塞或上呼吸道症狀。 / Audible nasal noise or flaring during respiration, often with nasal congestion or upper airway symptoms.

symptoms.name: 無汗 / absence of sweating
symptoms.description: 皮膚無汗出，即使發熱或惡寒也不出汗，常見於表寒束表的情況。 / Lack of sweating even with fever or aversion to cold, commonly seen when exterior cold constricts the pores.

symptoms.name: 面頰鮮紅界限分明 / bilateral bright red cheeks with clear border
symptoms.name_en: bilateral bright red cheeks with clear border
symptoms.description: 兩頰鮮紅且與周圍皮膚界限明顯，為真寒假熱常見面色表現之一。 / Bright red cheeks on both sides with a distinct border from surrounding skin, often seen in 'true cold, false heat'.

symptoms.name: 呼出氣不溫且不急促 / exhalation not warm and not rapid
symptoms.name_en: exhalation not warm and not rapid
symptoms.description: 呼出的氣既不溫暖也不急促，顯示體內陽氣不足或內寒傾向。 / Exhaled breath is neither warm nor rapid, indicating deficient internal yang or tendency toward interior cold.

symptoms.name: 舌乾質淡 / tongue dry and pale in quality
symptoms.name_en: tongue dry and pale in quality
symptoms.description: 舌乾但質地偏淡，顯示內有寒而津液不足的表征。 / Tongue is dry but pale in substance, suggesting interior cold with insufficient fluids.

symptoms.name: 脈浮數按之無力 / floating-rapid but forceless pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象表現為浮而數，但按之無力，常見於表證表現與裡虛並存的情況。 / Pulse is floating and rapid yet feels forceless on pressure, often seen when exterior signs coexist with interior deficiency.

symptoms.name: 脈沉細 / deep thin pulse
symptoms.description: 脈沉而細小，多提示邪在裡或裡熱耗陰的證候。 / Pulse is deep and thin, often indicating interior location of the pathogen or interior heat consuming yin.

symptoms.name: 舌乾質燥 / tongue dry and parched
symptoms.description: 舌體乾燥、質地燥裂，常見於裡熱或津液大傷的情形。 / Tongue surface is dry and parched, commonly seen with interior heat or severe fluid injury.

symptoms.name: 乾嘔 / dry retching
symptoms.description: 有欲嘔惡心但無吐出物，喉間乾嘔，為桂枝湯證可見之伴證之一。 / Nausea with retching but no expectoration of contents, a possible accompanying sign in Gui Zhi Tang presentations.

symptoms.name: 嗇嗇惡寒 / intermittent chills
symptoms.description: 一陣一陣的寒顫或冷意，常伴有汗出不足之表虛證。 / Intermittent waves of chills or cold sensations, often accompanying deficient exterior patterns with sweating.

symptoms.name: 淅淅惡風 / sudden aversion to wind
symptoms.description: 對風吹動非常敏感，感覺不適或寒顫，為表證常見症狀。 / Marked sensitivity and discomfort to wind exposure, often causing chills; a common exterior symptom.

symptoms.name: 胸悶 / chest tightness
symptoms.description: 胸口脹悶不舒，可能因氣滯或血虛所致，在誤用桂枝湯時可加重。 / Sensation of tightness or oppression in the chest, possibly due to qi stagnation or reduced circulation; may worsen if inappropriate Gui Zhi Tang is given.

symptoms.name: 脈浮緊 / floating-tense pulse
symptoms.description: 脈浮緊者脈象浮而緊，為太陽表寒之象，常見無汗、惡寒明顯及身體痠痛；此候當以發汗解表，表實而裏未虛者多主用麻黃湯。但發汗前須辨尺脈是否虛弱，若下焦虛弱不可大汗以免傷津耗血。 / A floating‑tense pulse is floating and tight, indicating Taiyang exterior cold—commonly with absence of sweating, marked aversion to cold, and body aches; this pattern calls for releasing the exterior by sweating and, when the exterior is replete and the interior not deficient, Ma Huang Tang is the primary formula. Before inducing sweating check the chi pulse for deficiency; if the lower pulse is weak do not provoke profuse sweating lest fluids and blood be harmed.

symptoms.name: 吐膿血 / vomiting pus and blood
symptoms.description: 嘔吐膿血或帶膿血樣物，多見於胃潰瘍或胃破裂等證候。 / Vomiting pus and blood, often indicates severe gastric lesion such as ulcer or erosion.

symptoms.name: 舌苔濁膩 / greasy turbid tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌苔厚重濁膩，顯示濕熱或痰濕內蘊。 / Thick, greasy, turbid tongue coating indicating damp-heat or phlegm-damp accumulation.

symptoms.name: 舌苔厚黃 / thick yellow tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌苔厚而黃，提示裏熱炽盛，尤多見於中焦濕熱夾雜。苔厚且膩者為濕濁凝滯，中焦濕熱；苔黃而乾硬則多見於熱盛耗津。臨床常伴小便不利、無汗或潮熱、心中懊惱、食少口渴，甚至身色發黃等陽明證候。此候宜清熱化濕、寬中利水（古方例見梔子豆豉湯），但須合脈證辨證施治，勿盲目攻下。 / Thick yellow tongue coating indicates vigorous interior heat and is especially seen with damp-heat lodged in the middle jiao. A thick, greasy (slimy) coating reflects turbid dampness obstructing the middle (damp-heat), while a yellow, dry/hard coating suggests intense heat that has injured the fluids. Clinically it often coexists with Yangming-pattern signs such as difficult or reduced urination, absence of sweating or tidal/afternoon fever, vexation in the chest/epigastrium, poor appetite and thirst, and may progress to jaundice. This pattern points to clearing heat and resolving dampness in the middle jiao (classical reference: zhi zi dou chi tang), but treatment must be determined by full pulse and symptom differentiation rather than applied indiscriminately.

symptoms.name: 舌苔薄白 / thin white tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌苔薄白為正常或表證未深，提示胃氣尚存。 / Thin white tongue coating is normal or indicates a superficial exterior pattern with preserved stomach qi.

symptoms.name: 氣喘 / dyspnea/wheezing (asthma)
symptoms.description: 呼吸急促、喘息或氣短，多因肺氣不利或痰飲阻肺。 / Rapid breathing, wheeze or shortness of breath, often due to impaired lung qi or phlegm-fluid obstructing the lungs.

symptoms.name: 身癢 / itching (skin itching)
symptoms.description: 皮膚瘙癢，常因表汗不透或風邪留著肌表所致。 / Skin itching, often due to unresolved exterior or wind remaining in the skin level.

symptoms.name: 大汗出 / profuse sweating
symptoms.description: 大量汗出，常使津液耗損，可能轉入裏熱或傷陰。 / Profuse sweating that depletes body fluids and may lead to interior heat or yin damage.

symptoms.name: 脈促 / hurried pulse
symptoms.description: 脈跳頻促且有間歇，常見於血行回流不暢或驟然失血後的心機不遑。 / Rapid, hurried pulse often with intermittence, seen when venous return is altered or after sudden downward movement of blood.

symptoms.name: 四肢微急 / slight limb cramps
symptoms.description: 四肢輕微抽搐或攣急，常因津液不足或經脈失養所致。 / Mild cramps or twitching of the limbs, commonly due to fluid depletion or insufficient nourishment of the channels.

symptoms.name: 脈微弱 / feeble/weak pulse
symptoms.description: 脈細弱無力，代表陽氣或津液虛弱，不能發汗或攻下。 / Fine, weak pulse indicating deficiency of yang or body fluids; patient is not suitable for sweating or purging.

symptoms.name: 面色潮紅 / flushed complexion
symptoms.description: 面色潮紅，可能為裡熱未解或虛熱外現。 / Flushed face, may indicate unresolved interior heat or false heat due to deficiency.

symptoms.name: 胸滿 / chest fullness
symptoms.description: 胸中脹滿不舒，常與血行受阻或氣機不利有關。 / Pressure or fullness in the chest, often related to impaired circulation or constrained qi movement.

symptoms.name: 翕翕發熱 / intermittent fever
symptoms.description: 一陣一陣的發熱，熱度間歇性出現。 / Intermittent episodes of fever occurring in waves.

symptoms.name: 小便數 / frequent urination
symptoms.description: 小便次數增多，排尿次數頻繁。 / Increased frequency of urination.

symptoms.name: 咽中乾 / dry throat
symptoms.description: 咽喉乾燥無潤，常感口渴或吞嚥不適。 / Dryness in the throat causing thirst or discomfort on swallowing.

symptoms.name: 譫語 / delirium/delirious speech
symptoms.description: 神志不清或胡言亂語，精神錯亂。 / Delirious speech or confused, rambling talk.

symptoms.name: 腳攣急 / leg cramps/spasms
symptoms.description: 腳部抽筋、拘急或伸屈困難。 / Cramping or spasmodic contraction of the legs causing difficulty in extension.

symptoms.name: 厥逆 / reversal with cold limbs (jueqi)
symptoms.description: 四肢逆冷、末端發涼甚至休克樣的寒逆表現。 / Cold reversal with cold extremities, limbs become cold and may indicate collapse.

symptoms.name: 足溫 / warm feet
symptoms.description: 足部回溫，為陽氣回復的臨床征象。 / Warmth returning to the feet, a clinical sign of returning yang.

symptoms.name: 舌苔厚白 / thick white tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌苔厚重且呈白色，多見於中焦濕盛或寒濕證。 / Thick white tongue coating often indicating dampness or cold in the middle burner.

symptoms.name: 下利 / diarrhea/borborygmus with loose stools
symptoms.description: 大便稀薄或頻繁下瀉，或腹中湧泄不止。 / Loose, watery stools or frequent diarrhea; urgent downward flow from the intestines.

symptoms.name: 小便清利 / clear abundant urination
symptoms.description: 小便清而量多，色淡透明，常見於陽虛或寒證。 / Clear, abundant pale urine often seen in yang deficiency or cold patterns.

symptoms.name: 微惡寒 / slight aversion to cold
symptoms.description: 內生的輕微怕冷感，常提示裏虛或陰陽失衡。 / A slight internal aversion to cold, often indicating internal deficiency or imbalance.

symptoms.name: 胃氣不和 / disharmony of stomach qi
symptoms.description: 胃氣運行不調，表現為噁心、嘔逆、脘腹脹痛或食滯。 / Disordered stomach qi manifesting as nausea, vomiting, epigastric/distension, or food stagnation.

symptoms.name: 喉嚨痛 / sore throat
symptoms.description: 咽喉部疼痛或刺痛感，常伴有咽乾或吞嚥不適。 / Pain or soreness in the throat, often with dryness or painful swallowing.

symptoms.name: 骨節疼痛 / joint and bone pain
symptoms.description: 骨節和關節酸痛，活動時加重，多見於風寒束表或痰濕阻絡。 / Aching pain of bones and joints, worse with movement, often seen with wind‑cold or phlegm‑damp obstruction.

symptoms.name: 頭項強痛 / nape and neck stiffness/pain
symptoms.description: 頭後項部位緊張僵硬或疼痛，常見於太陽經束表或表寒。 / Stiffness or pain in the nape and neck region, commonly seen with Taiyang exterior disorders or cold constriction.

symptoms.name: 微痛 / mild pain
symptoms.description: 輕微的疼痛感，痛勢不重但可影響舒適度。 / Mild, slight pain that is not severe but causes discomfort.

symptoms.name: 吐逆 / rebellious vomiting
symptoms.description: 胃氣上逆導致嘔吐、反胃或逆噴。 / Upward counterflow of stomach qi resulting in vomiting or regurgitation.

symptoms.name: 下利清穀 / watery diarrhea with undigested food
symptoms.description: 下利清穀：飯食入口即下，瀉出清稀或透明偏白的糜狀水樣大便，常夾帶未消化的穀粒。此為脾胃陽虛、腸中寒濕或下焦寒濕運化失司所致，食後即下，不能消化吸收。臨床多見於少陰病的寒虛證候（陽氣不足、內寒盛），若轉為口燥咽乾、腸中燥結則屬陽明熱實需攻下；若舌苔白、脈沉遲、四肢厥冷或下利頻多，則屬寒濕下利，治宜溫中散寒、回陽固脾止瀉。常用法則包括溫補為主：用附子類方以回陽溫中（如附子湯，重用乾薑、炙甘草）、或灸神闕隔鹽灸以溫腸胃；病性偏虛時可先用甘草瀉心湯類調理，病屬實寒或兼有便燥熱象時則慎用大承氣類攻下方。 / Watery diarrhea with undigested food: stools are passed soon after eating and are thin, clear to pale and often contain undigested grains. This pattern typically indicates spleen–stomach yang deficiency with cold-damp accumulation in the lower jiao — impaired transport/transformation so ingested food is not properly digested and is rapidly evacuated. It is commonly associated with a Shaoyin (少陰) pattern of yang deficiency or interior cold. If signs of heat appear (dry mouth/throat, constipation with dry stools), the pattern may have transformed to Yangming heat and purgation (e.g., Dachengqi Tang) may be indicated. If there is a white tongue coating, submerged slow pulse, cold extremities, or profuse clear diarrhea, the pattern is cold-damp lower-jiao diarrhea and the treatment principle is to warm the middle and lower jiao, restore yang, consolidate the spleen and stop diarrhea. Therapeutic approaches described in the source include warming Fuzi-containing formulas (e.g., Fuzi Tang with emphasis on dried ginger and roasted licorice), moxibustion at Shenque (often with salt), choosing Gan Cao Xie Xin Tang rather than Shengjiang Xie Xin Tang when virtual cold predominates, and reserving harsh purgatives for true interior heat patterns.

symptoms.name: 口渴 / thirst
symptoms.description: 感覺口乾渴欲飲，常見於內有熱或津液不足。 / A sensation of oral dryness with desire to drink, often seen with interior heat or fluid deficiency.

symptoms.name: 脈浮細 / floating-thin pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象浮而細，表證猶存但脈力減弱。 / Pulse that is floating and thin, indicating a lingering exterior sign with weakened pulse strength.

symptoms.name: 嗜臥 / preference to lie down / somnolence
symptoms.description: 病人多欲臥，嗜睡不喜活動。 / Marked desire to lie down or somnolence; patient prefers sleeping and reduced activity.

symptoms.name: 咽喉癢 / itchy throat
symptoms.description: 咽喉覺得癢癢，常引發咳嗽或欲清喉。 / Itchy sensation in the throat, often provoking cough or throat-clearing.

symptoms.name: 吐出白色泡沫痰 / expectoration of white foamy sputum
symptoms.description: 吐出清白泡沫狀痰，多見於表裏俱寒、水飲內停。 / Expectoration of clear white foamy sputum, often seen with exterior–interior cold and internal water retention.

symptoms.name: 表寒裏熱 / exterior cold with interior heat
symptoms.description: 表證為寒而裏實或裏熱，表寒與裏熱同時存在的臨床表現。 / Clinical picture of exterior cold coexisting with interior heat (cold on the surface, heat internally).

symptoms.name: 心下有水氣 / water accumulation below the heart (epigastric water retention)
symptoms.name_en: water accumulation below the heart (epigastric water retention)
symptoms.description: 心下（胃脘）有水飲停聚，常致乾嘔、咳嗽或喉中癢。 / Water/drink accumulation in the epigastrium causing dry retching, cough, or throat irritation.

symptoms.name: 少腹滿 / lower abdominal fullness
symptoms.description: 少腹脹滿不舒，伴小便不利或水氣停聚。 / Fullness and distension in the lower abdomen, often with urinary difficulty or retained water.

symptoms.name: 喉中如結 / sensation of a knot in the throat (globus)
symptoms.name_en: sensation of a knot in the throat (globus)
symptoms.description: 喉中有異物感，似有東西結在喉中，影響吞咽或咳嗽。 / A sensation of a lump or knot in the throat (globus), interfering with swallowing or provoking cough.

symptoms.name: 咳嗽 / coughing
symptoms.description: 呼吸道刺激引起的咳嗽，可伴痰、喘等。 / Cough caused by respiratory tract irritation, may be accompanied by sputum or wheeze.

symptoms.name: 表不解 / exterior not resolved
symptoms.description: 表證未解，惡寒、發熱等表象仍在，外邪未散。 / Exterior signs persist (aversion to cold, fever, etc.), indicating the exterior pathogen has not been released.

symptoms.name: 微熱 / low-grade fever
symptoms.description: 輕微的發熱，體溫略高但不達高熱。 / Mild elevation of body temperature; slight fever not reaching high fever.

symptoms.name: 不渴 / no thirst
symptoms.description: 缺乏口渴感，常見於體內水飲盛時。 / Absence of thirst, often seen when internal fluids are abundant.

symptoms.name: 脅痛 / hypochondriac pain
symptoms.description: 脅肋部位疼痛脹痛，常見於少陽證。 / Pain or distention in the hypochondriac region, commonly seen in Shaoyang patterns.

symptoms.name: 吐出清白泡沫痰 / expectoration of clear white foamy sputum
symptoms.name_en: expectoration of clear white foamy sputum
symptoms.description: 痰清白如泡沫，常見於寒飲內停之證。 / Clear white foamy sputum, typical of cold fluid retention.

symptoms.name: 吐痰影響臥位 / expectoration that prevents lying down
symptoms.description: 咳痰劇烈至不得臥，躺下即咳，坐不得睡。 / Expectoration and cough severe enough to prevent lying down; patient must sit up to breathe.

symptoms.name: 表寒 / exterior cold
symptoms.description: 表證以寒為主，惡寒、脈浮緊或浮緩等表層病象。 / Exterior pattern dominated by cold, marked by aversion to cold and floating pulse.

symptoms.name: 脈浮弱 / floating-weak pulse
symptoms.description: 脈浮而力量薄弱，示表邪猶在而正氣不足，屬太陽病外證未解之證候；治以解表發汗為主，原則上宜用桂枝湯，凡久病仍見此脈象仍以證取方。若兼微喘咳嗽，當用桂枝加厚朴杏仁湯等加減；切忌誤以攻下（下之為逆）或在尺脈遲微、下焦虛弱時強行發汗。 / A floating but weak pulse indicates an exterior pathogen still present with deficient upright qi — a Taiyang pattern of unresolved exterior; treatment aims to release the exterior by inducing sweat, typically with Gui Zhi Tang, and even in prolonged illness the formula is chosen by pattern. If there is slight panting or cough, modify to Gui Zhi Jia Hou Po Xing Ren Tang; do not use purgation or aggressive downward-draining therapies (downbearing causes reversal), and avoid forcing sweat when the chi (distal) pulse is slow or very weak, which indicates interior deficiency.

symptoms.name: 微喘 / mild dyspnea
symptoms.description: 輕微氣促或呼吸短促，多見於表未解或喘咳未止之狀。 / Slight shortness of breath or mild wheezing, often occurring when the exterior is unresolved or cough persists.

symptoms.name: 脈濇 / choppy/rough pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象扁而遲細，按之不流暢，常提示汗出不澈或津液不和。 / A flattened, slow and thin pulse that feels uneven on palpation, often indicating imperfect sweating or disharmony of body fluids.

symptoms.name: 脈浮數 / floating-rapid pulse
symptoms.description: 脈位浮而數，表熱兼外證未解，見於表證尚在且有熱象者。 / Pulse that is floating and rapid, seen when the exterior is present with signs of heat.

symptoms.name: 汗出不澈 / imperfect sweating
symptoms.description: 汗出但不暢或表未完全解，病邪未盡而表氣怫鬱。 / Sweating that is incomplete or not thorough, indicating the exterior pathogen has not been fully released.

symptoms.name: 自衄 / spontaneous epistaxis (nosebleed)
symptoms.description: 不由外傷而自發的鼻衄，多見於陽熱亢盛或陽氣上迫者。 / Spontaneous nosebleed not caused by trauma, often seen with exuberant yang or upward rush of qi and blood.

symptoms.name: 偏頭痛 / unilateral headache (migraine-like)
symptoms.description: 一側頭痛或脈絡局限性劇痛，與少陽或半表半裏證相絡。 / Pain localized to one side of the head, often associated with Shaoyang or mixed exterior-interior patterns.

symptoms.name: 印堂痛 / glabellar pain
symptoms.description: 位於兩眉間印堂處的疼痛，為陽明上衝或腸胃熱向上擾動之象。 / Pain located at the glabella (between the eyebrows), often reflecting upward disturbance of stomach heat or Yangming disorder.

symptoms.name: 脈濇按之扁 / flattened choppy pulse
symptoms.description: 指濇脈扁平不流暢，壓之扁，提示汗出不澈或脈象濁澀。 / A choppy (se) pulse that feels flattened and not flowing, suggesting imperfect sweating or turbid pulse quality.

symptoms.name: 面色緣緣正赤 / bright red facial flush
symptoms.description: 面色紅潤且邊緣鮮明，為陽氣郁於表而上衝之象。 / A bright red facial complexion with clear border, indicating yang qi constrained at the surface and rushing upward.

symptoms.name: 尺中脈微 / feeble pulse at chi (deep/weak at wrist-southern position)
symptoms.name_en: feeble pulse at chi (deep/weak at wrist-southern position)
symptoms.description: 尺中脈微表下焦或腎精不足，按之微弱乃裏虛之象。 / A feeble pulse at the chi position indicating lower burner or kidney deficiency and interior vacuity.

symptoms.name: 脈微細 / fine-weak pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象細小而微弱，常見於陰陽兩虛或津液不足後的脈象。 / Pulse is thin and weak, often seen in combined yin-yang deficiency or after fluid depletion.

symptoms.name: 脈沉微 / deep-faint pulse
symptoms.description: 脈沉而細微，按之難覺，常見於陽虛或臟腑深處病勢。 / Pulse is deep and faint, hard to perceive on palpation; commonly indicates yang deficiency or deep-organ pathology.

symptoms.name: 脈沉遲 / deep-slow pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象沉而遲澀，代表病在裡且有寒證或氣血虛損。 / Pulse that is deep and slow, indicating interior location and cold or qi/blood depletion.

symptoms.name: 四肢末端疼痛 / distal limb pain
symptoms.description: 四肢末端（手足）疼痛，發汗後常見的末梢疼痛表現。 / Pain in the distal parts of the limbs (hands/feet), a distal aching often seen after excessive sweating.

symptoms.name: 心下悸 / epigastric palpitation
symptoms.description: 心下部或臍下有跳動感或悸動，按壓可緩解，常見於發汗過多後。 / Sensation of palpitations or pounding beneath the epigastrium/umbilicus, sometimes relieved by pressing; often follows excessive sweating.

symptoms.name: 叉手自冒心 / pressing chest with hands/urge to press epigastrium
symptoms.name_en: pressing chest with hands/urge to press epigastrium
symptoms.description: 患者用手叉於胸前欲按壓心下以求舒緩的不適姿勢或衝動。 / The urge or action of clutching the chest/epigastrium with the hands to relieve discomfort.

symptoms.name: 臍下悸 / lower-abdominal palpitation
symptoms.description: 臍下或下腹有跳動感，欲作奔豚的先兆。 / Palpitation or throbbing beneath the umbilicus, a precursor to the 'running piglet' sensation (bentun).

symptoms.name: 奔豚 / running-piglet (bentun) sensation
symptoms.description: 一種劇烈向上衝動的腹下跳動及不安感，古方描述下焦水上衝之象。 / A forceful upward surging movement from the lower abdomen with restlessness, classical sign of lower burner water rushing upward.

symptoms.name: 虛脹 / deficient abdominal distention
symptoms.description: 腹脹但按之喜按、伴有放屁多、為脾胃虛弱與腸氣盛所致。 / Abdominal distention with preference for pressure, excessive flatus, due to spleen-stomach deficiency with trapped intestinal gas.

symptoms.name: 實脹 / excess abdominal distention
symptoms.description: 腹脹拒按，常由實邪如燥屎或食積阻塞所致，按天樞可痛。 / Abdominal distention with resistance to pressure, caused by excess accumulation such as hardened stool or food retention.

symptoms.name: 心下逆滿 / epigastric counterflow fullness
symptoms.description: 心下（上腹）逆滿悶脹不舒，常見於吐下傷胃後水飲停聚。 / A sense of counterflow fullness and oppression in the epigastrium, often seen after vomiting/diarrhea with retained fluids.

symptoms.name: 氣上衝胸 / qi rushing to the chest
symptoms.description: 氣上逆衝及胸，伴胸悶或呼吸受限，常伴頭眩。 / Qi counterflow rising into the chest, causing chest oppression or dyspnea and often accompanied by dizziness.

symptoms.name: 頭眩 / vertigo/dizziness
symptoms.description: 起坐或移動時出現的天旋地轉或頭暈目眩。 / Spinning vertigo or dizziness on standing or movement.

symptoms.name: 脈沉緊 / deep-tense pulse
symptoms.description: 脈沉緊：脈象沉於裏而緊實，常見於「結胸」之熱實、寒實或水結證。脈沉示病在裏（胸膈或下焦深處），脈緊示實邪結滯、扎實難移。常伴心下痛或心下痞硬、按之如石、數日不大便或便祕；熱實者兼舌燥渴、日晡潮熱，水結者則可無大熱而頭微汗或頭汗多。傷寒六七日熱結於裏常見脈沉緊，為大陷胸湯或丸之主證之一。與小結胸相較，小結胸多見脈浮滑、按之則痛；若脈浮大或病人煩躁，為陽脫或真陽將脫之危象，瀉下反致不良，應慎用峻劑。 / Deep‑tense pulse: a pulse that is deep and tight, commonly seen in jie xiong (結胸; chest obstruction/binding) due to heat‑excess, cold‑excess, or retained water. A deep pulse indicates an interior location (deep in the chest/diaphragm or lower jiao); a tense pulse indicates a replete, constrained pathogenic factor. It is often accompanied by pain or hardness under the heart (epigastric/retrosternal), a stone‑hard resistance to pressure, and reduced or absent bowel movements; heat‑excess cases show dry tongue, thirst, and evening tidal fever, while water‑binding cases may lack high fever and show slight or profuse sweating of the head. A deep‑tense pulse commonly appears in shanghan after six to seven days when heat is bound internally and is one of the primary indications for Da Xian Xiong Tang or pill. By contrast, mild (xiao) jie xiong often shows a floating‑slippery pulse and pain only on pressure. If the pulse is floating and large, or the patient is restless/agitated, this suggests yang collapse or impending failure; purgation may be contraindicated and aggressive down‑bearing therapy must be used with extreme caution.

symptoms.name: 身體震顫 / body tremor/shaking
symptoms.description: 全身或局部顫抖，因中膈水飲晃動或津液不足而生。 / Generalized or localized trembling caused by shifting of fluids in the diaphragm region or fluid depletion.

symptoms.name: 胃中乾 / dryness of the stomach
symptoms.description: 胃中津液不足，口渴、胃燥、煩躁等表現。 / Depletion of gastric fluids presenting with thirst, gastric dryness, and irritability.

symptoms.name: 嗳氣放屁 / eructation and flatus
symptoms.description: 頻繁打嗝與排氣，為腹部脹氣排泄之象，多見於虛脹。 / Frequent belching and passage of gas, a sign of venting intestinal gas often seen in deficient abdominal distention.

symptoms.name: 痰多 / copious sputum
symptoms.description: 痰量多，咳吐頻繁，常見於痰飲或肺熱化痰。 / Large amounts of sputum with frequent expectoration, seen in phlegm-fluid retention or lung-heat producing sputum.

symptoms.name: 肺熱 / lung heat
symptoms.description: 肺燥熱或肺部發炎之象，伴咳嗽、黃稠痰、喘促等。 / Heat in the lungs or pulmonary inflammation, accompanying cough, yellow sticky sputum, and wheeze.

symptoms.name: 無大熱 / absence of high fever
symptoms.description: 有發汗或胸悶但未見高熱，臨床提示表虛或肺熱不重。 / Sweating or chest symptoms without high fever, suggesting superficial deficiency or less severe pulmonary heat.

symptoms.name: 津液傷損 / fluid depletion
symptoms.description: 因過度發汗或藥力過強致體液津傷、口渴、體虛等表現。 / Loss of body fluids due to excessive sweating or overly strong dispersing medicines, resulting in thirst and deficiency symptoms.

symptoms.name: 不惡寒但熱 / heat without aversion to cold
symptoms.description: 患者不怕冷而感到身熱，為實熱或陽明內熱之象。 / Patient feels heat without aversion to cold, indicating excess heat or internal Yangming heat.

symptoms.name: 煩渴 / irritability with great thirst
symptoms.description: 煩躁口渴，欲飲大量冷水，常見於陽明大熱與白虎證。 / Restlessness with intense thirst and desire to drink large amounts of cold water, seen in Yangming or Baihu patterns.

symptoms.name: 小便淡白 / pale dilute urine
symptoms.description: 小便淡白清稀，提示虛脹或水飲內停。 / Pale, dilute urination suggesting deficient distention or water retention.

symptoms.name: 小便黃 / dark-yellow urine
symptoms.description: 小便色澤黃濃，提示內實或熱證（實脹候）。 / Dark yellow concentrated urine indicating internal excess or heat (seen in excess abdominal distention).

symptoms.name: 大汗出後欲飲水 / desire to sip water after profuse sweating
symptoms.name_en: desire to sip water after profuse sweating
symptoms.description: 大汗出後胃乾、煩躁而想少量多次進水，以和胃氣為治。 / After profuse sweating, with gastric dryness and agitation, patient desires small sips of water repeatedly to harmonize stomach qi.

symptoms.name: 消渴 / inability to quench thirst (unquenchable thirst)
symptoms.description: 喝再多水仍覺口渴，水不能化為津液，常見於發汗後或水停表面的證候。 / Persistent thirst despite drinking; fluids are not transformed into body fluids, often after sweating or when water is trapped at the body surface.

symptoms.name: 飲水則吐 / vomiting when ingesting water
symptoms.description: 病人飲水即吐，常見於表裏不和或水逆證，表示水不能下受或被上逆。 / Vomiting immediately after drinking water, seen in disharmony of exterior and interior or 'water reversal' patterns, indicating fluids cannot be received or descend.

symptoms.name: 虛煩不得眠 / restless agitation with insomnia (deficiency vexation)
symptoms.description: 發汗吐下或溫病後，津液不足導致的心煩不安、夜間難眠。 / Agitation and inability to sleep due to fluid/ Yin deficiency after sweating, vomiting, or warm-disease convalescence.

symptoms.name: 少氣 / shortness of breath/low energy (shaoqi)
symptoms.description: 氣虛或中焦受阻導致的氣短或乏力感。 / Shortness of breath or low energy due to qi deficiency or obstruction of the middle jiao.

symptoms.name: 四肢無力 / limb weakness (weak limbs)
symptoms.description: 四肢乏力、無力活動，常見於氣虛或虛煩後期。 / Weakness of the limbs, reduced strength for activity, commonly seen with qi deficiency or convalescence after illness.

symptoms.name: 心中懊惱 / chest vexation/inner agitation
symptoms.description: 心中煩悶、不安，常表現為胸悶或惱怒。 / Inner vexation or irritability manifested as chest oppression or mental agitation.

symptoms.name: 臥起不安 / unrest on lying and rising
symptoms.description: 患者在臥或起時感到不安、翻來覆去、難以安寢。 / Restlessness when lying down or rising, with tossing and inability to settle during sleep.

symptoms.name: 結實 / focal binding/impaction
symptoms.description: 腸內局部結塊或結實，導致局部脹滿或通行不暢。 / Localized hardening or binding in the intestines causing focal fullness and impaired passage.

symptoms.name: 腸胃虛寒 / gastrointestinal cold deficiency
symptoms.description: 胃腸陽氣不足，寒凝於中，見腹脹、食少、舌苔薄白、脈微弱等。 / Deficiency cold of the stomach and intestines with reduced digestive warmth, presenting with fullness, poor appetite, thin white coating, and weak pulse.

symptoms.name: 化膿瘡 / suppurated ulcer
symptoms.description: 皮膚或組織已化膿、膿液流出的瘡瘍狀態，不宜發汗。 / A sore or ulcer that has suppurated with pus discharge; sweating is contraindicated.

symptoms.name: 小便濃濁 / turbid urine
symptoms.description: 小便色濁如膏，有可能伴有黏稠或異味，提示下焦濕熱或膿血。 / Urine that is turbid or milky, suggesting lower burner damp-heat or purulent/seminal leakage.

symptoms.name: 血尿 / hematuria
symptoms.description: 小便帶血或出血性小便，為淋家或下焦實熱、結石等病理所致。 / Blood in the urine, seen in strangury, stones, or lower burner heat and injury.

symptoms.name: 面色蒼白 / pale complexion
symptoms.description: 面色蒼白、唇色淡薄，提示血虛或失血後的體虛狀態。 / Pale facial complexion and thin lip color, indicating blood deficiency or post-bleeding depletion.

symptoms.name: 恍惚心亂 / mental confusion and disorientation
symptoms.description: 神志恍惚、心緒紊亂、注意力不集中，常因津液虧損或陽虛而生。 / Mental cloudiness, agitation, and disorientation often due to fluid depletion or yang deficiency.

symptoms.name: 小便短赤 / short red urination
symptoms.description: 小便短少而色赤，提示膀胱下焦有熱或腸胃傳熱於膀胱。 / Scanty, short, and reddish urination indicating heat in the bladder or transmitted heat from the intestines.

symptoms.name: 振振欲擗地 / head-heavy staggering
symptoms.description: 頭重腳輕、欲仆地或搖動不穩的眩暈狀態，多見於浮陽上亢與陰重。 / A sensation of head heaviness and staggering with instability, often from floating yang rising and relatively heavy yin.

symptoms.name: 微煩 / slight vexation
symptoms.description: 輕微的煩躁不安，常見於病後虛熱或虛寒兼見時。 / Mild irritability or vexation often seen after illness when residual deficiency heat or cold remains.

symptoms.name: 汗出不解 / sweating without resolution
symptoms.description: 發汗後汗出仍未解表，病情未能解除，常伴虛熱或水飲內停。 / Persistent sweating after inducing sweat without resolving the exterior, with ongoing symptoms often due to deficiency heat or internal water accumulation.

symptoms.name: 心煩 / heart vexation/mental agitation
symptoms.description: 胸中或心中煩躁不安，表現為心神不寧、焦慮或易怒。 / Mental agitation centered in the chest or heart, presenting as unease, anxiety, or irritability.

symptoms.name: 吐蚘 / vomiting of worms
symptoms.description: 吐蚘：吐出寄生蟲或蟲卵的證候。多見於胃中虛寒或腸胃內容腐敗化生蟲時，患者多有胃脘寒冷、噁心嘔吐、食少或不欲食、脈沉細或虛等表現。病機為胃中寒濕或津液虛少，使蟲卵孵化或蟲體蘇生並隨嘔吐出來；臨床常見於感冒後或誤用發汗、攻下等法，致胃陽受損、津液耗傷、裏寒大盛而生蟲。治療要點以溫中回陽、補益津液、清化腸胃、解毒滅蟲為主，常用乾薑以溫胃、甘草以解毒調中，必要時溫裏救陽（如四逆湯）或和解營衛（如桂枝湯），局部可用殺蟲藥如巴椒（蜀椒）。註：此證與胃中寒冷、胃津不足密切相關，常見於發汗或攻下後虛寒耗傷胃陽之情形。 / Vomiting of worms: a TCM pattern in which parasites or worm ova are expelled by vomiting. It commonly occurs when the stomach is cold or when spoiled intestinal material generates parasites; patients often have gastric coldness, nausea and vomiting, poor appetite or aversion to food, and a sinking or deficient pulse. Pathomechanism: cold and deficient stomach yang with depleted gastric fluids permits eggs to hatch or parasites to become active and be vomited; this often follows colds or mistaken use of diaphoresis or purgation that injures stomach qi and exhausts fluids, producing interior cold. Treatment principles are to warm the middle and restore yang, replenish fluids, clear and detoxify the gut and kill parasites — e.g. dried ginger to warm the stomach, licorice to detoxify and harmonize, warming rescue formulas (Si Ni Tang) or harmonizing formulas (Guizhi Tang) as indicated, and antiparasitic herbs such as Sichuan pepper. Note: this symptom is closely linked to a cold stomach and weakened gastric fluids, especially after sweating or purgation that depletes stomach yang.

symptoms.name: 胃中寒 / coldness in the stomach
symptoms.description: 胃中寒：感覺胃內寒冷、胃脘痞冷或澀痛，伴隨食慾不振、消化吸收差，常見噁心、想吐或嘔吐（有時吐出蟲蚘），大便清稀、食入即下（清穀不止）或脘腹冷痛，手足冰冷，脈沉細或沉遲，舌淡白。病因常為腸胃素體虛寒或外邪處理次序錯誤（先發汗或誤攻下）致津液虧虛、裏寒加重；津液虛寒時為蟲卵孳生提供條件，故常見吐蚘。臨床應與腸熱、陽明實熱（大便臭、熱象）鑑別。治法以溫中回陽、救裏止瀉為主（如四逆湯類溫裡方；遇桂枝湯證改用乾薑以助回陽），並可用甘草解百毒、以辛溫藥溫胃、必要時用巴椒等殺蟲藥；若有胃腸積滯伴輕度不下可用調胃承氣以通十二指腸積滯，但凡辨證重在溫裡回陽、補津止瀉與驅蟲。 / Coldness in the stomach: a sensation of chill or coldness localized to the epigastrium with a cold, distended or constricted feeling; accompanied by poor appetite, reduced digestion and absorption, nausea or retching, sometimes vomiting (including expectoration of worms), loose watery stools or passage of undigested food (continuous clearing of grains), cold abdominal pain, cold hands and feet, and a deep thin or slow pulse with a pale white tongue. Etiology is usually intrinsic spleen–stomach yang deficiency or injury to stomach fluids after incorrect treatment order (e.g., sweating first or mistaken purgation) leading to depleted gastric fluids and increased interior cold; such cold, debilitated gastric conditions permit parasite egg hatching and thus vomiting of worms. Differentiate from intestinal heat/yangming heat (foul stools, febrile signs). Treatment principle is to warm the middle and restore yang, rescue the interior and stop diarrhea (e.g., warming decoctions like SiNiTang type for interior rescue; in GuizhiTang patterns replace fresh ginger with dried ginger to warm), use licorice to detoxify and clear harmful substances in the gut, employ pungent‑warm herbs to warm the stomach, and when indicated use antiparasitic herbs such as Sichuan pepper. If there is mild retained stagnation in the duodenum, a gentle purgative like Tiaowei Chengqi Tang may be used; overall management emphasizes warming the interior, restoring fluids and yang, arresting diarrhea, and addressing parasites when present.

symptoms.name: 血弱氣虛 / blood-deficiency with qi deficiency
symptoms.description: 血量不足、氣力衰弱的狀態，表現為面色蒼白、疲倦、易感冒等虛弱征象。 / State of blood deficiency and qi weakness, presenting with pale complexion, fatigue, and increased susceptibility to illness.

symptoms.name: 脅下痞硬 / hypochondriac/subcostal hardness (xiexia pi ying)
symptoms.description: 脅下或胸脅下方觸及的結節性或堅硬不移的抵抗物，伴胸脅脹滿或疼痛。 / A palpable, often hard focal resistance under the costal margin or hypochondrium, associated with hypochondriac fullness or pain.

symptoms.name: 腹中痛 / abdominal pain (epigastric/central)
symptoms.description: 中腹或胃區疼痛，可因寒滯、氣滯或熱邪而起，常影響食慾與排便。 / Pain in the central abdomen or epigastrium, caused by cold stagnation, qi stagnation, or heat, often affecting appetite and bowel function.

symptoms.name: 默默不欲食 / reduced appetite/silent anorexia
symptoms.description: 食慾不振，面無表情、不願進食，多見於半表半裏的少陽邪結。 / Marked loss of appetite with listlessness or lack of interest in eating, common in Shaoyang patterns with intercostal/lymphatic congestion.

symptoms.name: 心煩喜嘔 / vexation with marked nausea
symptoms.description: 心胸煩悶並伴有欲嘔或嘔吐，有時食物難以下嚥，見於少陽證或胸脅鬱結。 / Mental agitation or chest vexation accompanied by strong nausea or retching, sometimes with impaired swallowing; typical of Shaoyang congestion.

symptoms.name: 振慄 / shivering with tremors
symptoms.description: 身體顫抖、發冷且伴有短促顫栗，常見於表未解或氣血不足時。 / Shivering with tremors and chills, often seen when the exterior is unresolved or with qi-blood deficiency.

symptoms.name: 脈陰陽俱微 / both pulses (yin and yang) faint
symptoms.description: 尺寸兩部脈均微弱不明，表示表證消失而中焦虛弱或氣血不足。 / Both the yin and yang positions (deep and superficial) show faint pulses, indicating disappearance of the exterior pulse with mid-body deficiency or qi-blood insufficiency.

symptoms.name: 營弱衛強 / weak ying, strong wei (ying weak wei strong)
symptoms.name_en: weak ying, strong wei (ying weak wei strong)
symptoms.description: 營血虛而衛氣相對較強，導致汗出但營血不能充足支撐的證候。 / Weak nutritive (ying) blood with relatively stronger defensive (wei) qi, leading to sweating while nutritive blood is insufficient to support function.

symptoms.name: 表裏俱虛 / exterior and interior both deficient
symptoms.description: 表證未能與裏證同時恢復，表裏氣血俱虛，常見於發汗與攻下交錯後的虛弱狀態。 / Both the exterior and interior are deficient concurrently, seen after inappropriate sequence of sweating and purgation leading to generalized qi-blood weakness.

symptoms.name: 煩熱 / vexation with high fever
symptoms.description: 高熱伴煩躁、口渴的症狀，屬陽明熱類型。 / High fever accompanied by irritability and thirst, characteristic of Yangming heat.

symptoms.name: 下重 / prolapse/heaviness after defecation
symptoms.description: 大便後肛門不能收回或脫垂感，常見於攻下過度後。 / Sensation of prolapse or heaviness after defecation, inability of the anus to retract, often following excessive purgation.

symptoms.name: 噦 / hiccup/belching (yue)
symptoms.description: 吞氣或打嗝的反射，代表胃氣失和或胃氣衰竭。 / Hiccup or belching reflex indicating disharmony or failure of stomach qi.

symptoms.name: 手足溫 / warm hands and feet
symptoms.description: 手足溫熱，為陽明熱或裡熱證候之一。 / Warmth of the hands and feet, a sign often seen in Yangming or interior heat patterns.

symptoms.name: 胃陰虛 / stomach-yin deficiency
symptoms.description: 胃津不足，口渴但胃虛，消化不良、心下痞等並見。 / Deficiency of stomach yin with inadequate fluids, presenting with thirst, poor digestion, and epigastric obstruction.

symptoms.name: 面目及身黃 / facial and body jaundice
symptoms.description: 面部及全身呈現黃染，示脾失運化或陽黃膽證之分別。 / Yellow discoloration of face and body, suggesting spleen transport failure or yang (bilious) jaundice depending on quality.

symptoms.name: 噁心 / nausea
symptoms.description: 惡心、想吐的感覺，為胃氣不和或少陽症狀之一。 / Sensation of nausea or inclination to vomit, often due to stomach qi disharmony or a Shaoyang symptom.

symptoms.name: 脈結代 / intermittent-knotted pulse (jie dai)
symptoms.description: 脈象結而代，節律不整，時有停滯，多見於心脾虛或痰火阻絡。 / Pulse that is knotted and intermittent, irregular rhythm with pauses; often seen in heart or spleen deficiency or phlegm-heat obstruction.

symptoms.name: 日晡發潮熱 / tidal fever in late afternoon
symptoms.description: 午後黃昏時段陣發性的潮熱，常見於陽明傳熱或中焦熱積。 / Paroxysmal tidal fever occurring in late afternoon (around 3–5 pm), often seen with Yangming heat or heat accumulation in the middle jiao.

symptoms.name: 舌紅中帶紫 / tongue red with purple center
symptoms.description: 舌體以紅色為主，舌中帶有紫色瘀斑，提示血瘀或瘀血內阻。 / Tongue that is predominantly red with purple discoloration in the center, suggesting blood stasis or internal stasis.

symptoms.name: 舌有齒痕 / teeth-marked tongue
symptoms.description: 舌邊有牙齒壓痕，常見於脾氣虛弱或循環不良。 / Tongue with teeth impressions on the edges, commonly seen with spleen qi deficiency or poor circulation.

symptoms.name: 膈俞痛 / pain at Geshu (Geshu point pain)
symptoms.description: 督脈膈俞穴位（第七胸椎旁一寸半）有壓痛，為瘀血或胸膈相關病變的體表徵象。 / Tenderness at the Geshu (T7, 1.5 cun lateral) point, a surface sign suggesting blood stasis or pathology related to the chest/diaphragm.

symptoms.name: 血海痛 / Xuehai point pain
symptoms.description: 足太陰脾經血海穴（膝上）有壓痛，常與血絡不暢或瘀血有關。 / Tenderness at the Xuehai (SP10) point on the spleen channel, often associated with impaired blood circulation or blood stasis.

symptoms.name: 三陰交痛 / Sanyinjiao point pain
symptoms.description: 三陰交（內踝上）有壓痛，常見於婦科瘀血或少腹病變。 / Tenderness at Sanyinjiao (SP6) above the medial malleolus, commonly seen in gynecological blood stasis or lower abdominal disorders.

symptoms.name: 腹部青紫 / abdominal ecchymoses/blue‑purple patches
symptoms.description: 腹部可見青紫斑塊或瘀斑，提示局部瘀血或出血後色素沉著。 / Blue‑purple patches or ecchymoses on the abdomen, indicating local blood stasis or post‑hemorrhagic discoloration.

symptoms.name: 口渴而不欲飲 / thirst without desire to drink
symptoms.description: 患者口乾但不願或不欲飲水，見於瘀血阻滯或熱極傷津的情況。 / Dry mouth with little desire to drink, seen with blood stasis obstructing circulation or severe heat damaging fluids.

symptoms.name: 咽爛 / throat erosion/ulceration
symptoms.description: 咽部黏膜潰爛、灼痛或糜爛，常見於熱傷津液或劇烈炎症。 / Erosive or ulcerative changes of the pharyngeal mucosa with soreness, often due to heat injuring fluids or severe inflammation.

symptoms.name: 頭汗出 / head-only sweating
symptoms.description: 僅頭部出汗而四肢無汗，為浮陽或津液局部失衡之象。 / Sweating confined to the head while the rest of the body is dry, a sign of floating yang or localized fluid imbalance.

symptoms.name: 捻衣摸床 / picking at clothes and bedding
symptoms.description: 病人反覆捻衣、摸床邊，為神志混亂或津竭近乎抽搐的行為表現。 / Repetitive picking at clothes or bedding, indicating mental confusion or near‑exhaustion of bodily fluids with restless movements.

symptoms.name: 燥屎 / dried hard stools (desiccated feces)
symptoms.description: 燥屎：腸中乾結的糞便，色暗黑或乾硬，堅結難下，多見於陽明燥熱或久積裏熱。其在臨床上常伴有日晡潮熱、譫語及舌苔由黃而黑、乾燥等舌象，並可見腹脹、手足局部汗出，為內熱實結需攻下通腸之證候。 / Zao shi (desiccated feces): desiccated, hard, dark stools lodged in the intestines that are difficult to pass, commonly due to Yangming dryness-heat or prolonged interior heat. Clinically it often produces tidal (evening) fever, delirium, and tongue changes (yellow progressing to black and dry coating), and may be accompanied by abdominal fullness and sweating of the hands and feet — an interior excess obstructive pattern indicating the use of purgative formulas to open the bowels.

symptoms.name: 熱結膀胱 / heat accumulation in bladder
symptoms.description: 膀胱中有熱結、尿短赤或血尿等表現，伴少腹拘急及小便不利。 / Heat accumulation within the bladder manifested by scanty red urine or hematuria, lower abdominal tension, and urinary difficulty.

symptoms.name: 驚煩 / fright‑induced agitation
symptoms.description: 因驚嚇或陽浮所致的煩躁不安、驚惶或類似近狂的表現。 / Agitation and restlessness due to fright or floating yang, presenting as panic‑like or near‑manic behavior.

symptoms.name: 燙傷 / thermal burn injury
symptoms.description: 皮膚被熱力傷及，出現水泡、紅腫或皮膚組織損傷並伴瘙癢疼痛。 / Thermal injury to the skin with blisters, erythema, tissue damage, and associated pain and irritation.

symptoms.name: 便秘 / constipation / constipation
symptoms.description: 大便乾結不通，排便困難，常見於陽明實熱或血虛津傷。 / Dry, difficult bowel movements with inability to pass stool, commonly due to Yangming excess-heat or fluid/blood deficiency.

symptoms.name: 少腹拘急 / lower abdominal acute tension / lower abdominal tenseness/acute lower abdominal tension
symptoms.name_zh: 少腹拘急 / lower abdominal acute tension
symptoms.name_en: lower abdominal tenseness/acute lower abdominal tension
symptoms.description: 小腹中極關元一帶緊繃、刺痛或繃緊，見於膀胱熱結或瘀血阻滯。 / Acute tenseness or rigidity in the lower abdomen (around Zhongji/Guan yuan), seen with bladder heat accumulation or blood stasis obstructing the pelvis.

symptoms.name: 不可轉側 / inability to turn in bed / inability to turn over in bed
symptoms.name_zh: 不可轉側 / inability to turn in bed
symptoms.name_en: inability to turn over in bed
symptoms.description: 病人因全身沉重、痠痛或抽搐而無法自行翻身，見於極度虛弱或全身拘急情況。 / Patient cannot turn over in bed due to heaviness, stiffness, or weakness; seen in severe weakness or generalized rigidity.

symptoms.name: 小便利者可治 / small urine with treatable prognosis / small amount of urine with treatable prognosis
symptoms.name_zh: 小便利者可治 / small urine with treatable prognosis
symptoms.name_en: small amount of urine with treatable prognosis
symptoms.description: 在重症中若仍有小便通利，代表元陽未盡，可望轉機與治療成功。 / In severe cases, presence of some urinary output indicates residual yuan yang and a better prognosis; patient is still treatable.

symptoms.name: 吐血 / hematemesis / vomiting blood
symptoms.description: 自口中吐出血液的症狀。 / Vomiting blood (hematemesis).

symptoms.name: 便血 / hematochezia / blood in stools
symptoms.description: 大便中帶有血液的表現。 / Blood in stools (hematochezia).

symptoms.name: 腰以下重而痺 / lower-body heaviness with numbness
symptoms.description: 腰以下肢體沉重且感覺痺麻，常見於陽上亢、水停下焦之證。 / Heaviness and numbness below the waist, often seen when yang rises and fluids stagnate inferiorly.

symptoms.name: 脈微數 / fine-rapid pulse (thin and rapid)
symptoms.description: 脈微數：脈象既微又數，屬虛熱之象；忌用灸法（含艾灸、溫針）。因火為邪，加灸易致火入裏動煩，追虛逐實，血散脈中、出血及傷津耗液，久則焦骨傷筋，病情反重難復。 / Fine‑rapid pulse: a thin (weak) yet rapid pulse indicating deficient‑heat. Moxibustion (including warming needles) is contraindicated because added fire acts as a pathogenic factor that can be driven inward, producing vexation and internal counteraction, dispersal of blood from the vessels and bleeding, depletion of fluids, and eventual injury to bone and sinews; the heat may worsen and the condition become difficult to reverse.

symptoms.name: 到經不解 / illness not resolving by expected time
symptoms.name_en: illness not resolving by expected time
symptoms.description: 病程在應解的時限內未見好轉或解表的現象。 / Illness fails to resolve within the expected time window for release (e.g., not resolving by sixth/seventh day).

symptoms.name: 盜汗 / night sweating / spontaneous nocturnal sweating
symptoms.description: 夜間無故出汗，屬陰虛或營衛失調之證候。 / Nocturnal spontaneous sweating, often indicating yin deficiency or ying‑wei disharmony.

symptoms.name: 腹中饑，口不能食 / abdominal hunger with inability to eat
symptoms.name_en: abdominal hunger with inability to eat
symptoms.description: 腹中饑，口不能食：常見於吐後一二日，因嘔吐過度將胃中津液耗傷，胃陰（胃津）不足，故有腹中饑而口不能食之矛盾表現。屬虛證，關脈常見細弱或虛數，舌可見乾燥或薄苔。治宜濟養胃津、止嘔以復胃功能，經方多用大半夏湯（半夏止嘔開胃、人參補津等），若吐久（三四日）已及脾陽失運，則證候不同，治則宜溫中補陽如吳茱萸湯等。 / Abdominal hunger with inability to eat: typically follows one to two days of vomiting. Excessive vomiting depletes the stomach fluids (jinye), producing a deficiency pattern in which the patient feels abdominal hunger but cannot actually eat because the stomach lacks fluid and digestive capacity. This is a xu (deficiency) pattern; the guan pulse may be thin/weak or thready-rapid and the tongue may be dry or with a thin coating. Treatment principle is to nourish stomach fluids and stop vomiting to restore gastric function. Classic prescription: Da Banxia Tang (DaBanxiaTang, Great Pinellia Decoction) — Pinellia to stop vomiting and stimulate appetite, ginseng to replenish fluids. If vomiting persists three to four days and injures the spleen as well, the pattern shifts (cold/poor gastric motility, morning intake vomited by evening) and warmer, more tonic formulas such as Wu Zhuyu Tang are indicated.

symptoms.name: 朝食暮吐 / morning-meal vomited by evening
symptoms.description: 早上所食停滯胃中，至傍晚才反吐，乃因胃陽不足、胃虛寒或胃下垂致胃氣不升、蠕動停滯，胃津傷損，病人常喜食冷物以覺舒適。脈象常見左手寸脈微弱或消失，右手關脈大而脹。 / Food eaten in the morning remains undigested and is vomited by evening; this indicates stomach-yang deficiency or stomach-cold and/or gastric ptosis leading to weak gastric motility, impaired stomach fluids, and a clinical preference for cold foods. Pulse signs often show an absent or very weak left cun and a large, tense right guan.

symptoms.name: 胃中虛冷 / stomach deficiency-cold
symptoms.description: 病機：因吐法過度、汗泄或外感誤治，傷及胃的津液與胃陽，致胃氣不升不降、運化乏力，胃中虛冷。臨床表現：欲食而口納乏力，或先有食慾卻難以進食；喜食冷物以為舒適；進食後食物停滯、腹脹，不易消化，常見“朝食暮吐”（早餐食物至傍晚仍未消化即吐出）；可見噁心嘔吐、吐後饑而不能食。舌苔多白而滑，脈多見細弱或虛數。辨證要點：有吐後津傷、胃冷不振、食物久停、偏好冷食及朝食暮吐者屬胃中虛冷。治法：溫中補胃、回陽止嘔，常用方如吳茱萸湯（以溫熱藥物恢復胃陽，必要時可用乾薑代生薑以增溫力）；早期以胃液受傷、嘔吐明顯者可用大半夏湯調和；若因過汗或發汗太過致胃陽虧虛，可酌用甘草乾薑類溫補方。注意禁食甜、冷飲及刺激性食物，並依脈證、舌象與病程選方加減。 / Pattern: Stomach deficiency-cold arises when excessive vomiting, sweating, or improper treatment depletes the stomach's fluids and yang, leaving the stomach cold and failing to warm and transport. Clinical features: appetite or hunger with inability to eat; a preference for cold foods because they feel more comfortable; poor gastric motility with food stagnation and fullness; characteristic morning-meal vomited by evening (chao shi mu tu)—food taken in the morning remains undigested and is vomited by evening; nausea and recurrent vomiting; hunger but inability to ingest. Tongue and pulse: often white slippery coating, pulse thin/weak or deficient-rapid. Key diagnostic points: history of overuse of emesis or other treatments injuring gastric fluids, stomach coldness with impaired transport, food that stays and is later vomited, and craving cold foods. Treatment principle: warm the middle, rescue stomach yang, and stop vomiting. Typical prescriptions include Wu Zhu Yu Tang to strongly warm the stomach and restore yang (use Ganjiang/dry ginger for stronger warming when indicated); Dabanxia Tang for cases dominated by injured gastric fluids with active vomiting; Gan Cao–Ganjiang type formulas when post‑sweating yang depletion produced stomach cold. Avoid sweet, cold, or irritating foods and modify formulas by tongue/pulse and disease course.

symptoms.name: 舌苔滑 / slippery tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌上白苔滑膩，提示內有濕邪或痰飲，往往難治。 / A white, slippery (greasy) tongue coating indicating internal dampness or phlegm-fluid accumulation, often hard to treat.

symptoms.name: 結胸 / chest binding with pain on pressure
symptoms.name_en: chest binding with pain on pressure
symptoms.description: 按之胸中痛，寸脈浮、關脈沉者名結胸，多為中膈痰飲或瘀結所致。 / Painful chest binding elicited on pressure with floating cun pulse and sinking guan pulse, often due to phlegm-fluid or blood stasis in the epigastrium.

symptoms.name: 藏結 / visceral binding (cangjie)
symptoms.description: 類似結胸但飲食如常、時時下利，關脈小細沉緊、舌上白苔滑者，謂藏結，寒濕內結難治。 / A form of internal/visceral binding resembling chest binding but with normal appetite and frequent diarrhea; characterized by a small fine-sinking guan pulse and slippery white coating, reflecting cold-damp congealment.

symptoms.name: 心下溫溫 / epigastric warm sensation
symptoms.description: 心下（胃）感覺溫溫發熱或悶熱，常提示病位入陽明或胃腑有熱。 / A warm or mildly hot sensation in the epigastrium (below the heart), often indicating involvement of the Yangming channel or stomach heat.

symptoms.name: 小便自利 / urination freely/unobstructed urination
symptoms.description: 小便自利表示膀胱氣化通利，常見瘀血移至下焦、膀胱通利之候。 / Freely passing urine indicating bladder qi transformation is unobstructed; used to distinguish location of blood stasis or obstruction in the lower burner.

symptoms.name: 發狂 / mania/violent delirium
symptoms.description: 患者精神失常、狂妄不安，常為熱入下焦或瘀血熏蒸所致。 / Severe mental disturbance or mania, often due to heat in the lower burner or blood stasis disturbing the mind.

symptoms.name: 少腹硬 / lower abdominal hardness
symptoms.description: 少腹觸之堅硬、壓痛甚或滿實，常提示下焦瘀血或結聚。 / Hardness and marked distension of the lower abdomen on palpation, suggesting lower‑burner blood stasis or masses.

symptoms.name: 反靜 / relative quietness (reduced restlessness)
symptoms.description: 病人反而安靜、無煩躁徵象，常為裏寒或陽虛之表現。 / Patient appears unusually calm without agitation, often indicating interior cold or yang deficiency.

symptoms.name: 不往來寒熱 / no alternating chills and fever
symptoms.description: 缺乏往來寒熱現象，提示非少陽證或為臟結之特徵。 / Absence of alternating chills and fever, suggesting not a shaoyang pattern and characteristic of visceral binding.

symptoms.name: 脈浮大 / floating‑large pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象浮而洪大，代表表陽亢盛或陽氣欲脫，為下攻禁忌之一。 / A floating and large/flooding pulse indicating exuberant exterior yang or imminent yang collapse; a contraindication to aggressive purgation.

symptoms.name: 脈浮滑 / floating‑slippery pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象浮而滑，多見於表證兼有痰飲或痰濕內蘊，常見於小結胸證。 / A floating and slippery pulse often seen with exterior signs together with phlegm‑fluid accumulation, commonly found in small Xian Xiong pattern.

symptoms.name: 心下按之石硬 / epigastric stone‑hard on pressure
symptoms.description: 心下按之如石，按之拒按或劇痛，為結胸熱實或水結之重要體徵。 / Palpable stone‑hard resistance under the epigastrium that is markedly painful and resistant to pressure, a key sign of heat‑ or water‑phlegm consolidation (Xian Xiong).

symptoms.name: 按之則痛 / pain elicited on pressure
symptoms.description: 按壓病灶時出現疼痛，提示局部有痰熱或氣滯實證（小結胸等）。 / Pain provoked by pressure on the lesion, suggesting local phlegm‑heat or qi stagnation/solid pattern (e.g., small Xian Xiong).

symptoms.name: 頭微汗出 / slight head sweating
symptoms.description: 僅頭部有微汗，體表其餘處無汗，常見於誤下傷津後之水結胸證。 / Only slight sweating on the head while the rest of the body is dry, often seen when fluid depletion follows misapplied purging leading to water‑consolidation in the chest.

symptoms.name: 舌燥而渴 / tongue dry and thirst
symptoms.description: 舌質乾燥且口渴，提示津液受傷或內熱耗液，常見於熱實結胸。 / Dry tongue with thirst, indicating fluid injury or internal heat consuming body fluids, commonly present in heat‑excess Xian Xiong.

symptoms.name: 不大便數日 / no bowel movements for several days
symptoms.name_en: no bowel movements for several days
symptoms.description: 數日不大便，舌乾、腹滿或心下堅痛，提示裏結實熱或水痰梗阻。 / Absence of bowel movements for several days with dry tongue or abdominal/epigastric hardness, indicating internal binding of heat or phlegm‑fluid obstruction.

symptoms.name: 噁心欲吐（胸中噁心） / epigastric nausea (nausea with chest phlegm)
symptoms.description: 心下或胸中感到強烈噁心，常吐出痰而非咳痰，為小結胸之常見症狀。 / Marked nausea centered in the epigastrium/chest, often with expectoration of phlegm rather than productive cough, commonly seen in small Xian Xiong.

symptoms.name: 頭汗出而餘處無汗 / head sweating only with rest of body dry
symptoms.name_en: head sweating only with rest of body dry
symptoms.description: 頭部出汗，而身體其餘部位無汗，提示津液耗損且陽氣上浮，見於誤下後的水結或津液不足。 / Sweating limited to the head while the rest of the body is dry, suggesting fluid depletion and yang floating upward; seen after misapplied purgation with water‑consolidation or fluid loss.

symptoms.name: 客氣動膈 / obstructing qi moving the diaphragm
symptoms.description: 外邪入內、痰水停於胸膈，引起胸膈阻塞、膈內拒痛與呼吸短促之表現。 / Foreign pathogen entering inward with phlegm‑fluid stagnation in the chest/diaphragm causing obstruction, resistance pain in the diaphragm and respiratory shortness.

symptoms.name: 胸滿心下堅硬 / chest fullness with epigastric hardness
symptoms.description: 從心下至少腹呈堅實脹滿，按之拒按或劇痛，提示水痰熱累積或大結胸證。 / Firm fullness from the epigastrium to the lower abdomen with resistance on pressure, indicating accumulation of phlegm‑fluid and heat or large Xian Xiong consolidation.

symptoms.name: 痰壅咽喉（咽喉痰潮） / phlegm accumulation in throat (throat phlegm congestion)
symptoms.name_en: phlegm accumulation in throat (throat phlegm congestion)
symptoms.description: 咽喉有痰潮上湧，吞咽困難或痰多，常見於胸中痰飲壅塞者。 / Phlegm surging in the throat with difficulty swallowing or copious sputum, commonly seen with phlegm‑fluid obstruction in the chest.

symptoms.name: 脈沉滑 / deep-slippery pulse
symptoms.description: 沉脈代表病在裏，滑脈多見於痰飲或血熱，臨床提示裏有水飲或血熱並行。 / Deep pulse indicates interior disease; a slippery quality often suggests phlegm-fluid accumulation or blood-heat, implying interior water or heat involvement.

symptoms.name: 脈數滑 / rapid-slippery pulse
symptoms.description: 脈數兼滑常見於血熱壯盛或津液耗傷導致血行亢進，臨床可見出血傾向。 / A rapid and slippery pulse commonly occurs with exuberant blood-heat or fluid depletion leading to accelerated blood flow and may signal a tendency to bleeding.

symptoms.name: 肉上粟起 / piloerection/goosebumps
symptoms.description: 皮膚出現雞皮疙瘩，常見於表邪束表或驟冷後皮表收縮、水氣不通。 / Piloerection (goosebumps) on the skin, often seen when exterior pathogenic factors constrict the surface or after sudden cold exposure with impaired water movement.

symptoms.name: 意欲飲水反不渴 / desire to drink but not thirsty
symptoms.name_en: desire to drink but not thirsty
symptoms.description: 病人想喝水卻無真實口渴感，常見於熱在胸肺而胃無燥熱的水飲證。 / A subjective urge to drink without true thirst, often occurring when heat is in the chest/lungs while the stomach is not dry—typical of water-accumulation in the chest.

symptoms.name: 寒實結胸 / cold-solid chest binding
symptoms.description: 胸中因寒飲或積滯凝結為實，表現為胸悶、昏迷或大便不暢，舌苔白滑。 / Cold-solid binding in the chest from cold-fluid or retained material forming a hard obstruction, presenting with chest fullness, stupor or bowel stagnation and a white slippery tongue.

symptoms.name: 手足冷 / cold hands and feet
symptoms.description: 手足溫度下降，四肢冰冷，常見於裏寒或陽氣不足。 / Coolness of the hands and feet, often seen with interior cold or deficiency of yang qi.

symptoms.name: 大便鞭 / hard rope-like stools
symptoms.description: 大便乾硬呈長條狀或一條，提示腸道蠕動遲滯，多因裏寒或津液不足。 / Stools that are hard and rope-like, indicating reduced intestinal motility often due to interior cold or fluid deficiency.

symptoms.name: 心下痛 / epigastric pain (below the heart)
symptoms.description: 膈下或心下部位疼痛，可由裏寒、結胸或胃腸積滯引起。 / Pain beneath the heart (epigastric), which can result from interior cold, chest binding, or gastrointestinal stagnation.

symptoms.name: 舌苔白滑 / white slippery tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌苔呈白且滑膩，常見於寒實痰飲或臟結證候。 / Tongue coating that is white and slippery, often seen in cold-solid phlegm-fluid accumulation or visceral binding patterns.

symptoms.name: 心下痞硬 / epigastric hardness with obstruction
symptoms.description: 心下痞硬指心下或膈下（上腹）感到結實、脹滿或局部硬塊，常伴噁心、嘔吐、吞酸、食欲不振、腹中雷鳴或下利。臨床上須分辨「痞」與「結胸」：若心下滿而不痛，多為痞，為氣滯、水飲或食滯臟腑之症，按之可濡、可移，往往屬寒熱夾結、腸胃津液失和；若心下硬且作痛、堅梆伴大便不通，乃為結胸（實邪蓄於胸膈），或因裏實熱結或積聚成塊（疝瘕、積聚、腫塊如胃癌、胰臟病變）。常見病機包括表證被誤下攻致邪入裏、少陽或陽明錯雜、津液下陷成水飲、痰濕食滯、或胃中虛客氣上結。伴隨證候可見舌苔（黃代表有熱、乾燥更甚示實熱）、脈象（初為浮緊轉為關上浮或關上虛滑）、按之自濡提示氣痞非固塊；口渴、小便不利提示水飲需利水。辨證要點：痞不痛宜調和脾胃（半夏瀉心湯及其生薑、甘草變方）；痞兼下利或水多者先利水（五苓散、十棗湯）；痞兼上焦實熱或脈關上浮者以攻實清熱（大黃黃連瀉心湯）；心下硬痛或真實痞塊者以攻堅破結（大陷胸湯/丸、芒硝、硝石等並配補中藥以固攝津液）。臨床若疑有腫塊或持久不解，並應警覺器質性病變並作進一步檢查。 / Epigastric hardness with obstruction refers to a sensation of firmness, fullness or a focal hard mass beneath the heart/under the diaphragm (upper abdomen), often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, acid belching, poor appetite, borborygmi or diarrhea. Clinically one must distinguish pi (stagnation/obstruction) from jiexiong (consolidated chest masses): pi is fullness without sharp pain, due to qi stagnation, water accumulation, phlegm-damp or food retention — the area may feel soft or moist on pressure and is often a cold–heat mixed disorder with disrupted gastric fluids; jiexiong is hard, painful and tense with constipation, representing an actual accumulating obstruction or solid mass (e.g., conglomeration, tumor). Common mechanisms include exterior disease improperly driven downward into the interior, Shaoyang or Yangming disharmony, fluid sinking forming water-damp, phlegm-damp and retained food, or vacuity allowing rebellious guest qi to bind. Accompanying signs: tongue coating (yellow → heat; very dry → strong interior heat), pulse changes (e.g., floating-tense then signs of upper-burner heat), and “soft on pressure” (anzhi zuru) indicating qi-pi rather than fixed mass; thirst with scanty urination suggests water retention requiring diuresis. Treatment principles and formula hints: non‑painful pi — harmonize middle and drain water/resolve damp (Banxia Xiexin Tang and its Shengjiang or Gancao variants); pi with prominent diarrhea or heavy water — first resolve water (Wuling San, Shizao/“Ten Jujube” type purgatives); pi with upper‑burner heat or floating guan pulse — clear and purge (Dahuang Huanglian Xiexin Tang); hard painful masses or true accumulations — attack and break up the mass (Daxianxiong Tang/wan, mangxiao/nitre with supportive herbs to protect fluids). If a persistent structural mass is suspected, consider possible tumorous causes and pursue further investigation.

symptoms.name: 胸脅下滿 / hypochondriac and lower chest fullness
symptoms.description: 胸脇及下胸部脹滿不舒，常見於血熱或水飲阻滯三焦所致。 / Fullness in the hypochondriac and lower chest area, often due to blood-heat or water accumulation obstructing the sanjiao.

symptoms.name: 乾噫食臭 / dry belching with foul odor
symptoms.description: 胃中宿食腐敗，噯氣乾惡且有臭味，常見於腸胃停滯與下利之後。 / Belching with dry eructation and foul odor due to retained, decomposing food in the stomach, often after intestinal stasis or diarrhea.
