symptoms.name: 按之濡 / softened on pressure
symptoms.description: 腹部按之呈軟而濡的觸感，提示內有水飲或氣痞未散。 / Abdomen becomes soft and moist on pressure, indicating internal water accumulation or unresolved qi pi.

symptoms.name: 汗出不惡寒 / sweating without aversion to cold
symptoms.description: 身體有汗出但病人不覺怕冷，示表解而裏未和或陽虛陽鬱不固。 / Sweating occurs without aversion to cold, suggesting exterior resolved but interior not harmonized, or unstable yang.

symptoms.name: 腹中雷鳴 / borborygmus with loud intestinal noise
symptoms.description: 腹內有水氣或宿食，腸鳴如雷，常伴下利與胃腸蠕動異常。 / Loud rumbling noises in the abdomen from water or retained food, commonly associated with diarrhea and abnormal GI motility.

symptoms.name: 脅下有水氣 / hypochondriac water accumulation
symptoms.description: 脅下隱脹或有水感，提示三焦或胸膈間水飲停聚。 / Sensation of water accumulation or distention under the hypochondrium, indicating sanjiao or mediastinal fluid retention.

symptoms.name: 穀不化 / undigested food in stools
symptoms.description: 進食後所食即下，消化不良，便中見未化穀類或呈水樣。 / Food passes undigested shortly after ingestion, indicating digestion failure; stools may contain undigested grains or be watery.

symptoms.name: 嘔即短氣 / retching with shortness of breath
symptoms.description: 噁心欲吐而吐不出，伴呼吸短促，常因胸膈水飲上頂導致呼吸受限。 / Severe nausea/retching without productive vomiting accompanied by dyspnea, often from mediastinal or diaphragmatic fluid restricting respiratory excursion.

symptoms.name: 引脅下痛 / radiating hypochondriac pain
symptoms.description: 疼痛由胸下或心下牽引至脅下，常伴隨水飲或氣滯壓迫感。 / Pain that extends from the epigastrium or chest down to the hypochondrium, often associated with fluid accumulation or qi stagnation.

symptoms.name: 經脈動惕 / meridian twitching
symptoms.description: 經脈震動、惕動，常因血虧不足以養筋而見。 / Twitching or trembling of the meridians, often seen when blood is insufficient to nourish the tendons.

symptoms.name: 痿 / wei (wasting/paralysis)
symptoms.description: 久病或損傷後出現的肌肉無力、萎縮或麻痺。 / Wasting or paralysis with muscle weakness and atrophy occurring after prolonged illness or injury.

symptoms.name: 胸中痞硬 / chest obstruction with hardness
symptoms.description: 胸中痞滿堅硬，按之不濡，常伴氣上衝咽喉或嘔吐。 / Chest fullness with firm hardness, not softened on pressure, often accompanied by upward qi to the throat or retching.

symptoms.name: 表裏俱熱 / simultaneous exterior and interior heat
symptoms.description: 表證未解而裏又熱，患者同時有外感和內熱表現。 / Concurrent signs of exterior disease and interior heat, with both surface and internal manifestations of heat.

symptoms.name: 時汗 / intermittent sweating
symptoms.description: 時有汗出，非持續性之汗出，常見於表裏夾熱或表未解之情形。 / Episodes of sweating that are intermittent rather than persistent, seen with mixed exterior‑interior conditions.

symptoms.name: 氣上衝咽喉 / qi rushing to the throat
symptoms.description: 胃氣或痰飲上逆衝及咽喉，感到有氣流冒上喉中。 / Upward rushing of stomach qi or phlegm‑fluid into the throat, felt as a flow of qi reaching the pharynx.

symptoms.name: 背微惡寒 / slight aversion to cold at the back
symptoms.name_en: slight aversion to cold at the back
symptoms.description: 背部感到微微怕冷，常伴有體表津液不足的表現。 / Slight chilliness felt in the back, often accompanying surface fluid depletion.

symptoms.name: 渴欲飲水 / strong desire to drink water
symptoms.description: 嗜飲水並有明顯想飲的衝動，多見於津液不足或熱傷津的證候。 / A marked urge to drink water, seen in patterns of fluid depletion or heat injuring fluids.

symptoms.name: 口燥渴 / dry mouth with thirst
symptoms.description: 口腔乾燥且口渴，常提示津液不足或胃熱上熾。 / Dry mouth accompanied by thirst, suggesting fluid depletion or stomach heat rising.

symptoms.name: 小腹痛 / lower abdominal pain
symptoms.description: 下腹部疼痛，痛勢可為絞痛或持續性脹痛，見於腸炎或下利伴腹痛者。 / Pain in the lower abdomen, which may be colicky or persistent, seen in enteritis or diarrheal patterns with abdominal pain.

symptoms.name: 胸中有熱 / heat in the chest
symptoms.description: 胸膈感到內熱、灼熱或悶熱，多見上焦實熱所致。 / Sensation of heat or burning in the chest, often due to excess heat in the upper burner.

symptoms.name: 胃下有邪氣 / pathogenic factor below the stomach
symptoms.description: 胃下部有邪熱或痰濁郁積，致噁心嘔吐或胸悶。 / Pathogenic factor (heat or turbid phlegm) below the stomach, causing nausea, vomiting, or chest fullness.

symptoms.name: 掣痛 / severe pulling/cramping joint pain
symptoms.description: 關節或肌肉出現牽扯性劇痛，常為風濕搏迫或痛風類表現。 / Severe pulling or cramping pain of joints/muscles, often from wind-damp invasion or gout-like presentations.

symptoms.name: 不得屈伸 / inability to flex or extend
symptoms.description: 關節無法屈曲或伸直，活動受限且伴疼痛。 / Inability to flex or extend a joint, limited range of motion with pain.

symptoms.name: 身微腫 / slight bodily swelling
symptoms.description: 身體呈現輕微浮腫或腫脹，常見於濕滯或氣血運行不利。 / Mild generalized or localized swelling, commonly due to damp stagnation or impaired qi/blood movement.

symptoms.name: 上熱下寒 / upper heat with lower cold
symptoms.description: 上焦有熱而下焦寒冷的冷熱錯雜現象，常見於熱上寒下的證候。 / Heat in the upper burner with coldness in the lower burner, a mixed pattern of heat above and cold below.

symptoms.name: 身體煩疼 / body aches and vexation
symptoms.description: 全身疼痛且伴有煩躁不安，多見於風濕相搏的傷寒後期。 / Generalized body aches with vexation/restlessness, common in wind-damp invasions during later stages of cold damage.

symptoms.name: 無表證 / absence of exterior signs
symptoms.description: 無明顯表證，體表無惡寒發熱或汗出等外感表現。 / No obvious exterior signs; no typical superficial manifestations like aversion to cold, fever, or sweating.

symptoms.name: 不嘔 / absence of vomiting
symptoms.description: 沒有嘔吐的現象，常用以區別病位未及少陽或胃經。 / No vomiting present; used to help distinguish patterns not involving the Shaoyang or stomach channels.

symptoms.name: 表證壯盛 / strong exterior signs
symptoms.description: 表邪明顯，惡寒發熱、汗多或脈浮等外感證候顯著。 / Pronounced exterior signs such as marked aversion to cold/fever, profuse sweating, or a floating pulse.

symptoms.name: 日晡 / dusk/late afternoon
symptoms.description: 指申時到戌時的黃昏時段，中醫用以描述陽明經發病之時機。 / The late afternoon/dusk period (shen to xu hours), traditionally associated with the Yangming channel activity.

symptoms.name: 舌苔黃燥 / yellow-dry tongue coating
symptoms.description: 舌苔伸出來又黃又乾燥，為陽明熱實及燥象的舌象。 / Tongue coating that is yellow and dry, a tongue sign of Yangming heat and internal dryness.

symptoms.name: 中脘痛而拒按 / mid-epigastric pain with guarding on pressure
symptoms.name_en: mid-epigastric pain with guarding on pressure
symptoms.description: 中脘部疼痛且按之則拒按，常由大便實結阻滯所致。 / Pain at the midepigastrium with refusal or guarding on pressure, often due to fecal impaction causing obstruction.

symptoms.name: 右腿弓起方可入眠 / right leg flexed to sleep
symptoms.description: 入睡時須將右腿屈起方能入眠，與盲腸或闌尾區阻塞之牽扯有關。 / Patient must flex the right leg to fall asleep, associated with irritation or obstruction in the cecal/appendiceal region.

symptoms.name: 脾約 / constrained spleen
symptoms.description: 脾因過度發汗或津液耗損而運化受約，導致胃腸蠕動減弱。 / Spleen function constrained due to excessive sweating or fluid depletion, leading to weakened gastrointestinal motility.

symptoms.name: 微汗出 / slight generalized sweating
symptoms.description: 全身微微出汗，汗不旺但為陽明證或裏實熱初發之徵候。 / Slight, generalized sweating that is not profuse; may indicate early Yangming heat or interior excess beginning to manifest.

symptoms.name: 手足汗出 / localized sweating of hands and feet
symptoms.name_en: localized sweating of hands and feet
symptoms.description: 僅手足局部出汗，常見於胃氣虛所致的局部出汗證候。 / Sweating localized to the hands and feet, often seen with stomach qi deficiency causing peripheral sweating.

symptoms.name: 不能食 / inability to eat
symptoms.description: 完全或顯著不能進食，提示胃不蠕動或胃虛寒。 / Complete or marked inability to ingest food, indicating impaired gastric motility or stomach deficiency-cold.

symptoms.name: 欲食 / desire to eat
symptoms.description: 表現出想進食的欲望，提示脾胃運化功能尚存或恢復中。 / A desire to eat, suggesting preserved or recovering spleen-stomach digestive function.

symptoms.name: 食難用飽 / unable to eat to fullness
symptoms.description: 吃少量即感飽脹，屬胃氣不足或脾虛不能受納之象。 / Feeling full after small amounts of food, reflecting stomach qi deficiency or spleen inability to receive and transform.

symptoms.name: 皮下蟲行感 / formication under the skin
symptoms.description: 皮表下有蟲行樣瘙癢或蠕動感，多因久虛導致津液不布所致。 / A crawling or tingling sensation beneath the skin (formication), often due to long-standing deficiency and poor fluid distribution.

symptoms.name: 大便自調 / normal bowel movements
symptoms.description: 大便通暢、排便規律，表示腸胃運化恢復或尚未受損。 / Regular, well-formed bowel movements indicating recovered or intact intestinal function.

symptoms.name: 濈然微汗出 / sudden slight sweating
symptoms.description: 突然出現的微汗，為陽明裏實熱衝出之汗，多為全身性。 / A sudden appearance of slight sweating, often systemic, indicating interior Yangming excess heat releasing outward.

symptoms.name: 手足濈濈然汗出 / clammy sweating of hands and feet
symptoms.name_en: clammy sweating of hands and feet
symptoms.description: 手足濈然而汗出：四肢局部微濕、汗薄而不爽，常見於陽明病胃腸津液先耗或胃寒轉向裡實、胃津將竭之早期；若伴潮熱、不惡寒、腹脹且大便已硬，為裏實燥屎證，屬可攻下者（大承氣湯證）。 / Clammy sweating of the hands and feet: mild, cool, thin sweating localized to the limbs, seen in early depletion of stomach/intestinal jinye (body fluids) or progression toward Yangming dryness-heat (or stomach-cold turning interior). If accompanied by tidal fever, no aversion to cold, abdominal fullness and hardened stools, it indicates interior excess with desiccated stools and is a purgation pattern (Da Cheng Qi Tang).

symptoms.name: 不咳 / absence of coughing
symptoms.description: 指病人沒有咳嗽的表現，作為辨證的陰性指標。 / Absence of cough, used as a negative diagnostic sign in pattern differentiation.

symptoms.name: 能食 / able to eat
symptoms.description: 能正常進食，提示胃腸蠕動未受抑制。 / Ability to eat normally, indicating preserved gastrointestinal motility.

symptoms.name: 欲漱不欲嚥 / desire to rinse but not swallow
symptoms.name_en: desire to rinse but not swallow
symptoms.description: 想漱口但不願咽下，為陽明經熱的典型表現。 / Desire to rinse the mouth but not to swallow, a typical sign of Yangming channel (qi/blood) heat.

symptoms.name: 額上微汗出 / slight forehead sweating
symptoms.description: 額頭出現微汗，提示頭部仍有少量津液可散失。 / Slight sweating on the forehead, indicating some remaining fluids at the head that can evaporate.

symptoms.name: 面含赤色 / facially tinged red
symptoms.description: 面帶輕微紅色（非全身潮熱），為不可輕攻下的面色變化之一。 / Face with a slight red tinge (not generalized tidal fever), a complexion change suggesting caution against aggressive purgation.

symptoms.name: 不惡寒 / absence of aversion to cold
symptoms.description: 病人不怕冷，常見於陽明病，提示病位在裏而非在太陽或少陽。 / No aversion to cold; seen in Yangming pattern, indicating the pathogen is interior rather than Taiyang or Shaoyang.

symptoms.name: 嘔多 / frequent vomiting
symptoms.description: 頻繁嘔吐或噁心嘔酸，提示病邪在少陽或胃氣受損。 / Repeated vomiting or frequent nausea/vomiting of sour material, suggesting Shaoyang involvement or gastric injury.

symptoms.name: 脈遲 / slow pulse
symptoms.description: 脈搏遲緩，常見於病邪深入內裡、胃腸寒冷或裡實。 / Pulse that is slow/retarded, often indicates an interiorly lodged pathogen, cold in the GI tract, or interior excess.

symptoms.name: 脈滑 / slippery pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象滑數或如珠走者，多見於痰飲宿食或臟腑結滯。 / A slippery pulse (rolling like beads), commonly seen with phlegm-fluid, retained food, or visceral obstruction.

symptoms.name: 脈短 / short pulse
symptoms.description: 脈短促或呼吸與脈搏不同步，常見於津液耗傷或將脫陽氣的危象。 / An abbreviated/short pulse, often associated with severe fluid loss or imminent collapse of yang qi.

symptoms.name: 鄭聲 / repetitive heavy speech (Zhengsheng)
symptoms.description: 語言反覆重複、聲重不清，多為陽明虛證時見。 / Repetitive, heavy or rambling speech, often seen in Yangming deficiency presentations.

symptoms.name: 轉矢氣 / induction of flatus after ingestion
symptoms.description: 服方後腹中產生氣機轉動並放屁，為小承氣/承氣類方對證之動態試驗。 / Generation of flatus after taking the decoction, indicating the formula has reached and mobilized intestinal stagnation; used as a diagnostic test for Chengqi formulas.

symptoms.name: 得下 / successful bowel evacuation
symptoms.description: 用藥後排便通利，代表攻下療效已達成，應停止再服。 / Successful bowel movement after purgation therapy; indicates effect achieved and further dosing should be stopped.

symptoms.name: 潮熱 / tidal fever
symptoms.description: 間歇性潮熱、身體感覺熱潮上湧，常伴汗出或發熱反覆。 / Intermittent surges of heat (tidal fever), often with transient sweating or recurrent feverish sensations.

symptoms.name: 喘滿 / dyspnea with fullness
symptoms.description: 呼吸短促，胸部或胸腹有脹滿感，似氣上逆而不能舒展。 / Shortness of breath accompanied by a sensation of chest or abdominal fullness, as if qi is constrained and cannot descend.

symptoms.name: 口不仁 / loss of taste / numbness of mouth
symptoms.name_en: loss of taste / numbness of mouth
symptoms.description: 口中味覺減退或遲鈍，吃東西覺得無味或麻木感。 / Blunted or diminished taste sensation; food tastes bland or the mouth feels numb.

symptoms.name: 舌上胎 / tongue coating (adherent plaque)
symptoms.description: 舌面有異常黏著的苔或膜狀物，伴中焦火盛或痰熱上擾。 / An adherent or membranous coating on the tongue surface, often seen with middle jiao heat or phlegm-heat upward disturbance.

symptoms.name: 面垢 / dirty facial complexion
symptoms.description: 面色顯得髒污暗沉，似久病不潔，常伴口不仁或體內濕熱。 / A dirty, grimy facial complexion appearing darkened or unclean, often accompanying loss of taste or internal damp-heat.

symptoms.name: 表虛裏實 / exterior deficiency with interior excess
symptoms.description: 外表證象虛弱而內裏實熱、實邪壅滯，常見汗出同時腹內結實。 / Exterior signs are deficient while the interior is in excess (heat or accumulation), presenting as sweating with interior fecal impaction or blockage.

symptoms.name: 額上出汗 / forehead sweating
symptoms.description: 主要發汗出現在額頭部位，常見於攻下後或汗出位置異常時。 / Sweating primarily localized to the forehead, often occurring after purgation or when sweating patterns are abnormal.

symptoms.name: 口乾 / dry mouth / kougan
symptoms.description: 口腔乾燥，津液不足的表現。 / Dryness of the mouth indicating depletion of body fluids (xerostomia).

symptoms.name: 鼻燥 / nasal dryness / bizao
symptoms.description: 鼻腔乾燥，常見於上焦熱或津液傷損。 / Dryness of the nasal passages, often seen with upper‑burning heat or fluid depletion.

symptoms.name: 外有熱 / exterior heat / wai you re
symptoms.description: 表證表現為外部有發熱或畏熱感。 / Presence of heat signs on the body's exterior (manifest exterior heat).

symptoms.name: 耳前後腫 / pre/post‑auricular swelling / er qian hou zhong
symptoms.name_en: pre/post‑auricular swelling / er qian hou zhong
symptoms.description: 耳前及耳後區域腫脹，提示淋巴或腮腺腫大。 / Swelling in front of and behind the ear, suggesting lymphadenopathy or parotid gland swelling.

symptoms.name: 剌之稍瘥 / slight relief after pricking / la zhi shao huai
symptoms.name_en: slight relief after pricking / la zhi shao huai
symptoms.description: 經刺血（放血）後病勢或局部腫痛稍為緩解。 / Minor alleviation of symptoms or local pain after pricking/bleeding.

symptoms.name: 善忘 / forgetfulness / shanwang
symptoms.description: 記憶力減退，近期記憶尤為明顯缺失。 / Impaired memory, especially recent memory loss (forgetfulness).

symptoms.name: 大便黑 / black stools / dark tarry stools
symptoms.description: 大便呈黑色或柏油樣，常提示上消化道出血或瘀血內蓄。 / Stools that are black or tarry in appearance, often indicating blood in the gastrointestinal tract or internal blood stasis.

symptoms.name: 不大便而嘔 / no bowel movements with vomiting / bubaobian eryou
symptoms.name_en: no bowel movements with vomiting / bubaobian eryou
symptoms.description: 不能排便並伴隨嘔吐的症狀，提示氣機阻塞或實熱內壅。 / Inability to defecate accompanied by vomiting, suggesting obstructed qi movement or internal accumulation of heat/food.

symptoms.name: 舌上白苔 / white tongue coating / she shang bai tai
symptoms.name_en: white tongue coating / she shang bai tai
symptoms.description: 舌面覆有白色苔質，常見於寒濕或表裡不和。 / White coating on the tongue, commonly seen with cold‑damp or certain exterior–interior patterns.

symptoms.name: 脈續弦 / continued wiry pulse / mai xu xian
symptoms.name_en: continued wiry pulse / mai xu xian
symptoms.description: 脈象持續弦澀，表示少陽氣機不解或續變之脈象。 / A persistent wiry pulse suggesting unresolved Shaoyang pattern or ongoing pathogenic constraint.

symptoms.name: 繞臍痛 / periumbilical pain
symptoms.description: 繞臍周圍陣發性疼痛，常見於腸內有燥屎阻塞時。 / Paroxysmal pain around the umbilicus, often seen when dry fecal impaction obstructs the intestines.

symptoms.name: 食穀欲嘔 / nausea provoked by eating
symptoms.description: 進食後即感噁心欲吐，食入即惡心或嘔吐。 / Nausea or urge to vomit triggered specifically by eating; ingestion provokes retching or vomiting.

symptoms.name: 大便乍難乍易 / alternating difficult and easy defecation
symptoms.description: 大便有時難以排出有時又易通，呈間歇性通秘狀態。 / Defecation alternates between difficulty and ease, representing intermittent obstructive constipation.

symptoms.name: 喘冒不得臥 / dyspnea preventing recumbency
symptoms.description: 呼吸急促或喘息至不能平臥，需要坐起或半坐位；常見於大腸病變影響肺的表裏關係。 / Breathlessness severe enough to prevent lying flat, often requiring upright posture; may occur when lower intestinal pathology affects the lung-interior/exterior relationship.

symptoms.name: 脈芤 / hollow pulse (kao)
symptoms.description: 按之中空如被掏空的脈象，常見於大出血或血虛之證。 / A pulse that feels hollow or empty in the center, commonly seen after major blood loss or with blood deficiency.

symptoms.name: 胃下垂 / gastric ptosis (stomach prolapse)
symptoms.description: 胃功能低下下垂，常伴倦怠、消化不良與進食即嘔等症狀。 / Prolapse or sagging of the stomach with impaired function, commonly accompanied by fatigue, dyspepsia, and postprandial nausea.

symptoms.name: 嘔酸 / acid regurgitation
symptoms.description: 吞吐時有酸水或酸味上逆，常見於肝胃不和或胃酸逆滯。 / Regurgitation or vomiting of sour fluid or a sour sensation, commonly from liver‑stomach disharmony or acidic reflux.

symptoms.name: 燥矢 / desiccated fecal impaction
symptoms.description: 乾燥堅硬的大便滯留於腸中，阻塞腸道通利。 / Dry, hardened fecal matter retained in the intestines, causing obstipation and obstruction.

symptoms.name: 腹微滿 / slight abdominal fullness
symptoms.description: 腹部輕微脹滿感，常見於腸內燥屎或裏實未清時。 / Mild sensation of abdominal bloating, often present with dry fecal impaction or unresolved interior excess.

symptoms.name: 初頭硬 / initially hard stools
symptoms.description: 排便開始時糞便硬結，暗示腸中有乾燥硬塊。 / Hard feces at the beginning of bowel movement, suggesting hardened fecal material lodged in the intestines.

symptoms.name: 後必溏 / subsequently loose stools
symptoms.description: 病程後期大便變稀或溏薄，提示內有濕或既有硬塊已軟化。 / Stools become loose later in the course, indicating internal dampness or softening of previously hardened feces.

symptoms.name: 發作有時者 / intermittent attacks
symptoms.description: 疼痛或症狀時輕時重、間歇發作，不持續恒定。 / Symptoms such as pain occur intermittently, with episodes that come and go rather than continuous.

symptoms.name: 手足躁擾 / restlessness of hands and feet
symptoms.description: 手足不安、躁動不寧的表現，常為里實未清之後之煩擾症狀。 / Agitation or restless movement of the hands and feet, often a later sign when interior excess is unresolved.

symptoms.name: 陽脈微 / slight/soft yang pulse
symptoms.description: 右手寸脈或陽側脈微弱、緩下，代表陽氣歸根或痊愈趨勢。 / A slightly weak or softened yang pulse (right cun), indicating yang returning to source or a trend toward recovery.

symptoms.name: 脈實 / full/firm pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象有力而充實，常提示內實、裏熱或實證。 / A forceful, substantial pulse signifying interior excess, heat in the bowels, or a full pattern.

symptoms.name: 蒸蒸發熱 / intermittent steaming fever
symptoms.description: 一陣一陣上來的熱感，常見於胃內熱初起。 / Waves of intense rising heat, commonly indicating early stomach/yangming heat.

symptoms.name: 目中不了了 / eyes unfocused/blurred vision
symptoms.description: 眼神不清，視物不明，常見重症裡熱上擾的表現。 / Unclear gaze or blurred vision, often a sign of severe interior heat disturbing the sensory orifices.

symptoms.name: 瘀血 / blood stasis
symptoms.description: 血行不暢或血液瘀滯，可見疼痛、便血或病程不解。 / Impaired blood circulation or stagnant blood, seen as pain, bloody stools, or failure to resolve illness.

symptoms.name: 胃中熱 / stomach heat
symptoms.description: 胃腸部位的實熱症候，表現為心下或中焦燥熱脹痛。 / Excess heat in the stomach manifested by burning, fullness or distention in the epigastrium/middle jiao.

symptoms.name: 舌上津液多 / tongue with excessive saliva
symptoms.description: 舌面有過多津液或口水，提示內濕重或脾運失調。 / Excessive saliva or fluid on the tongue surface, indicating heavy internal dampness or spleen dysfunction.

symptoms.name: 陽黃 / yang-jaundice
symptoms.description: 陽黃為皮膚及眼球呈鮮明橘黃色或明亮黃色，提示熱邪在裏導致的黃疸。 / Yang‑jaundice presents as bright orange or vivid yellow discoloration of skin and sclera, indicating interior heat causing jaundice.

symptoms.name: 陰黃 / yin-jaundice
symptoms.description: 陰黃為膚色暗黃或油潤不明的黃疸，常屬寒濕或血瘀所致。 / Yin-jaundice: dull, dark, or greasy yellowing often due to cold-damp or blood stasis.

symptoms.name: 寒濕在裏 / interior cold-damp
symptoms.description: 寒濕在裏指寒與濕滯於內，表證已解但裏濕未去，臨床可見黃疸等。 / Interior cold-damp: retention of cold and dampness internally, with exterior signs relieved but internal dampness unresolved, may manifest as jaundice.

symptoms.name: 濕結下焦 / damp-consolidation in lower jiao
symptoms.description: 濕結下焦指濕熱或寒濕阻滯下焦，導致小便不利及下腹脹滿。 / Damp-consolidation in the lower jiao: dampness (with or without heat) obstructing the lower burner, causing scanty or difficult urination and lower abdominal fullness.

symptoms.name: 瘀熱在裏 / interior blood-heat stasis
symptoms.description: 瘀熱在裏指熱邪與血瘀互結於裏，導致全身或體表發黃及炎性表現。 / Interior blood-heat stasis: heat combined with blood stasis in the interior, producing systemic jaundice and inflammatory signs.

symptoms.name: 無腹脹 / no abdominal distention
symptoms.description: 腹部無脹滿或脹感，常作為梔子柏皮湯的鑑別要點之一。 / No abdominal distention: absence of abdominal fullness or bloating, a distinguishing sign for Zhizi Baipi Tang pattern.

symptoms.name: 表寒束熱 / exterior-cold constraining heat
symptoms.description: 表寒束熱指外感寒邪束表，內有熱邪不能宣洩，常見發黃且無汗。 / Exterior-cold constraining heat: exterior cold retaining the surface while interior heat cannot release, often producing jaundice with absence of sweating.

symptoms.name: 眼睛發黃 / scleral/ocular jaundice
symptoms.description: 眼白或眼球染成黃色，與全身或局部黃疸相關。 / Scleral/ocular jaundice: yellow discoloration of the eyes associated with systemic or local jaundice.

symptoms.name: 眼睛赤痛 / red painful eyes
symptoms.description: 眼球或眼瞼紅腫疼痛，伴有發炎征象，可用外洗劑治療。 / Red painful eyes: ocular redness with pain and inflammatory signs, sometimes treated with topical washes.

symptoms.name: 腸內濕阻 / intestinal damp obstruction
symptoms.description: 濕濁阻滯腸道，表現為大便濕滯或小便不利與腹部脹滿。 / Intestinal damp obstruction: damp turbidity blocking the intestines, manifesting as sticky stools, difficult urination, and abdominal distention.

symptoms.name: 三焦瘀熱 / triple-jiao heat stasis
symptoms.description: 熱與瘀滯於三焦（上中下焦），導致大小便失常與腹部脹滿或全身發黃。 / Triple-jiao heat stasis: heat and stasis lodged in the three jiao (upper, middle, lower), causing urinary and bowel dysfunction, abdominal distention, or systemic jaundice.

symptoms.name: 兩耳無所聞 / bilateral hearing loss
symptoms.description: 閉塞或失聰，兩側耳朵聽力喪失或顯著減退，常見於少陽邪入或津液不足時。 / Bilateral loss or marked reduction of hearing in both ears, often seen when Shaoyang pathogen invades or when body fluids are depleted.

symptoms.name: 口苦 / bitter taste in the mouth
symptoms.description: 口中苦味，常伴咽乾，為少陽膽氣上逆或膽熱證的常見主症。 / A bitter taste in the mouth often with dry throat; typical Shaoyang sign due to gallbladder qi counterflow or gallbladder heat.

symptoms.name: 脈弦細 / wiry-fine pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象弦而細，代表肝膽或少陽之脈兼有水相與氣相的表現，常見少陽證或水道受邪。 / Pulse that is wiry and fine, indicating involvement of liver/gallbladder or Shaoyang with both water and qi features; common in Shaoyang patterns.

symptoms.name: 脈弦緊 / wiry-tight pulse
symptoms.description: 脈弦而緊，代表寒熱夾雜或表裏不和，多見於少陽或太陽轉少陽時。 / Wiry and tight pulse indicating mixed cold/heat or disharmony between exterior and interior; seen in Shaoyang or transition from Taiyang to Shaoyang.

symptoms.name: 目赤 / red eyes
symptoms.description: 眼睛紅赤、充血或發炎，常因血熱或眼部血液津液不足所致，少陽邪入或上擾可見。 / Red, inflamed eyes from blood heat or insufficient fluids to nourish the eyes; may appear when Shaoyang pathogen ascends.

symptoms.name: 目合則汗 / sweating on eye closure
symptoms.description: 閉眼時出汗，表示虛汗或津液耗損，常見於病後汗傷或少陽/表裡虛損階段。 / Sweating when eyes are closed, indicating deficiency sweating or fluid loss, often seen in post‑illness fluid depletion or Shaoyang-related deficiency.

symptoms.name: 上關上 / upper guan rising pulse manifestation
symptoms.description: 關脈跳至上位（寸位偏上），代表陽熱上擾至上焦，常見於三陽合病或熱上擾。 / Pulse manifestation where the guan moves upward to a higher position, indicating yang heat rising to the upper Jiao; seen in Three Yang combined disease or ascending heat.

symptoms.name: 胸中滿而煩 / chest fullness with vexation
symptoms.description: 胸中感到脹滿並伴有煩躁不安，少陽病或上焦受阻時常見，誤用吐下可致氣血耗傷。 / Fullness in the chest with irritability/vexation; common in Shaoyang disease or upper Jiao obstruction; improper purging/vomiting can further injure qi and blood.

symptoms.name: 吐下發汗後脈結代或悸 / post-vomiting/purging/sweating palpitations or intermittent pulse
symptoms.name_zh: 吐下發汗後脈結代或悸
symptoms.description: 吐下發汗後出現心悸或脈結代，提示氣血受損、心小腸相表裏受累，需用安神、補血法。 / Palpitations or intermittent (knotted) pulse after vomiting, purging, or heavy sweating, indicating injury to qi/blood and possible heart-small intestine involvement; requires calming and blood‑tonifying treatment.

symptoms.name: 脅下硬滿 / hypochondriac hardness and fullness
symptoms.description: 脅下（胸肋下）部位堅硬而滿，按之有痛或硬塊，為少陽胸脅阻滯或痰飲瘀結所致。 / Hardness and fullness under the ribs (hypochondrium), often firm to palpation and possibly painful, due to Shaoyang obstruction, phlegm‑fluid accumulation or stasis.

symptoms.name: 脈一緩 / pulse slightly relaxed
symptoms.description: 脈象稍有緩和，常見於病情即將解除之時。 / Pulse slightly relaxed; commonly seen when the illness is about to resolve.

symptoms.name: 脈小 / small/thin pulse
symptoms.description: 脈細小，或微弱，常表示體虛或病勢渴欲已。 / Fine/thin pulse, or faint; often indicates deficiency or that the disease is about to cease.

symptoms.name: 一息四至 / four breaths per cycle pulse rate
symptoms.name_en: four breaths per cycle pulse rate
symptoms.description: 脈博或呼吸以四次為一息，提示脈象正常（正常不快不慢）。 / Pulse/respiration measured as four beats per single breath cycle, indicating a normal pulse (neither fast nor slow). In text used to denote normal pulse in pregnancy context.

symptoms.name: 脈正常 / normal pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象無異常，節律平和，常見於健康或非疾病狀態；在書中提及正常脈但有噁心即為受孕。 / Pulse without abnormality, steady rhythm; in this text, normal pulse combined with nausea may indicate pregnancy rather than disease.

symptoms.name: 脾臟腫大 / splenomegaly
symptoms.description: 脾體腫大，伴脘腹脹滿、消化功能下降與津液滯留。 / Enlargement of the spleen with epigastric/abdominal distention, impaired digestion and accumulation of fluids.

symptoms.name: 脈陽微 / slight yang pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象顯示陽脈微弱，代表殘餘氣機或陽氣不壯。 / Pulse showing a slightly diminished yang component, indicating residual or weakened yang qi.

symptoms.name: 脈陰澀 / rough yin pulse
symptoms.description: 陰部脈象澀滯、不流利，反映血行或陰脈受阻。 / Yin-side pulse that is rough or choppy, reflecting impaired blood flow or obstruction in the yin pulse.

symptoms.name: 四肢煩疼 / limb aching and vexation
symptoms.description: 四肢感到煩悶酸痛、拘急不適，常見於中風或脾經受病時。 / Sensation of aching, vexation or tightness in the limbs, often seen when the Taiyin pattern or wind affects the limbs.

symptoms.name: 大實痛 / severe fixed abdominal pain
symptoms.description: 腹部實在之痛，按之仍甚或拒按，屬實證需攻下或瀉實。 / Severe, fixed abdominal pain that worsens with pressure or is associated with guarding, indicating an excess/obstructive pattern requiring purgation or evacuation.

symptoms.name: 亥至丑發作時刻 / midnight-early morning recovery time
symptoms.description: 病情好轉常在亥時至丑時（夜半至子時後一段）胃氣回復，病情轉佳。 / Clinical improvement in Taiyin disease often occurs between Hai and Chou hours (midnight to early morning) when stomach qi revives.

symptoms.name: 自利不渴 / diarrhea without thirst
symptoms.description: 下利頻繁但感覺不渴，提示中焦有寒濕，津液積滯而口渴欠現。 / Frequent diarrhea without thirst, indicating cold-damp in the middle jiao with retained fluids and absent thirst.

symptoms.name: 手足自溫 / hands and feet feel warm
symptoms.description: 病程中手足反覺溫暖，提示胃氣向外散出或裏證轉化的表現。 / Hands and feet become warm during disease, suggesting dispersal of stomach qi outward or transformation of an interior pattern.

symptoms.name: 拒按 / guarding/refusal to be pressed
symptoms.description: 觸按腹部即抗拒或表現劇痛，提示實證或腹膜刺激。 / Refusal to allow abdominal pressure due to severe pain or guarding, indicating an excess pattern or peritoneal irritation.

symptoms.name: 腹滿時痛 / abdominal fullness with intermittent pain
symptoms.description: 腹脹伴隱隱作痛，按之可有所緩解，多見於太陰或脾濕。 / Abdominal distention with intermittent, dull pain that may ease with pressure; commonly seen in Taiyin/damp spleen patterns.

symptoms.name: 胃氣外散 / stomach qi dispersal
symptoms.description: 胃陽或胃氣散到四肢，導致胃中無熱而消化力下降，表現為手足發溫等。 / Dispersal of stomach yang/qi to the limbs, causing diminished central digestive warmth and function, sometimes presenting as warm hands and feet.

symptoms.name: 亡陽 / yang collapse / loss of yang
symptoms.description: 陽氣嚴重衰敗，表現為浮脈而無力、反汗不止等危急征象。 / Severe depletion of yang with floating weak pulse and profuse sweating despite internal collapse; a life‑threatening state.

symptoms.name: 自利而渴 / involuntary diarrhea/urination with thirst
symptoms.description: 指病人自利（下利或頻尿）同時感到口渴，提示下焦虛寒兼有引水自救的現象。 / Involuntary diarrhea/urination accompanied by thirst, indicating lower‑jiao deficiency‑cold with compensatory drinking behavior.

symptoms.name: 欲吐不吐 / retching without vomiting / urge to vomit without emesis
symptoms.name_en: retching without vomiting / urge to vomit without emesis
symptoms.description: 常見於少陰病，病人有欲吐的感覺但吐不出，與中焦津液阻滯有關。 / A sensation of wanting to vomit without actual emesis, often seen in Shaoyin pattern due to blockage of gastric fluids.

symptoms.name: 下焦虛寒 / lower‑jiao deficiency‑cold
symptoms.description: 腎陽不足致下焦陽氣失溫，臨床見小便色淡白、不利及下利等寒象。 / Kidney‑yang deficiency affecting the lower jiao, presenting with pale dilute urine, urinary difficulty, diarrhea and other cold signs.

symptoms.name: 尺脈弱濇 / weak-rough pulse at chi (weak and choppy chi pulse)
symptoms.name_en: weak-rough pulse at chi (weak and choppy chi pulse)
symptoms.description: 尺位脈象弱且濇，提示下焦陽虛與血少，屬少陰危險指標。 / Weak and choppy pulse at the chi (deep) position, indicating lower‑jiao yang deficiency and blood insufficiency; a serious Shaoyin sign.

symptoms.name: 踡臥 / lying curled up / fetal position due to cold
symptoms.name_en: lying curled up / fetal position due to cold
symptoms.description: 因惡寒而屈身蜷曲臥位，常見於下焦寒盛的少陰病。 / Curling up in bed due to severe aversion to cold, commonly seen in Shaoyin pattern with pronounced lower‑jiao cold.

symptoms.name: 脈細沉數 / fine-deep-rapid pulse
symptoms.description: 脈細而沉且數，顯示病在裏寒中更兼有虛熱或驟變，少陰病常見脈象之一。 / A pulse that is thin, deep and rapid, suggesting interior pathology possibly with deficiency‑fire or acute change; seen in some Shaoyin presentations.

symptoms.name: 手足反溫 / hands and feet relatively warm
symptoms.description: 在少陰病過程中，若手足轉為溫暖，提示腸胃功能恢復而可治。 / When hands and feet become relatively warm during illness, it suggests restoration of digestive qi and a favorable prognosis in Shaoyin cases.

symptoms.name: 胸暴煩 / sudden chest vexation/acute chest agitation
symptoms.description: 胸中突然煩躁不安，少陰轉解時可能出現的短暫症狀。 / Sudden chest vexation or acute inner agitation in the chest, sometimes occurring transiently as Shaoyin resolves.

symptoms.name: 陰浮 / floating yin pulse
symptoms.description: 陰脈浮起，表示陰脈（血脈）向上浮出，常為陽氣回復之象。 / Floating yin pulse: the yin (blood) pulse becomes floating, indicating return of yang and often heralding recovery.

symptoms.name: 脈不至 / absent pulse
symptoms.description: 脈不可及或不至，表示脈象極其微弱或陽氣絕，常為危重徵象。 / Absent pulse: pulse cannot be felt, indicating extreme faintness or yang collapse and is a grave sign.

symptoms.name: 下利止 / cessation of diarrhea
symptoms.description: 原有下利後突然止，常因津液枯竭或失血，為病情危重之象。 / Cessation of diarrhea after profuse stools, often due to fluid depletion or blood loss, and indicates a serious prognosis.

symptoms.name: 息高 / prolonged/high respiration
symptoms.description: 呼吸長而高，為氣力衰竭或末期之象，常見於危重病人末期。 / Prolonged/high respiration: long, forceful breaths indicating exhaustion of vital qi or terminal stage in critically ill patients.

symptoms.name: 半夜胃氣回來 / nocturnal return of stomach qi
symptoms.description: 半夜（亥至丑時）病人感到餓，胃氣回升，為少陰病或陰證轉機的標誌。 / Nocturnal return of stomach qi: feeling hungry at midnight-early morning (亥至丑), indicating recovery of stomach qi and possible turning point in Shaoyin pattern.

symptoms.name: 手足逆冷 / reversed cold of hands and feet
symptoms.name_en: reversed cold of hands and feet
symptoms.description: 手足厥冷，四肢逆冷，表示陽氣衰微、胃氣不能溫煦四肢，為少陰危重徵象之一。 / Reversed cold of hands and feet: extremities are cold (jue), indicating yang decline and failure of stomach qi to warm the limbs, a grave sign in Shaoyin cases.

symptoms.name: 頭眩頻發 / recurrent vertigo
symptoms.description: 頻繁眩暈頭暈，常因嚴重血虛或心氣衰竭所致，為危重象。 / Recurrent vertigo: frequent dizziness often due to severe blood deficiency or cardiac weakness, indicating serious condition.

symptoms.name: 吐利並作 / simultaneous vomiting and diarrhea
symptoms.description: 嘔吐與下利同時發生，胃腸功能極度受損，常伴脈象微細或四逆，為危重徵象。 / Simultaneous vomiting and diarrhea: concurrent emesis and diarrhea indicating severe gastrointestinal failure and often accompanied by fine pulse or four-cold reversal (Si Ni), a grave sign.

symptoms.name: 四逆 / four reversals (extreme cold limbs)
symptoms.description: 四逆指四肢厥冷、全身寒冷，陽氣幾盡，為危及生命的重症脈證。 / Four reversals: extreme cold of all four limbs indicating near exhaustion of yang qi and a life-threatening state.

symptoms.name: 但欲寐 / desire to sleep
symptoms.description: 患者雖病但只想入睡，屬少陰病常見的嗜眠表現。 / Patient shows an overwhelming desire to sleep despite illness; a common somnolence sign in Shaoyin pattern.

symptoms.name: 汗出不煩 / sweating without irritability
symptoms.description: 出汗但無內熱煩躁之表現，常見於少陰陽虛而表微解的狀態。 / Sweating occurs without accompanying irritability or vexation, seen when yang is weak but the exterior is slightly resolving.

symptoms.name: 自利 / spontaneous diarrhea
symptoms.description: 病程中自然發生的下利，常提示正氣大傷或腸道功能嚴重受損。 / Diarrhea arising spontaneously during the course of disease, often indicating severe depletion of Zheng qi or intestinal dysfunction.

symptoms.name: 不得臥 / inability to lie down/sleep
symptoms.description: 患者煩躁或心中不安而無法平臥或入睡，為危重或熱證的警訊。 / Patient cannot lie down or sleep due to agitation or inner vexation; a warning sign of severe or heat-entering conditions.

symptoms.name: 便膿血 / pus and blood in stools
symptoms.description: 大便帶有膿血，提示腸內炎症或潰爛，為危險徵象。 / Stools containing pus and blood, indicating intestinal inflammation or ulceration; a serious sign.

symptoms.name: 吐劇 / severe vomiting
symptoms.description: 劇烈反覆嘔吐，常致津液虧損及氣機失調，需急救處理。 / Violent, recurrent vomiting that often leads to fluid depletion and disrupted qi movement, requiring urgent management.

symptoms.name: 自欲吐 / desire to vomit
symptoms.description: 自覺想要嘔吐但未必已吐，為少陰病早期或轉重的症狀。 / An urge to vomit without necessarily producing emesis, seen in early or worsening Shaoyin conditions.

symptoms.name: 下利不止 / uncontrolled diarrhea
symptoms.description: 腹瀉持續不止，表明腸道炎症或重度腸損傷。 / Diarrhea that continues without stopping, indicating intestinal inflammation or severe bowel injury.

symptoms.name: 刺關元穴 / needling Guanyuan (CV4)
symptoms.description: 以刺關元穴止下利，為少陰下利便膿血時之外治法。 / Needling the Guanyuan (CV4) acupuncture point to stop diarrhea; an external intervention for Shaoyin diarrhea with pus and blood.

symptoms.name: 自利清水色純青 / spontaneous watery diarrhea with pure green stools
symptoms.name_en: spontaneous watery diarrhea with pure green stools
symptoms.description: 自發性清水下利，糞色純青，多為膽汁外溢所致。 / Spontaneous watery diarrhea producing pure green stools, often due to bile entering the large intestine.

symptoms.name: 脈沉 / deep pulse
symptoms.description: 脈位沉而難按，提示裏寒或陽氣下陷。 / Pulse felt primarily at a deep level and difficult to access, indicating interior cold or sinking yang.

symptoms.name: 飲食入口則吐 / vomiting upon ingestion
symptoms.description: 進食即吐，食入不能下行，常見於胸中飲實或上焦阻塞。 / Vomiting immediately after ingestion, with food failing to descend, often seen with fluid accumulation in the chest or upper-jiao obstruction.

symptoms.name: 數更衣 / frequent changing of clothes
symptoms.description: 因反覆下利或多汗需頻繁更衣，提示大量津液耗散。 / Frequent changing of clothes due to recurrent diarrhea or profuse sweating, indicating marked loss of body fluids.

symptoms.name: 嘔而汗出 / vomiting with sweating
symptoms.description: 伴隨吐逆同時出汗，常見於陽氣虧虛或重度津液流失。 / Vomiting accompanied by sweating, commonly seen in yang deficiency or severe fluid depletion.

symptoms.name: 脈微濇 / fine-choppy (faint-choppy) pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象細而澀，勢微且不利，常見於虛寒下利之證。 / Pulse that is fine and choppy (faint and rough), often seen in deficient-cold diarrhea patterns.

symptoms.name: 胸中飲實 / phlegm-fluid accumulation in the chest
symptoms.description: 痰飲滯留於胸中，上焦阻塞，表現為胸悶、嘔吐及嗆咳。 / Phlegm-fluid accumulation lodged in the chest causing upper-jiao obstruction, with chest fullness, vomiting, and choking cough.

symptoms.name: 昏迷 / coma/unconsciousness
symptoms.description: 意識喪失或深度嗜睡，為厥陰病中常見之危重表現之一，提示血中邪盛或陽氣衰敗。 / Loss of consciousness or deep unresponsiveness; a severe sign in Jueyin disease indicating deep blood entrapment or collapse of yang qi.

symptoms.name: 寒熱並結 / simultaneous cold-and-heat (cold-heat complex)
symptoms.description: 體內同時見寒象與熱象並存，常見於厥陰邪在血分深處互爭之候。 / Coexistence of cold and heat signs, often seen when pathogenic factors in the blood level (Jueyin) struggle internally.

symptoms.name: 氣上撞心 / upward-rushing qi striking the heart
symptoms.description: 下有寒、上有熱時熱氣被寒阻擠上衝，感覺氣上衝撞心胸或心前區。 / Heat constrained below by cold forces qi upward, producing a sensation of qi rushing up and striking the chest/heart.

symptoms.name: 心中疼熱 / burning pain in the chest/epigastrium
symptoms.description: 胸中或心下感到灼熱刺痛，類似熱邪灼傷胃心之感。 / A burning, painful sensation in the center of the chest or epigastrium, as if heat is injuring the stomach/heart region.

symptoms.name: 脈微浮 / slightly floating pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象略呈浮而微弱，章中提示為免疫回復、陽氣回升之良兆。 / A pulse that is mildly floating and faint; in the chapter it indicates recovery of host defenses and returning yang.

symptoms.name: 除中 / transient return/reperfusion sign (chu zhong)
symptoms.description: 危重病人短暫恢復食慾或體溫回升的現象，為迴光返照樣表現，可能預示病情反覆或危險。 / A transient return of appetite or warming in a critically ill patient (a temporary revival), akin to 'rallying', which may indicate fleeting recovery or impending danger.

symptoms.name: 反汗出 / recurrent sweating/return of sweating
symptoms.description: 原本無汗或汗止後又出汗，章中作為熱回升或免疫反應之一表現。 / Resumption of sweating after prior absence or cessation, viewed in the chapter as a sign of returning heat or immune response.

symptoms.name: 凍瘡 / chilblains/frostbite (chilblain)
symptoms.description: 因外有寒而裡有熱之錯綜，對於肢端凍瘡可用當歸四逆湯使血入而回溫。 / Cold-induced chilblains; in Jueyin-type mixed cold-and-heat, Danggui Sini Decoction may restore fresh blood flow and warming to digits.

symptoms.name: 饑而不欲食 / hungry but no desire to eat
symptoms.name_en: hungry but no desire to eat
symptoms.description: 感到飢餓但無食慾，常見於胃氣受阻、蟲積或中焦不和之厥陰證。 / Sensation of hunger without appetite; seen when stomach qi is impaired, with parasite burden or middle-jiao disharmony in Jueyin patterns.

symptoms.name: 唇上白點 / white spots on the lips
symptoms.description: 唇部出現小而整齊的白色斑點，為中寒或脾開竅失常之望診征候之一。 / Small, regularly arranged white spots on the lips; a visual sign suggesting middle cold or spleen opening dysfunction.

symptoms.name: 腿部蟲區壓痛 / tenderness over leg 'worm' zone
symptoms.description: 兒科望診中於腿部特定區域觸壓有壓痛，為體內寄生蟲或蟲卵繁殖之體徵。 / Localized tenderness on palpation over leg areas associated with parasitic infestation; a pediatric sign of internal worms or larval zones.

symptoms.name: 丑至卯上 / recovery from chou to mao (early-morning recovery)
symptoms.name_en: recovery from chou to mao (early-morning recovery)
symptoms.description: 病情欲解時於子夜至清晨（丑至卯）出現好轉或復原的時間性徵象。 / A time-specific sign of improvement occurring in the late night to early morning (Chou to Mao hours), indicating recovery phases in Jueyin disease.

symptoms.name: 唇下黑斑/眼下微黑 / periorbital/dark spots under eyes and black dots on lips
symptoms.name_en: periorbital/dark spots under eyes and black dots on lips
symptoms.description: 兒科望診中唇上白點伴眼下微黑，提示上熱下寒並存，為厥陰蟲積之象。 / In pediatric inspection white spots on the lips with slight darkness under the eyes indicates upper heat with lower cold coexistence, suggestive of parasitic infestation in Jueyin.

symptoms.name: 先厥 / initial fainting/early syncope
symptoms.description: 病程初期出現的暫時性昏厥或四肢逆冷，常見於病邪入血或厥陰初犯。 / An early transient syncope or reversal of limbs cold at disease onset, seen when the pathogen initially invades the blood level or Jueyin.

symptoms.name: 脈不浮 / non-floating pulse
symptoms.description: 脈象不浮出表，表示未復原或陽氣未回升，章中用以判斷厥陰中風恢復與否。 / Pulse that is not floating, indicating lack of recovery or no return of yang; used to assess non-recovery in Jueyin wind-attack.

symptoms.name: 體內寄生蟲 / internal parasitic infestation
symptoms.description: 腸胃內寄生蟲或蟲卵寄居體內，導致食後吐蚘、饑而不欲食等厥陰相關症狀。 / Parasitic worms or eggs residing in the gastrointestinal tract, causing postprandial vomiting of worms, hunger without appetite, and other Jueyin-related signs.

symptoms.name: 口傷爛赤 / mouth ulceration/raw red mouth
symptoms.description: 口腔黏膜糜爛、潰爛呈紅腫，常見於厥陰誤汗後津液受損時。 / Erosive, raw red lesions of the oral mucosa, seen when fluids are depleted (e.g., after inappropriate sweating in jueyin).

symptoms.name: 喉不痺 / throat not painful
symptoms.description: 喉嚨未感痺痛，為便膿血時常見之表徵；即喉中不呈疼痛或麻木。 / Absence of throat pain or numbness; a sign sometimes accompanying diarrhea with pus/blood, indicating upward or downward migration of pathogenic factors.

symptoms.name: 指頭寒 / cold fingertips
symptoms.description: 手指端冰冷，為厥微或厥陰恢復/病勢變化時可見的局部寒象。 / Coldness of the fingertips, a peripheral sign seen in mild jue or during changes in jueyin disease progression.

symptoms.name: 陽氣退 / decline of yang qi
symptoms.description: 陽氣衰微，表現為寒多熱少、四肢厥冷、精神沉弱等衰退徵象。 / Decline of yang qi with manifestations of predominating cold over heat, cold extremities, weakened vitality, and general deterioration.

symptoms.name: 膚冷 / cold skin
symptoms.description: 皮膚觸之冰冷，常見於陽氣衰退或寒邪深入時。 / Skin feels cold to touch, commonly seen with yang decline or deep cold invasion.

symptoms.name: 久利 / chronic diarrhea
symptoms.description: 久而不止的下利或長期腹瀉，常與脾胃虛寒或寄生蟲等有關。 / Prolonged, persistent diarrhea often associated with spleen-stomach deficiency-cold or parasitic infestation.

symptoms.name: 脈細欲絕 / fine pulse nearly absent
symptoms.description: 脈細而微，近於絕脈，示心陽將衰或氣血虛弱。 / Pulse is very fine and nearly absent, indicating imminent cardiac yang collapse or severe qi-blood deficiency.

symptoms.name: 汗出不止 / unceasing sweating
symptoms.description: 汗液持續流出不止，耗損陽津，易致陰陽失衡。 / Continuous, unremitting sweating that depletes yang fluids and may precipitate yin-yang collapse.

symptoms.name: 熱不去 / persistent heat
symptoms.description: 發熱持續不退，即便汗出亦難以解熱，常見津液虧損或裡熱未清。 / Fever or heat that does not resolve despite sweating, suggesting fluid depletion or unresolved interior heat.

symptoms.name: 四肢拘急 / limb stiffness and cramping
symptoms.description: 四肢疼痛拘急，關節僵緊，常見於津液不足導致循環障礙。 / Painful stiffness and cramping of the limbs with joint rigidity, often due to fluid depletion impairing circulation.

symptoms.name: 厥不還 / persistent reversal (no return of warmth)
symptoms.description: 指經灸或其他回陽法後手腳仍不回溫，病情轉差，常為危重證候。 / Failure of warmth to return after moxibustion or resuscitative measures, indicating worsening prognosis and critical state.

symptoms.name: 煩躁不得臥 / restless agitation with inability to lie down
symptoms.name_en: restless agitation with inability to lie down
symptoms.description: 極度煩躁不安，不能安臥，常見於陽氣欲脫、心神不寧的危證。 / Extreme agitation and inability to lie down, often seen when yang is about to collapse and the spirit is disturbed; a grave sign.

symptoms.name: 下利至甚 / profuse uncontrollable diarrhea
symptoms.description: 下利劇烈且持續，導致津液耗損和虛脫，為危重證候。 / Severe, continuous watery diarrhea causing fluid depletion and collapse; a critical sign.

symptoms.name: 灸厥陰 / moxibustion at Jueyin points
symptoms.description: 對厥陰病位灸治（如中脘、關元等），作為回陽救逆或助陽法。 / Moxibustion applied to Jueyin-related points (e.g., Zhongwan, Guanyuan) used to rescue yang and reverse collapse.

symptoms.name: 熱兼下利 / fever with concurrent diarrhea
symptoms.description: 發熱同時伴有腹瀉或下利，可能為胃腸津液耗損或裡熱引起的消化道失衡。 / Fever occurring together with diarrhea, suggesting gastrointestinal fluid depletion or interior heat affecting digestion.

symptoms.name: 灸中脘 / moxibustion at Zhongwan
symptoms.description: 在中脘穴灸治以溫中回陽，常用於胃氣衰弱、回陽的灸法之一。 / Moxibustion at Zhongwan point to warm the middle and restore yang; used for impaired stomach qi and resuscitation.

symptoms.name: 脈乍緊 / intermittently tight pulse
symptoms.description: 脈時而緊、時而不緊，反映胸中有實邪阻滯。 / Pulse that becomes tight intermittently, indicating an intermittent constriction often from an obstructing pathogen in the chest.

symptoms.name: 飢不能食 / hungry but unable to eat
symptoms.description: 有饑感卻無法進食，常見於胸中實阻或胃氣不和。 / Sensation of hunger but inability to eat, often seen with chest obstruction or disharmony of stomach qi.

symptoms.name: 咽喉不利 / throat obstruction/difficulty swallowing
symptoms.description: 咽喉不利、喉間腫塞或吞咽困難，常伴咽中如結或咽喉腫痛。 / Throat obstruction or difficulty swallowing, often with sensation of a knot in the throat or throat swelling.

symptoms.name: 灸之不溫 / moxibustion fails to warm
symptoms.description: 對關元等穴灸法仍不回溫，表示陽氣極衰、難以回復。 / Moxibustion applied (e.g., at Guanyuan) fails to produce warming, indicating severe yang collapse and poor recovery potential.

symptoms.name: 唾膿血 / expectoration of pus and blood
symptoms.description: 唾出或咳出帶膿血的痰，示血熱或組織潰爛，常見上焦熱逆及喉口潰爛情形。 / Expectoration or spitting of pus mixed with blood, indicating blood-heat or tissue ulceration often from upper-jiao heat reversal and throat/gum lesions.

symptoms.name: 少陰負趺陽 / Shaoyin pulse weaker than Fuyang (normal relation)
symptoms.name_en: Shaoyin pulse weaker than Fuyang (normal relation)
symptoms.description: 少陰脈（太溪）較趺陽/衝陽脈為細小，為正常之脈候。 / Shaoyin (Taixi) pulse smaller/weaker than the Fuyang/Chongyang pulse; a normal comparative pulse finding.

symptoms.name: 寸脈反浮數 / reversed-floating rapid cun pulse
symptoms.description: 寸位脈反而呈浮數，為上熱的脈象指標。 / Reversed-floating rapid pulse at the cun position: the cun pulse becomes floating and rapid, indicating upper heat.

symptoms.name: 尺中自濇 / choppy chi-mid pulse (self-choppy at chi)
symptoms.description: 尺中位自見濇象，脈濇而不暢，常提示血行下走或血虧。 / Choppy pulse at the middle chi position: a choppy quality at the chi-mid indicating downward movement of blood or blood deficiency.

symptoms.name: 戴陽（面戴陽） / facial floating-yang (cheek flushing despite deficiency)
symptoms.description: 顴部微紅但下焦虛寒，為陽氣浮越於面之證候。 / Facial 'daiyang': slight cheek flushing despite lower-jiao deficiency-cold, representing floating of yang to the face.

symptoms.name: 便臭 / foul-smelling stools
symptoms.description: 大便氣味惡臭，常見於熱性下利或痢疾。 / Foul-smelling stools: malodorous stools commonly seen in febrile diarrhea or dysenteric disorders.

symptoms.name: 熱利 / heat diarrhea (febrile diarrhea)
symptoms.description: 熱性下利，伴便臭、脈數等熱象，多見急性腸炎或痢疾。 / Heat diarrhea: febrile, smelly diarrhea accompanied by rapid pulse and other heat signs, typical of acute enteritis or dysentery.

symptoms.name: 微厥 / mild syncope (slight faintness)
symptoms.description: 輕微厥逆或神志不清但仍有喘息或微溫，為下焦虛寒陽氣浮越之表現。 / Mild syncope: slight fainting or transient loss of vigor, representing floating of yang due to lower-jiao deficiency-cold.

symptoms.name: 裏寒外熱 / interior cold with exterior heat
symptoms.description: 內裏寒甚而表有熱象或出汗，常見於裏寒兼有虛熱之候。 / Interior cold with exterior heat: marked interior cold with concurrent superficial heat signs or sweating, seen when interior cold coexists with false/relative heat.

symptoms.name: 脈大 / large/flooding pulse
symptoms.description: 脈來洪大有力，常示內有實熱或實邪未止。 / Large/flooding pulse: a big strong pulse often indicating interior excess heat or unresolved disease.

symptoms.name: 脈沉弦 / deep-wiry pulse
symptoms.description: 脈沉而弦，代表裏實或水氣壅遏，與下重相應。 / Deep-wiry pulse: deep and wiry, suggesting interior excess or water/qi obstruction associated with heavy bearing-down sensation.

symptoms.name: 脈數 / rapid pulse
symptoms.description: 脈來疾數，常為熱證或陽亢之象。 / Rapid pulse: fast pulse rate often indicating heat pattern or yang hyperactivity.

symptoms.name: 下利日十餘行 / diarrhea ten-plus times daily
symptoms.description: 每日下利十餘行，為病勢劇烈或陽熱實盛的指標。 / Diarrhea occurring more than ten times a day, indicating severe disease or intense interior heat/excess.

symptoms.name: 脈微弱數 / fine-weak-rapid pulse
symptoms.description: 脈細微而數，常見於陽氣將回或虛熱將現的過渡脈象。 / Fine, weak, and rapid pulse: thin, weak and rapid pulse seen when yang is returning or during transition from cold to emerging heat.

symptoms.name: 下利清穀不可攻表 / do not release exterior when watery diarrhea present
symptoms.name_en: do not release exterior when watery diarrhea present
symptoms.description: 有下利清穀者為內虛寒，不可攻表，攻表會耗內津及加重裏寒。 / When watery diarrhea with undigested food is present (lower-jiao deficiency-cold), do not attack the exterior; releasing exterior will consume internal fluids and worsen interior cold.

symptoms.name: 腸壁破損出血 / intestinal wall erosion with bleeding
symptoms.description: 腸壁被病原或毒熱腐蝕破損而出血，多見於霍亂、劇烈痢疾或嚴重感染。 / Intestinal wall erosion with bleeding: bleeding due to mucosal destruction by pathogens or heat-toxin, seen in cholera, severe dysentery or intense infection.

symptoms.name: 下利後脈絕手足厥冷 / post-diarrhea absent pulse with cold extremities
symptoms.name_en: post-diarrhea absent pulse with cold extremities
symptoms.description: 下利嚴重至脈絕並手足厥冷，提示陽氣衰竭及危重。 / Severe diarrhea resulting in absent pulse and cold extremities, indicating yang exhaustion and critical condition.

symptoms.name: 吐涎沫 / vomiting of saliva
symptoms.description: 吐出黏稠或泡沫狀唾液，常見於胃虛或肝氣犯胃所致之乾嘔或噦。 / Vomiting or expulsion of frothy or viscous saliva, often seen with gastric deficiency or liver‑qi attacking the stomach causing dry retching or hiccup.

symptoms.name: 虛煩 / empty‑heat vexation
symptoms.description: 內虛而見心煩、煩躁，但無實熱，本質為陰液不足或虛熱所致。 / Vexation arising from deficiency (empty‑heat), manifested as irritability and restlessness without substantial heat, due to yin/fluid depletion.

symptoms.name: 按之心下濡 / epigastric soft-on-pressure
symptoms.description: 按壓心下部時感覺濡軟、不實，常見於病後虛弱或痊癒前之脾胃虛證。 / Softness on pressure beneath the xiphoid/epigastrium, indicating deficiency or resolving disease in the middle burner.

symptoms.name: 大吐大下後虛 / post‑purge collapse (extreme depletion)
symptoms.description: 大量嘔吐與瀉下後出現極度虛脫、津液耗損及內寒之症。 / Severe depletion after profuse vomiting and purging, with fluid loss, collapse, and interior cold.

symptoms.name: 心下硬 / epigastric hardness on pressure
symptoms.description: 心下區域按之堅硬、脹滿，多見於實邪停滯如實滿或結胸。 / Hardness and firmness beneath the heart on pressure, indicating internal accumulation or focal binding such as excess stool blockage or chest binding.

symptoms.name: 吐出膿 / expectoration/vomition of pus
symptoms.description: 嘔吐或咳出膿性分泌物，提示胃或肺內有化膿性病灶，常應讓其自出而勿急治。 / Expectorating or vomiting pus, indicating suppurative lesions in stomach or lungs; often allowed to discharge spontaneously rather than forcibly stopped.

syndromes.name: 大陷胸證 / Da Xian Xiong pattern (Great Collapsed Chest)
syndromes.name_en: Da Xian Xiong pattern (Great Collapsed Chest)
syndromes.description: 大陷胸證為《傷寒論》所載之急重實證，病因為痰、飲、水、熱互結壅阻於胸膈及中焦，使氣機不得下降或氣上逆，並可兼及水飲壅滯致循行受阻。病機要點：痰飲互結化熱或熱迫液聚，痰熱水三者在膈下、心下凝聚成實塊或膿樣浸潤，致膈下閉塞、橫膈不能下降，呼吸受阻。臨床主症：心下痞滿或心下按之硬如石（按則痛或不按而痛，重者按之石硬不近）；胸悶胸部壓迫感；氣不得下、短氣喘促、咳吐黃稠痰或大量痰塊；發熱或日晡潮熱、口渴口苦、便閉或乾結；舌質多見紅、舌苔黃厚或黃膩、舌燥；脈多沉緊有力，或滑數、沉實。分證要點：屬實邪閉阻之重證，脈沉緊、心下石硬者宜用大陷胸證治；脈浮滑、心下按之則痛且較輕者為小結胸（小陷胸證）；若無顯著大熱而以水飲為主者屬水結胸，可酌用丸劑或溫化法。與大承氣湯辨別：大承氣多為下焦實熱、大便秘結且兩側天樞部有壓痛；大陷胸為上焦痰熱水結於胸膈中心。現代對應可為胸腔或腹腔積液、胸膜或胰周炎性滲出、黏液或膿性積聚、嚴重痰飲阻塞或腫塊性梗阻。治法以峻下逐飲、瀉熱消結、通利胸下閉阻為要，臨床採短程大劑量速攻但須由有經驗之中醫師辨證施治並嚴密監護。危險徵象包括脈浮大、極度煩躁、意識改變、持續嘔吐、劇烈腹痛、急性腎功能惡化等，見此應停藥並轉西醫急救。孕婦、兒童、年老體弱及氣血虛、陰虛發熱者禁或慎用。使用期間應密切監測排便、尿量、生命徵象與電解質、腎功能等實驗室指標；必要時加用宣化理氣藥（如厚朴、枳實）以助氣機下行及化痰，但前提必須為實邪閉阻。 / Da Xian Xiong (Great Collapsed Chest) is an acute, severe replete pattern recorded in the Shanghan Lun. Etiology/pathomechanism: phlegm, fluid (yin), water and heat intermix and congeal to obstruct the chest (xiongge) and middle burner, preventing normal downward movement of qi or forcing qi upward; accumulated water/phlegm further impairs circulation. Key mechanism: phlegm-fluid with heat forms hard consolidations or viscous exudates beneath the diaphragm and in the epigastrium, blocking the diaphragm and limiting descent, producing respiratory compromise. Clinical features: epigastric/under-chest fullness with a palpable hard, stone-like mass (painful on pressure or so hard it is painful even without pressure); chest oppression or a sense of compression; inability of qi to descend, shortness of breath, rapid breathing, coughing up thick yellow sputum or large phlegm plugs; fever or late-afternoon tidal fever, thirst or bitter taste, constipation or dry stools; tongue often red with thick yellow or yellow-greasy coating, dry tongue; pulse commonly submerged, tight and forceful (chenjin), or slippery-rapid/sinkable and solid. Differentiation: this is a true (shi) obstructive emergency—deep tight pulse and heart-down stone-hard mass indicate Da Xian Xiong; a floating-slippery pulse with epigastric pain on pressure but less hardness indicates Xiao Xian Xiong (small trapped chest) treated by Xiao Xian Xiong Tang. If there is little overt heat and water predominates, consider water-binding patterns and choose appropriate modifications or pill forms. Distinguish from Da Chengqi Tang patterns: Da Chengqi involves lower-jiao constipation with bilateral abdominal tenderness at the tian shu points, whereas Da Xian Xiong involves upper-jiao/epigastric/phrenic obstruction by phlegm-heat-water. Modern correlates include pleural or peritoneal effusion, inflammatory exudates (eg acute pancreatitis with effusion), mucinous or purulent accumulations, severe phlegm-fluid obstruction, or tumor-related masses. Treatment principle: vigorous purgation to drain fluids and accumulations, clear heat, disperse and open the chest—short-course, relatively high-dose, rapid-acting therapy under experienced clinical supervision. Red flags (avoid or stop): floating-large pulse, severe agitation, altered consciousness, persistent vomiting, severe abdominal pain, acute renal impairment. Pregnancy, children, the frail, and qi/blood or yin-deficient febrile patients should avoid or use extreme caution. Monitor stools, urine output, vital signs, electrolytes and renal function; adjunctive addition of qi-descending/phlegm-transforming herbs (eg Houpo, Zhi Shi) is permissible only when a replete obstructive pattern is confirmed.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主要經方與君臣佐使功能： 1) 大陷胸湯（常用湯劑）：主藥為大黃、芒硝、甘遂。大黃苦寒，瀉下攻積、清熱破結、活血通腑；芒硝寒苦鹹，潤下軟堅，導水入腸以助瀉並潤滑痰固；甘遂寒苦咸，峻下逐水、消散痰飲與結塊（性峻猛有毒性）。傳統煎法例示：先以水煎大黃取汁，再去滓，納芒硝煮沸數次，最後入甘遂末溫服；方劑劑量按病重增減（經方舉例：大黃六兩、芒硝一升、甘遂少量生用，臨證視病勢調整）。應用要點：適用於熱實結胸、脈沉緊、心下石硬、舌燥渴、五六日不大便或日晡潮熱者。 2) 大陷胸丸（丸劑/收丸法）：方中有大黃、葶藶（炒）、芒硝、杏仁，製丸後另以甘遂末少量入服；丸劑因成形較留滯上焦、較適用於有痰而熱不甚劇烈或需要丸劑緩行者，古方劑量例：大黃半斤、葶藶半升（炒）、芒硝半升、杏仁半升（去皮尖、熬黑），搗篩合研成丸，服法依方別。 3) 小陷胸湯（去痰消結，較緩）：黃連、半夏、栝蔞實三味以黃連清熱，栝蔞破結滑痰，半夏降逆祛水痰，適用於心下按之則痛、脈浮滑、以痰結為主之小結胸。 配伍與加減：如需宣化寬胸、助氣機下行，可兼用厚朴、枳實；痰多需加葶藶、杏仁以利吐痰；濕寒邊緣者先以溫化法（乾薑、炙甘草、白朮、茯苓）調理。 禁忌與注意：孕婦禁用含甘遂、芫花、大戟等峻下逐水藥；兒童、老人、氣血或陰虛者慎用或避免；用藥期間嚴密監測排便次數、尿量、體重、心率血壓及電解質、腎功能；出現脈浮大、極度煩躁、意識改變、劇烈腹痛或急性腎衰等立即停藥並轉急救。臨床原則為：先確定為實邪閉阻、患者有承受力，然後短程強攻並嚴密監護。 / Main classical formulas and herb functions: 1) Da Xian Xiong Tang (decoction): core herbs are Da Huang, Mang Xiao and Gan Sui. Da Huang (cold, bitter) drains accumulations, clears heat, breaks stagnation and opens the bowels; Mang Xiao (cold saline) softens hard stools, draws water into the bowel to facilitate downward discharge and helps move viscous phlegm; Gan Sui (very cold, bitter-salty) forcefully drains water, disperses phlegm-fluid and dissolves masses (potent and potentially toxic). Traditional preparation: boil Da Huang first, remove dregs, add Mang Xiao and boil, then add Gan Sui powder and take warm. Dosages are adjusted to severity (classical examples are large doses; e.g. historical texts list heavy measures—use only under expert supervision). Indications: heat-replete condensed chest pattern with submerged tight pulse, stone-hard epigastric mass, dry mouth/thirst and constipation or tidal fever. 2) Da Xian Xiong Wan (pill): contains Da Huang, Tingli (Tinglizi) processed, Mang Xiao, and Xinren (bitter apricot seed); the pill is formed and Gan Sui powder is administered in a small adjunct dose. Pills tend to remain/stay in the upper burner and are used when a bolus form is preferred (for some water-bound or less violently febrile patterns). Classical pill recipe examples are given in the literature; exact preparation and dosing require experienced practitioners. 3) Xiao Xian Xiong Tang (milder, phlegm-clearing formula): Huang Lian, Ban Xia, Gualou Shi. Huang Lian clears heat/inflammation, Gualou breaks and disperses phlegm-conglomerates, Ban Xia descends rebellious qi and transforms phlegm—suitable for small trapped chest with epigastric pain on pressure, floating-slippery pulse and predominance of phlegm rather than hard water-heat masses. Modifications and adjuncts: add Hou Po and Zhi Shi to promote qi descent and broaden the chest; add Tingli and Xingren to facilitate expectoration; when cold or deficient features predominate, use warming/harmonizing herbs (Gan Cao, Ganjiang, Baizhu, Fuling) rather than powerful purgatives. Contraindications and precautions: pregnancy contraindicated for formulas containing Gan Sui, Yuanhua, Daji and similar strong purgatives; avoid or use extreme caution in children, the elderly, and qi/blood or yin-deficient patients. During therapy closely monitor bowel movements, urine output, vital signs, electrolytes and renal function; stop treatment and seek emergency care for floating-large pulse, severe agitation, persistent vomiting, severe abdominal pain, altered consciousness or acute renal dysfunction. Clinical principle: confirm a true replete obstructive pattern and patient tolerance before short-course aggressive purgation, and perform treatment only under experienced clinical supervision.

syndromes.name: 傷寒 / Shanghan (Cold Damage)
syndromes.description: 廣義上指『傷於寒』之外感性急性病，張仲景以六經辨證（太陽、陽明、少陽、太陰、少陰、厥陰）為主的病機分類與治療原則。 / Broadly refers to externally contracted illnesses caused by cold. Zhang Zhongjing classified these using the Six Channels (Taiyang, Yangming, Shaoyang, Taiyin, Shaoyin, Jueyin) for diagnosis and treatment strategies.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 經典方劑示例：麻黃湯、桂枝湯、白虎湯、小柴胡湯等。 / Example classic formulas: Ma Huang Tang (Ephedra Decoction), Gui Zhi Tang (Cinnamon Twig Decoction), Bai Hu Tang (White Tiger Decoction), Xiao Chai Hu Tang (Minor Bupleurum Decoction).

syndromes.name: 時疫 / Epidemic disease (Shiyi)
syndromes.description: 指不論個人體質，感染後表現出相似群體性病證的外感病，常有同時期多人發病的特徵。 / Refers to epidemic external diseases that produce similar clinical manifestations across people regardless of individual constitution; commonly causes simultaneous outbreaks among many people.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 處方思路與傷寒有重疊，但重視群體防治與解表清熱之法，常用經典解表或清疫方。 / Treatment approach overlaps with Shanghan but emphasizes epidemic control and formulas that release the exterior and clear epidemic toxins; classic formulas for resolving epidemics and clearing heat may be used.

syndromes.name: 太陽病 / Taiyang pattern
syndromes.description: 太陽病為六經之一的表證，以脈浮、頭項強痛、惡寒為核心，常見發熱、或有汗、或無汗等不同表證。依汗出與津液狀態可分為中風（發熱汗出、脈緩）、傷寒（無汗、惡寒、脈緊）、溫病（發熱口渴、熱在表或裡）或風溫（自汗、身灼、津液耗傷）等類型。未及時解表，可向少陽、陽明等裏經傳入，出現裏熱或腑熱。臨床強調以汗解為主（宜慎用發汗法而非以火熏灸取汗）；嚴禁用溫針、灸或以火烘患者取汗，因火攻可致邪由表入裏，造成「火逆」（上煩煩躁、頭汗身不汗、舌咽燥）、病勢延遲不解（到經不解）、吐血或下血等危重證候。《辨太陽病》中多處警示：脈浮熱甚勿灸，微數脈勿灸（虛熱忌灸），發汗應先見煩而後自汗，發汗過度或火熏可致陽浮、津液耗傷與心悸奔豚。總結：太陽證以發汗解表為首要原則，對有虛熱、津液不足或脈象提示內熱者慎用或禁用灸法，按證選方和補益生津以防裏熱與火逆。 / The Taiyang pattern is an exterior syndrome of the Six Channels characterized by a floating pulse, nape/neck stiffness, headache and aversion to cold, often with fever and either presence or absence of sweat. It is subclassified by sweating and fluid status into Zhongfeng (wind-strike: fever with sweating, slow pulse), Shanghan (cold-damage: aversion to cold, no sweat, tight pulse), Wenbing (warm-disease: fever with thirst) or Fengwen (wind-warmth: spontaneous sweating, body burning, fluid depletion). If untreated it may transmit inward to Shaoyang or Yangming producing interior or bowel heat. Clinical principle is to resolve the exterior by inducing sweat; do not substitute with moxibustion/warming needles (fire-application), because applying heat can drive the pathogen inward and cause 'fire reversal' (huo ni) — manifested by agitation, head sweating with body dryness, thirst, delayed course ('daojing bujie'), hematemesis or hematochezia and other severe signs. Textual cautions: when the pulse is floating with marked heat do not moxibust; a fine‑rapid (micro‑rapid) pulse indicates xu-heat and also contraindicates moxibustion. Sweating therapy should be controlled (often vexation precedes spontaneous sweating); excessive sweating or fire‑application risks consuming jin/fluids, producing floating yang, heart vexation and complex inward patterns. In short: use sweating to release the Taiyang exterior, avoid fire‑based methods when there is xu or signs of internal heat, and treat progression to Shaoyang/Yangming according to their patterns while protecting fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：麻黃湯（無汗、表實兼寒者，以發汗散寒）；桂枝湯（有汗或營衛不和者，以解表和營衛）。溫病或風溫重在益津養液，處方中可加生津藥如沙參、麥冬、生地等，並避免過度發汗或以火熏、溫針取汗。若病勢傳入少陽、陽明，依證加用小柴胡湯或承氣類、白虎類攻裏清熱生津之劑。臨床禁忌與處理：嚴禁用灸或溫針強行取汗（可致火逆、煩躁、到經不解、吐血、下血、奔豚等）；遇火逆或燙針煩躁、頭汗身不汗、脈浮熱盛者，可酌用桂枝加桂湯以振發逼散腸中濁氣，或用桂苓甘草龍骨牡蠣湯等安神鎮陽、生津除煩，並以茯苓利水以助中焦氣化（劑量與加減依證）。 / Common formulas: Ma Huang Tang (Ephedra Decoction) — for exterior cold without sweating to induce sweat and disperse cold; Gui Zhi Tang (Cinnamon Twig Decoction) — for exterior disorders with sweating or ying‑wei disharmony to harmonize. For wenbing or wind‑warmth prioritize fluid‑nourishing and yin‑enriching herbs (e.g., shashen/Glehnia, maidong/Ophiopogon, shengdi/Rehmannia) to protect jin/fluids and avoid excessive induced sweating or local heating. If the disorder transmits to Shaoyang or Yangming, treat per pattern (e.g., Xiao Chaihu Tang for Shaoyang; Chengqi‑type or Bai Hu Tang for Yangming) and add draining/clearing formulas as appropriate. Contraindications and special measures: avoid moxibustion or warming needles to force sweat — fire‑application can cause 'fire reversal' (huo ni) with agitation, head‑only sweating and body dryness, delayed resolution, hematemesis or hematochezia, and other severe signs. In such fire‑reversal or post‑thermal agitation states clinicians may consider guizhi jiagui tang (pinyin) to strongly mobilize yang and disperse intestinal turbidity, or guilinggancao longgu muli tang (pinyin) to calm vexation, settle floating yang and support fluids; add fuling (poria) to resolve retained water when indicated. Dosage and choice must follow the specific pulse and symptom picture and always protect jin/fluids.

syndromes.name: 陽明病 / Yangming pattern
syndromes.description: 陽明病為六經之一的裡實熱位，主以腸胃熱實為要。主要表現：高熱或午後日晡潮熱，口渴甚、煩躁、面紅或面含赤色、腹脹滿、實滿而便秘（大便堅硬）、舌苔多黃厚或膩、脈多見洪大、滑、緊或有浮而緩、脈浮緊兼潮熱等。熱可在經（血脈）或在腑（腸胃）——經熱多見津傷口燥、欲漱不欲嚥、易出血（用白虎湯）；腑熱多見大便結實、腹硬滿（用承氣類）。病位在陽明故不惡寒且多能食；若熱上擾肺則見咳嗽、咽痛。合併表證或胃寒未辨而誤攻下易致胃中空虛、噦逆、逆氣上衝或津液大傷。臨床要點：觀發熱時相（午後潮熱）、大便與小便情況、舌苔（黃/白/厚膩）、脈象及是否自汗或無汗，以決定採取攻下、清熱養津或溫補中焦的治法。張仲景並列出數種不能攻下的禁忌：①嘔多者不可攻；②心下硬滿（陷胸）者不可攻（攻之可致下利不止而危殆）；③面含赤色者不可攻（攻之可致小便不利、發黃）；④陽明中風（陽明兼有太陽或少陽）亦不可妄攻。 / Yangming pattern is an interior excess-heat syndrome of the stomach and intestines in the Six-Channel system. Key features: high fever or tidal afternoon/evening fever, marked thirst, irritability, facial redness (sometimes localized), abdominal fullness and distension with hard constipation, yellow thick or greasy tongue coating, and pulses often large/flooding, slippery, tight, or floating with tension. Heat may be at the nutritive/blood level (jing/vascular heat) or at the organ/enteric level (fu/intestinal heat)—jing-level presents with extreme thirst, dry mouth that the patient wants to rinse but not swallow, and bleeding tendencies (indicative of Bai Hu Tang use); fu-level presents with obstinate constipation and abdominal hardness (indicative of Cheng Qi Tang use). Because the disease is in Yangming it generally lacks aversion to cold and patients often can eat; if heat ascends to the lungs it causes cough and sore throat. If an exterior syndrome or stomach cold is not recognized and aggressive purgation is applied, one may cause gastric collapse, hiccup, rebellious qi, profuse loss of fluids and sequelae. Clinical differentiation should focus on time of fever (afternoon tidal heat), stool and urine patterns, tongue coating (yellow vs white/greasy), pulse quality, and sweating, to choose between purgation, heat-clearing and fluid-replenishing, or warming/tonifying the middle. Zhang Zhongjing also warns against purgation in four situations: (1) frequent vomiting; (2) heart‑epigastric hardness (xinxia yingman, trapped chest) — purgation may precipitate unremitting diarrhea and death; (3) facial flushing/local facial redness — purgation may lead to urinary difficulty and jaundice; (4) Yangming with concurrent Taiyang/Shaoyang involvement (Yangming zhongfeng).
syndromes.herbal_treatments:
常用方劑與加減要點：
- 清熱養津（經熱首選）：白虎湯（高熱、極渴、舌苔多為白或薄黃但口燥欲漱、脈洪大）及其加減；遇津液虧耗甚者宜用竹葉石膏合方以復津液。 
- 攻下瀉實（腑熱、便秘）：大承氣湯（陽明腑實、腹滿、便秘結實）；病勢較輕者用小承氣或調胃承氣類。 
- 兼證處理：太陽兼陽明者以桂枝湯合大黃或適當解表後攻；少陽兼陽明者用大柴胡湯。 
- 胃虛寒或陽虛多寒象者：理中湯、吳茱萸湯、茯苓四逆湯等溫中補脾以固胃（胃下垂、嘔吐或脈遲者慎用攻下）。 
- 濕熱黃疸證：梔子豆豉湯等清中焦濕熱以解黃疸。 
- 發汗後或津傷者：於發汗方中加生薑、甘草、大棗或加人參、黃耆以補津氣；發汗過度後再攻下前務必問小便次數以判斷津液存亡（小便停則不可攻）。 
用藥注意事項：先辨表裏、寒熱、胃氣虛實；嚴禁在嘔多、心下硬滿、面含赤色或陽明兼他經（陽明中風）等四種情形下輕易攻下；攻下前稽查小便、舌脈與津液狀態，必要時先清熱養津或溫補中焦。 / Common formulas and prescribing principles: 
- Clear heat and replenish fluids (nutritive/blood‑level heat): Bai Hu Tang (White Tiger Decoction) for very high fever, intense thirst, dry mouth (may want to rinse but not swallow), and a flooding pulse; when fluids are severely depleted consider Zhu Ye Shi Gao (Bamboo Leaf + Gypsum) type modifications to restore fluids. 
- Drain down for organ/intestinal heat with constipation: Da Cheng Qi Tang (Major Order the Qi) for Yangming fu excess with abdominal fullness and hard stool; milder cases may use Xiao Cheng Qi Tang or Tiao Wei Cheng Qi variants. 
- Treat concomitant channels: if Taiyang coexists with Yangming consider Gui Zhi Tang plus Da Huang (or release the exterior before purgation); if Shaoyang coexists use Da Chai Hu Tang. 
- Stomach cold or spleen/stomach deficiency: Li Zhong Tang, Wu Zhu Yu Tang, or Fu Ling Si Ni Tang to warm and tonify the middle when cold/vacuity predominates (do not purge in these cases). 
- Damp‑heat with jaundice: Zhi Zi Dou Chi Tang and similar formulas to clear middle jiao damp‑heat and resolve jaundice. 
- After heavy sweating or when fluids are injured: add Sheng Jiang, Gan Cao, Da Zao (or Ren Shen, Huang Qi when indicated) to protect/replenish fluids and qi; always ask about urinary frequency—if urine is scant or absent do not purge. 
Prescribing cautions: always differentiate exterior vs interior and cold vs heat and assess stomach qi and fluid status before purgation. Do not attempt aggressive purgation in the following Zhang Zhongjing contraindications: (1) frequent/protracted vomiting, (2) heart‑epigastric hardness/trapped chest (xinxia yingman), (3) localized facial flushing/facial redness, (4) Yangming with concurrent Taiyang or Shaoyang involvement. Check tongue, pulse, stool and urine and consider clearing heat and restoring fluids or warming the middle before any harsh draining therapy.

syndromes.name: 少陽病 / Shaoyang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陽為半表半裏之證，常見胸脅苦滿、往來寒熱、口苦噁心等，病欲解時脈象可見緩和或變小，且解位常在寅至辰時分。脈正常伴噁心可為受孕，非病證。 / Shaoyang is a half‑exterior, half‑interior pattern often presenting with chest/hypochondriac fullness, alternating chills and fever, bitter taste and nausea. As the pattern resolves the pulse may relax or become fine, and resolution often occurs between the寅 and辰 hours. A normal pulse with nausea may indicate pregnancy rather than a disease pattern.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：小柴胡湯等和解少陽方，以柴胡為君調和表裡，臨證可按證加減或合用佐使藥。遇脈已一緩、症見轉輕，方藥可維持或下調。注意臨床禁忌：若脈正常且惡心為妊娠表現，應避免盲用和解少陽方。 / Common formulas: Xiao Chai Hu Tang (Minor Bupleurum Decoction) and other harmonizing Shaoyang prescriptions, with chaihu (Bupleurum) as the chief herb to harmonize the half‑exterior/half‑interior. Formulas are modified according to accompanying signs and the pulse. If the pulse has already relaxed (indicating resolution), doses or potency may be reduced. Caution: if the pulse is normal and nausea appears to be due to pregnancy, avoid indiscriminate use of harmonizing Shaoyang formulas.

syndromes.name: 太陰病 / Taiyin pattern
syndromes.description: 太陰以脾為主，病機為中焦脾胃運化失司，濕濁津液滯留於中，致腹脹滿、噁心嘔吐、食少納差、下利溏瀉，舌苔多為厚白或白膩，脈多見虛弱或有時浮數。若邪未盡於表，脈浮者宜解表以桂枝湯；若濕邪內盛而有寒，見自利不渴、四肢厥冷或後來手足自溫，宜用四逆類溫中化寒；濕飲內停者常見腹中隱痛或脹痛，按之能緩（喜按為虛，拒按為實），虛者補之、實者攻下或收斂。病程上常於亥至丑時（約21:00–03:00，夜半胃氣復）轉盛或轉衰；若脾家尚實、腐穢隨下利排出，往往於第七八日可自止。治法總攝：溫中健脾、化濕排津、收澀止痛，兼辨虛實用方。 / Taiyin centers on the Spleen: pathogenesis is failure of middle jiao (spleen–stomach) transport and transformation, with accumulation of damp turbid fluids in the middle. Typical manifestations are abdominal fullness/distension, nausea and vomiting (often of white turbid fluids), poor appetite, and watery, loose diarrhea. The tongue usually has a thick white or greasy-white coating; the pulse is often weak but may be floating when exterior involvement exists. If the pulse is floating use an exterior-resolving approach (Guizhi Tang). If internal cold–damp predominates with non-thirsty diarrhea or cold extremities (sometimes later relieved so that hands/feet feel warm), apply Sini-type warming formulas. Abdominal pain must be differentiated by palpation: pain relieved by pressure (likes pressure) suggests deficiency and needs tonification, whereas pain worse on pressure (resists pressure) indicates excess and may require purgation or dispersing/collecting strategies. Clinically Taiyin disorders often change at night (hai to chou hours, approx. 21:00–03:00) when stomach qi revives. If the spleen still has some strength, corrupted damp may be expelled by frequent diarrhea and the condition can remit around day seven or eight. Principle of treatment: warm the middle and strengthen the spleen, resolve damp and drain accumulated fluids, and use astringent/analgesic measures as indicated; choose formulas based on exterior vs interior, cold vs heat, and deficiency vs excess.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝湯：脈浮有表證以解表；四逆類（如四逆湯/通脈四逆類）：自利不渴、脾寒甚者溫中散寒；小建中湯：胃弱、脾氣虛寒、腹脹隱痛宜調補和中，方中重用芍藥以收斂止痛；真武湯：有水飲內停、脾陽虛兼寒者溫中破飲（方中乾薑常配用生附或炮附以破飲化濕）；桂枝加芍藥湯：脾腫腹脹、脹痛按之能緩者，加重芍藥以收斂止痛；桂枝加大黃湯：遇大實痛、拒按者可攻下散結，但遇脈弱或胃氣虛易動者宜減少大黃劑量。 / Guizhi Tang: release the exterior when pulse is floating. Sini-class formulas (e.g., Si Ni Tang or similar): for Taiyin with non-thirsty diarrhea and pronounced cold of the middle, warm the middle and rescue yang. Xiao Jian Zhong Tang: for stomach weakness and spleen qi deficiency with abdominal distension and aching pain; harmonizes the middle and uses increased Shaoyao to astringe and relieve pain. Zhenwu Tang: for retention of water/damp with spleen-yang deficiency and cold; warms the middle and disperses fluid stagnation (dry ginger combined with shengfu or paofu is often used to transform water). Guizhi Jia Shaoyao Tang: for spleen swelling, abdominal distension and pain that is relieved by pressure—heavy use of Shaoyao to astringe and contract tissues. Guizhi Jia Da Huang Tang: for large excess pain with resistance to pressure (firm obstruction) use purgation to disperse accumulation, but reduce Da Huang dosage when the pulse is weak or the stomach qi is easily over-stimulated.

syndromes.name: 少陰病 / Shaoyin pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰病多屬下焦腎陽虛、陰寒內盛。脈象多為沉而微細，主症以欲寐、嗜睡、手足乏力或手足逆冷（或偶見反溫）、譫語、吐利、小便淡白或小便不利為主。臨床上若陰脈浮起或夜半胃氣回升（子時至寅時欲食），為陽氣回復、病勢向愈之徵。嚴重徵象包括脈不至、下利止而頭暈、四逆、惡寒身踡、息高等亡陽症候，這類多為危象。若腎邪向膀胱傳入可見膀胱熱、小便帶血（必要時辨別腎結石或膀胱炎）。脈不至者可灸少陰七壯（太溪）以助回陽。治則以溫補腎陽、回陽固表、扶助中土為主，忌發汗及強攻下以免動血亡陽。 / Shaoyin pattern primarily reflects lower‑jiao Kidney yang deficiency with internal yin cold. The pulse is typically deep and fine. Core symptoms are marked somnolence, desire to sleep, weakness or coldness of the limbs (occasionally paradoxical warmth), delirium, vomiting and/or diarrhea, pale dilute urine or urinary difficulty. Clinically, a floating yin pulse or nocturnal return of stomach qi (awakening at midnight to early morning, roughly zi to yin hours) indicates returning yang and recovery. Grave signs include absent pulse, cessation of diarrhea with marked vertigo, extreme cold limbs with four‑fold reversal (si ni), marked aversion to cold with body contortion, and prolonged labored respiration — all signs of yang collapse and high mortality. Kidney pathology involving the bladder may produce urinary heat and hematuria; consider renal stones or cystitis. For absent pulse moxibustion at Taixi (seven cones) is recorded. Treatment principle is to warm and tonify Kidney yang, rescue/revive yang and stabilize the exterior; strictly avoid diaphoretics and strong purgation which can precipitate blood loss and further yang failure.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 代表方：真武湯（重用附子以溫腎回陽）；救逆與補血方：炙甘草湯、小建中湯；回陽救急方：四逆湯（遇危重採大劑，以兩計）；膀胱熱或腎結石相關小便帶血時可用豬苓湯或桃核承氣湯。臨床注意：慎防發汗及猛攻下，脈不至可用灸少陰七壯（太溪）。 / Representative formulas: Zhenwu Tang (commonly with substantial Fuzi doses to warm and restore Kidney yang). Rescue and circulatory support: Zhi Gan Cao Tang, Xiao Jian Zhong Tang. Emergency revival: Si Ni Tang (in critical cases given in large doses, traditionally measured in liang). For bladder heat or urinary bleeding related to stones: Zhu Ling Tang or Tao He Cheng Qi Tang. Clinical cautions: avoid diaphoretics and strong purgatives; if pulse is absent moxibustion at Taixi (seven cones) is recommended.

syndromes.name: 厥陰病 / Jueyin pattern
syndromes.description: 厥陰病為六經最深而變化繁多的一類證，常見寒熱交替或先寒後熱、先熱後厥。主症為手足厥冷（可達肘膝）、胸脅痞滿或胸腹脹悶、嘔逆吐利（得食即嘔為蚘厥）、煩躁不安或煩躁不得臥；可見脈象多變：脈微、脈細欲絕、脈促或脈滑。常兼見汗出傷津而口舌生瘡、下利甚或下利不止伴膿血、小便不利或赤澀、少腹或膀胱區疼痛等。病因病位屬肝經入裏、脾胃失和，並可伴有水結、血結、熱結或冷結等分型。危險徵象包括下利不止、汗出不止、脈微欲絕、手足厥逆持久（>五日）等，常提示陽氣虛脫或病情加深。治療綱領以護津不誤汗、復陰調營、和解變證為主，並須辨寒熱虛實：寒證以溫中回陽、溫陽利水、驅蟲止嘔；熱/結聚以清熱攻下、利小便通關；水血結聚分型施治；虛證慎用攻下或利水，必要時回陽救逆、扶正固護。飲食禁忌生冷、滑腸物與臭穢助蟲食物。 / Jueyin pattern is the deepest and most variable of the Six Channels, often showing alternating or sequential cold and heat. Cardinal signs are cold hands and feet (sometimes to elbow/knee), chest and hypochondrial fullness, nausea/vomiting (vomiting after eating is an anthelmintic sign), and intermittent or persistent agitation/restlessness (including inability to lie down). Pulse signs vary: faint/fine (mai wei/mai xi), imminent collapse (pulse nearly extinguished), rapid (mai cu) or slippery (mai hua) indicating interior heat. Complications include sweating injuring fluids with mouth ulcers, profuse or unremitting diarrhea often with pus and blood, difficulty or burning on urination, and lower abdominal or bladder pain. Pathomechanism involves liver-channel internal invasion and disharmony of spleen–stomach with possible water, blood, heat, or cold accumulations. Red flags are unceasing diarrhea, continuous sweating, faint pulse with cold extremities lasting >5 days — all suggestive of yang collapse and worsened prognosis. Treatment principles: protect fluids and avoid sweating in Jueyin, restore Yin and nutritive (ying) level, harmonize transformations, and differentiate cold/heat and deficiency/excess: warm the middle and rescue yang or expel parasites for cold patterns; clear constrained heat and promote bowel or urinary discharge for heat/accumulation; resolve water or blood stasis by pattern-specific methods; in deficient states avoid aggressive purgation and prioritize rescuing yang and supporting upright qi. Dietary avoidance: raw/cold foods, slippery foods and foul/odorous items that favor parasites or injure the middle.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治法總述：以復陰調營、護津不汗、和解變證為綱；兼辨寒熱虛實，寒證溫中回陽、驅蟲、溫陽利水；熱證清熱攻下、利小便通關；水血結聚分型用方。常用方劑與適應：烏梅丸（主蚘厥、久利、寒利帶膿血，溫中殺蟲、固護中焦）；真武湯（主下焦寒結、陽虛水停、小便不利，溫陽利水）；五苓散（主水結膀胱、小便不利、水腫）；桃核承氣湯（主下焦血結、逐瘀通小便）；豬苓湯/澤瀉類方（主熱結膀胱、小便赤澀、利水清熱）；小建中湯（主裡寒脘腹痛、調和中焦）；當歸四逆湯（治手足厥寒、脈細欲絕、回陽補血以溫經）；當歸四逆加吳茱萸生薑湯（內有胃寒、嘔逆、帶下等久寒證）；四逆湯/回陽救逆方（陽厥、真厥需回陽者）；白虎湯（遇脈滑兼裏熱、傷津需大劑生津之證）；白通湯與赤石脂禹餘糧類收澀劑（治下利不止、亡血下利者收止）。用藥要點：忌誤發汗於厥陰、虛證慎攻下、護津以免傷津耗液、下利久證用澀劑止利並扶正，遇陽脫以回陽救逆為先。 / Treatment summary: Restore Yin and the nutritive (ying) level, protect fluids and avoid inducing sweat, and harmonize transformation signs; differentiate cold/heat and deficiency/excess. Cold patterns: warm the middle, rescue yang, expel parasites, and warm/transform retained water. Heat/accumulation: clear constrained heat and promote bowel or urinary discharge. Water or blood accumulations are treated by pattern-specific formulas. Common formulas and indications: Wu Mei Wan (Wu Mei Wan, Black Plum Pill) — for anthelmintic Jueyin, chronic or cold dysentery with pus/blood, warms middle and expels parasites while supporting qi; Zhenwu Tang (Zhenwu Tang, True Warrior Decoction) — for lower-jiao cold accumulation, yang deficiency with water retention and urinary difficulty, warms yang and promotes urination; Wu Ling San (Wu Ling San, Five-Ingredient Powder with Poria) — for water accumulation in the bladder, urinary difficulty and edema; Taohe Chengqi Tang (Taohe Chengqi Tang, Peach-Pit Decoction to Order the Qi) — for blood accumulation in the lower jiao, drives out stasis and unblocks; Zhu Ling Tang / ze xie–type formulas (Zhu Ling Tang, Polyporus Decoction; formulas with Ze Xie) — for heat accumulation of the bladder with red, painful urination, clear heat and promote urination; Xiao Jian Zhong Tang (Xiao Jian Zhong Tang, Minor Construct the Middle) — for interior cold abdominal pain and stomach cold contributing to parasitic phenomena; Danggui Sini Tang (Danggui Sini Tang, Angelica Decoction for Frigid Extremities) — for cold hands/feet with fine/near-extinct pulse, warms channels and nourishes blood; Danggui Sini + Wuzhuyu Shengjiang (Danggui Sini jia Wuzhuyu Shengjiang) — when chronic gastric cold, vomiting or leukorrhea due to internal cold require warming and antiemetic action; Si Ni Tang / other rescue-yang formulas (Si Ni Tang, Frigid Extremities Decoction) — for true yang collapse with cold extremities requiring urgent resuscitation; Bai Hu Tang (Bai Hu Tang, White Tiger Decoction) — when slippery pulse indicates interior heat with injured fluids and need for strong clearing and fluid replenishment; Bai Tong Tang (Bai Tong Tang) and Chi Shizhi YuYuLiang Tang (pinyin for 赤石脂禹餘糧湯) or astringent formulas — for unremitting diarrhea/bleeding diarrhea to astringe and stop leakage. Therapeutic cautions: do not induce sweating in Jueyin; avoid aggressive purgatives in deficient patients; protect and restore body fluids; use astringents to stop profuse diarrhea while supporting upright qi; prioritize rescuing yang when signs of collapse appear.

syndromes.name: 中風 / Zhongfeng (wind attack)
syndromes.description: 太陽病的一種表證類型，特徵為發熱、汗出、惡風及脈緩，表證有汗而不解者。 / A Taiyang exterior subtype characterized by fever, sweating, aversion to wind and a relaxed pulse; sweating may not relieve the illness.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用桂枝湯類解表發汗劑以和營衛，必要時調補津液。 / Often treated with Guizhi-type formulas (e.g., Guizhi Tang) to harmonize ying and wei and induce sweating, with fluid-replenishing herbs as needed.

syndromes.name: 溫病 / Wenbing (warm disease)
syndromes.description: 因先傷寒後轉熱證或因汗液大量流失而表現為發熱、口渴且不惡寒之溫熱病候。 / A warm-disease pattern arising after cold injury or substantial fluid loss, presenting with fever and thirst without aversion to cold.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以清熱、生津、滋陰為主，兼顧補液以防脫水。 / Treatment focuses on clearing heat and generating fluids (shengjin), nourishing yin and replenishing fluids to prevent dehydration.

syndromes.name: 風溫 / Fengwen (wind-warmth)
syndromes.description: 風溫類型屬於太陽病中津液大損之表熱，表現為自汗出、身灼熱、脈浮以及身重嗜睡等。 / A wind-warmth variant of Taiyang with severe fluid loss presenting as spontaneous sweating, burning body sensation, floating pulse, heaviness and somnolence.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以解表並兼生津補液為要，並慎用發汗劑；常酌用滋陰生津藥。 / Treatment aims to release the exterior while nourishing fluids; use diaphoresis cautiously and include yin-nourishing, fluid-generating herbs.

syndromes.name: 真寒假熱 / true cold, false heat
syndromes.description: 表現為表面似熱而內裡實寒的證候，常見面頰鮮紅而呼吸不溫、脈浮數而無力等。 / A pattern in which the exterior appears hot while the interior is truly cold; often presents with bright cheeks, cool exhalation, and a floating-rapid yet forceless pulse.
