Common variants and indications: 1) Shengjiang Xiexin Tang (use more fresh ginger) — indicated when watery diarrhea, marked intestinal water accumulation and borborygmus predominate; fresh ginger disperses water in the stomach. 2) Gancao Xiexin Tang (heavy licorice) — for stomach qi deficiency with «guest qi», undigested food not present but belching/dry hiccup; gancao moderates and allows medicines to remain longer in the middle. 3) Da Huang Huanglian Xiexin Tang — for moist epigastric «pi» with soft abdomen, and for severe upper‑fire/bleeding patterns (upper heat predominates). 4) Fuzhi Xiexin Tang — when exterior collapse/cold with sweating and «pi» requires warming and consolidating (aconite processed). 5) Add Wuling San when there is true water retention with thirst, irritability and scant urine. 6) Use Ten Jujube Decoction / Da Xianxiong approaches only in severe chest/diaphragmatic water accumulation (attack rapidly and with caution). Tongue/coating guidance: yellow coating indicates interior heat—use huangqin/huanglian; yellow and very dry calls for stronger heat‑clearing and fluid‑generating agents (e.g. gypsum); thin‑white suggests lingering exterior cold or predominating stomach cold—adjust ganjiang vs shengjiang accordingly. Therapeutic principle: harmonize Shaoyang and the middle, descend rebellious qi, transform phlegm‑water and clear focal heat while replenishing stomach fluids; modify according to cold/heat, deficiency/excess and presence of water retention.

syndromes.name: 生薑瀉心湯證 / Shengjiang Xiexin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 以下利、腹中雷鳴、心下痞硬並伴乾噫食臭、脅下水氣為主，屬寒熱雜結與水飲內停。 / Pattern with diarrhea, loud abdominal borborygmus, epigastric hardness with foul belching and hypochondriac water; represents cold-heat complex with internal water retention.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：生薑、甘草、人參、乾薑、黃芩、半夏、黃連、大棗（與半夏瀉心湯類似，重用生薑）。 / Formula: Shengjiang, Gancao, Renshen, Ganjiang, Huangqin, Banxia, Huanglian, Dazao (similar to Banxia Xiexin Tang with emphasis on Shengjiang).

syndromes.name: 甘草瀉心湯證 / Gancao Xiexin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 胃中虛弱、客氣上結所致之痞滿，穀不化、腹中雷鳴、乾嘔、心煩而不得安，重用甘草以和緩補助。 / Pattern of stomach qi deficiency with upward-bound qi causing epigastric pi, undigested food, borborygmus, dry retching and agitation; Gancao is emphasized to harmonize and retain substances.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：甘草、黃芩、乾薑、人參、半夏、黃連、大棗（甘草用量較重）。 / Formula: Gancao, Huangqin, Ganjiang, Renshen, Banxia, Huanglian, Dazao (with heavier Gancao).

syndromes.name: 大黃黃連瀉心湯證 / Da Huang Huang Lian Xiexin Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Da Huang Huang Lian Xiexin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 表裏熱盛、上焦蓄熱或血熱之象，心下痞按之濡，脈見浮或上焦火盛者用之。 / Pattern of combined exterior‑interior heat with accumulation in the upper burner or blood heat; epigastric pi soft on pressure and floating pulse at upper positions indicate use of this pattern.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：大黃、黃連（以麻沸湯泡取藥氣）。 / Formula: Da Huang and Huang Lian (extracted by hot infusion/soaking - mafeitang).

syndromes.name: 附子瀉心湯證 / Fuzi Xiexin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 心下痞伴表虛惡寒、汗出者，表弱裏躁，兼用炮附子固表溫中以止汗並助降裏熱。 / Pattern of epigastric pi with exterior deficiency (aversion to cold) and sweating; processed Fuzi is used to secure the exterior and warm the center while addressing interior disturbance.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：大黃、黃連、黃芩、炮附子（附子取汁）。 / Formula: Da Huang, Huang Lian, Huang Qin with processed Fuzi (Fuzi juice added).

syndromes.name: 十棗湯證 / Shi Zao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 三焦網絡或胸膈大量水飲積聚，致胸下脹滿、引脅痛、嘔而氣短，表解而裡不和者。 / Pattern of extensive sanjiao-mediated water accumulation in the chest/mediastinum causing epigastric fullness, hypochondriac pain, retching with dyspnea; occurs when exterior is released but interior not harmonized.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：芫花、甘遂、大戟、大棗（研末、以棗湯服）。 / Formula: Yuanhua, Gansui, Daji with jujubes (powdered herbs taken with jujube decoction).

syndromes.name: 赤石脂禹餘糧湯證 / Chishizhi Yuyuliang Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 主治下焦泄利不止，或下利清穀，伴心下痞硬；以澀劑收澀止利。 / Treats unremitting lower‑jiao diarrhea or watery stools with undigested food and epigastric hardness; uses astringent substances to stop leakage.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 赤石脂、禹餘糧（煎服） / chishizhi, yuyuliang (decoction)

syndromes.name: 旋覆代赭石湯證 / Xuanfu Daizheshi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 主治心下痞硬、噫氣不除及痰飲內阻所致的反胃、噁心嘔逆。 / Treats epigastric hardness and persistent belching due to phlegm‑fluid obstruction causing refractory regurgitation and nausea.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 旋覆花、人參、生薑、代赭石、大棗、炙甘草、半夏 / xuanfuhua, renshen, shengjiang, daizhesh (daizheshi), dazao, zhi gancao, banxia

syndromes.name: 桂枝人參湯證 / Guizhi Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 外證未解兼寒利或腸胃虛寒致下利不止，伴心下痞硬，為表裏夾雜之寒利證。 / For simultaneous exterior and interior cold‑diarrhea or cold diarrhea with middle jiao deficiency causing persistent diarrhea and epigastric hardness; harmonizes exterior and tonifies middle.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝、炙甘草、白朮、人參、乾薑 / guizhi, zhi gancao, baizhu, renshen, ganjiang

syndromes.name: 瓜蒂散證 / Guadi San pattern
syndromes.description: 用於膈上梗阻（胸中痞硬、氣上衝咽喉、不得息）需用吐法排除上方痰塞或異物；亡血虛家禁用。 / Used for obstruction above the diaphragm (chest hardness, upward qi to throat, difficulty breathing) where emesis is indicated to expel phlegm or lodged material; contraindicated in blood‑depleted patients.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 瓜蒂、赤小豆、香豉（或豆豉）及湯劑佐用 / guadi, chixiaodou, xiangchi (or douchi) decocted with hot water

syndromes.name: 白虎加人參湯證 / Bai Hu Jia Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Bai Hu Jia Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 主治表裏俱熱、時汗惡風、大渴且舌乾欲飲甚者；以石膏清熱、以人參補津。 / Treats simultaneous exterior and interior heat with sweating, aversion to wind, great thirst and a very dry tongue; gypsum clears heat while ginseng restores fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 石膏、人參（兼用白虎湯藥如知母、粳米、炙甘草視證加減） / shigao, renshen (plus typical Bai Hu components such as zhimu, jingmi, zhi gancao as indicated)

syndromes.name: 麻黃杏仁甘草石膏湯證 / Ma Huang Xingren Gancao Shigao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 麻黃杏仁甘草石膏湯證
syndromes.name_en: Ma Huang Xingren Gancao Shigao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 用於汗出而喘、但無大熱者，主肺熱或胸中熱盛導致喘咳兼汗出。 / For sweating with wheezing but without high fever, addressing lung‑heat or chest heat causing cough/asthma with sweating.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 麻黃、杏仁、炙甘草、石膏 / mahuang, xingren, zhi gancao, shigao

syndromes.name: 黃芩加半夏生薑湯證 / Huangqin plus Banxia Shengjiang Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Huangqin plus Banxia Shengjiang Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 腸胃熱利或伴嘔吐且有腹痛者，兼用黃芩以清腸胃之熱，半夏、生薑以止嘔化痰。 / Enteric or intestinal heat-dysentery with vomiting and abdominal pain; uses huangqin to clear intestinal heat and banxia/shengjiang to stop vomiting and transform phlegm.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 黃芩、芍藥、甘草、大棗、半夏、生薑。 / Scutellaria (huangqin), peony (shaoyao), licorice (gancao), jujube (dazao), pinellia (banxia), fresh ginger (shengjiang).

syndromes.name: 黃芩湯證 / Huangqin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 腸熱所致的熱利或腸炎之證，特點為熱利、腹痛絞痛且表證可能已解，主清腸熱止痛。 / Pattern of intestinal heat causing dysentery/enteritis, characterized by hot diarrhea and colicky abdominal pain; treats by clearing intestinal heat and relieving pain.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 黃芩、甘草、芍藥、大棗。 / Scutellaria (huangqin), licorice (gancao), peony (shaoyao), jujube (dazao).

syndromes.name: 黃連湯證 / Huanglian Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 上熱下寒、胸膈有熱及嘔吐瀉泄並存的證候，主清上焦熱、和中止吐。 / Pattern of heat in the chest with cold below, presenting with vomiting and diarrhea; treats by clearing upper burner heat and harmonizing the middle burner to stop vomiting.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 黃連、甘草、乾薑、桂枝、人參、半夏、大棗。 / Coptis (huanglian), licorice (gancao), dried ginger (ganjiang), cinnamon twig (guizhi), ginseng (renshen), pinellia (banxia), jujube (dazao).

syndromes.name: 桂枝附子湯證 / Guizhi Fuzi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 傷寒病後風濕相搏、身體關節痠痛、脈浮虛而濇者，用以解表祛風並溫經散寒。 / Post-shanghan wind-damp invasion with arthralgia and a floating, deficient, rough pulse; treats by releasing the exterior, expelling wind, and warming the channels to dispel cold-damp.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝、附子、生薑、炙甘草、大棗。 / Cinnamon twig (guizhi), prepared aconite (fuzi), fresh ginger (shengjiang), honey-fried licorice (zhi gancao), jujube (dazao).

syndromes.name: 去桂枝加白朮湯證 / Qu Guizhi Jia Baizhu Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Qu Guizhi Jia Baizhu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 主要用於大便溏者之風濕證，白朮重用以健脾燥濕，附子助行表濕。 / Pattern for wind-damp with loose stools; Baizhu is emphasized to strengthen the spleen and dry dampness while Fuzi mobilizes damp from the exterior.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 白朮、炙甘草、附子、大棗、生薑。 / Atractylodes (baizhu), honey-fried licorice (zhi gancao), prepared aconite (fuzi), jujube (dazao), fresh ginger (shengjiang).

syndromes.name: 甘草附子湯證 / Gancao Fuzi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 風濕相搏導致骨節劇痛、汗出、短氣、小便不利等證，主以溫陽行氣、散風除濕並助利小便。 / Wind-damp invasion with severe arthralgia, sweating, shortness of breath, and urinary difficulty; treats by warming yang, mobilizing qi, dispelling wind-damp, and facilitating urination.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 甘草、附子、白朮、桂枝。 / Licorice (gancao), prepared aconite (fuzi), atractylodes (baizhu), cinnamon twig (guizhi).

syndromes.name: 太陽陽明 / Taiyang–Yangming transition
syndromes.description: 由太陽病發汗或用桂枝、麻黃、葛根等過度，津液耗散轉入陽明的證候，特點為發汗後脾約與津液傷損。 / Transition from Taiyang to Yangming due to excessive sweating or overuse of Guizhi/Mahuang/Gegen, causing fluid loss and constrained spleen; characterized by post‑sweating fluid depletion.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治法重在調理汗出與補津，視情可調整桂枝湯類處方。 / Treatment focuses on balancing sweating and replenishing fluids; Guizhi-type formulas are adjusted according to presentation.

syndromes.name: 正陽陽明 / Zhengyang Yangming pattern
syndromes.description: 指胃家實證，腸內實結導致大便阻滯，表現為中脘拒按、舌苔黃燥、大渴與便秘。 / True interior Yangming with bowel impaction in the stomach/large intestine causing obstruction; presents with midepigastric guarding, yellow‑dry tongue coating, great thirst, and constipation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以承氣湯類（如大承氣湯、小承氣湯）下法為主以通便泄熱。 / Treated primarily with Chengqi decoctions (e.g., Da Chengqi Tang, Xiao Chengqi Tang) to purge and clear interior heat.

syndromes.name: 少陽陽明 / Shaoyang–Yangming pattern
syndromes.description: 少陽病轉入陽明時，常見利小便同時胃中燥實及大便難的混合證候。 / Shaoyang transitioning into Yangming with simultaneous urination and gastric dryness leading to difficult stools; a mixed Shaoyang–Yangming presentation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 兼顧和解少陽與清胃燥實，常用小柴胡加導下或化燥勸下之法。 / Treatment harmonizes Shaoyang and clears gastric dryness, often combining Xiao Chai Hu approaches with purgation as needed.

syndromes.name: 陽明中風 / Yangming Zhongfeng (Yangming wind attack)
syndromes.description: 陽明熱盛而伴有風症狀，兼見口苦、咽乾、腹滿、微喘、發熱、惡寒，脈浮而緊。 / A presentation of pronounced Yangming interior heat with wind-like features, marked by bitter taste, dry throat, abdominal fullness, mild dyspnea, fever, aversion to cold, and a floating-tense pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 視兼證而治，若同太陽表證用桂枝湯加大黃；若為少陽兼證，則用大柴胡湯。 / Treat according to concomitant patterns; if accompanied by Taiyang exterior signs use Guizhi Decoction plus Da Huang; if combined with Shaoyang use Da Chai Hu Tang.

syndromes.name: 中寒 / Zhonghan (middle cold)
syndromes.description: 陽明或中焦虛寒，不能進食，伴小便不利、手足局部汗出等胃寒證候。 / Middle Jiao cold due to stomach deficiency, presenting with inability to eat, scanty urination, and localized hand‑foot sweating consistent with stomach cold.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 依輕重可用吳茱萸湯、理中湯或茯苓四逆湯等溫中回陽方。 / Depending on severity use Wu Zhu Yu Tang, Li Zhong Tang, or Fuling Sini Tang to warm the middle and restore yang.

syndromes.name: 固瘕 / Gudan (stubborn intestinal mass)
syndromes.description: 長期胃腸停滯、下利與初硬後溏、食穀不化，形成頑固堆積或虛寒性瘕塊。 / Chronic stagnation in the intestines with persistent diarrhea, stools initially hard then loose, undigested food, producing stubborn masses often due to deficient-cold.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 依證可用甘草乾薑湯或吳茱萸湯等溫中方劑調理。 / Treat with warming middle formulas such as Gan Cao Gan Jiang Tang or Wu Zhu Yu Tang depending on presentation.

syndromes.name: 陽明中風兼表證 / Yangming pattern with concurrent exterior signs
syndromes.name_en: Yangming pattern with concurrent exterior signs
syndromes.description: 陽明裏實同時伴有太陽或少陽表證，出現表裏夾雜的脈象與發熱表現，攻下需慎重。 / Yangming interior excess coexisting with Taiyang or Shaoyang exterior signs, producing mixed pulse and fever patterns; purgation must be used cautiously.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 若同太陽證可用桂枝湯加大黃，若同少陽證則用大柴胡湯；總以先解表為要。 / If accompanied by Taiyang signs consider Guizhi Tang plus Da Huang; if with Shaoyang use Da Chai Hu Tang — prioritize resolving the exterior first.

syndromes.name: 梔子豆豉湯證 / Zhizi Douchi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 主治中焦濕熱，常見身目發黃、舌苔厚黃及小便不利者。 / Treats middle-jiao damp-heat; commonly presents with body/skin jaundice, thick yellow tongue coating, and difficult urination.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 梔子、豆豉等清熱利濕藥物為主。 / Formulation centered on Zhizi and Douchi to clear heat and drain dampness.

syndromes.name: 竹葉石膏湯證 / Zhu Ye Shi Gao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Zhu Ye Shi Gao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 主治津液傷損、營熱交迫，表現為額微汗出、小便不利、口燥等，兼能益津清熱。 / For fluid depletion with heat at the ying/nutritive level and yangming-type fluid loss; presents with slight forehead sweating, scanty urination, dry mouth; replenishes fluids and clears heat.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 竹葉、石膏、人參等養營益津、清熱藥物。 / Herbs such as Zhuye, Shigao, and Renshen to nourish the ying, replenish fluids, and clear heat.

syndromes.name: 大承氣湯證 / Da Chengqi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 證屬陽明腑實熱結：外感或內傷化熱壅遏胃腸，熱熾蒸耗津液，腸中燥屎不下。主症：數日不通或大便硬結難下、腹脹滿且按之尤甚、腹痛，常見潮熱或持續發熱、有時汗出而熱不解；小便少或不利。舌乾，苔黃至焦黑或脫落，舌質乾燥，脈多滑數或數而有力。治則以急攻瀉下、攻堅通腑、泄腸中之熱並兼護津陰。辨證要點為實熱腸中燥結（以腹滿按痛、舌苔黃黑、脈滑數、便秘為主），須與濕阻、嚴重陰虛或虛寒等鑑別。臨床注意：輕者可用小承氣或和劑緩攻；濕重或小便不利可合五苓散或先和化；攻下前應詳察小便、舌脈與腹診，攻下後監測脈象、出血或膿血便及腹痛變化，若出現譫語、持續高熱、血便或腹痛不解，當懷疑熱毒或瘀血改方。禁忌或慎用於陰虛津傷、久瀉體虛、孕婦、極度虛弱或脫水者。 / Pattern: Yangming fu excess with interior heat-binding. Pathomechanism: external or internal pathogen transforms to intense heat lodged in stomach/intestines, steaming and consuming fluids so feces become dry and bound. Key signs: several days without stool or hard difficult stools; marked abdominal fullness and pain worse on pressure; tidal or persistent fever (may persist despite sweating); occasionally profuse sweating; scanty or obstructed urination. Tongue dry with yellow to dark/black scorched or denuded coating; pulse often slippery and rapid or rapid and forceful. Principle: rapid purgation to drain accumulation, clear intestinal heat and protect yin. Diagnostic focus: true excess-heat obstruction of the bowel (distinguish from damp obstruction, severe yin deficiency or cold deficiency). Clinical notes: mild cases use Xiao Chengqi Tang or harmonizing preparations; if damp predominates or urine is scanty combine with Wu Ling San or start with a gentler formula. Before and during purgation assess urine, tongue, pulse and abdominal findings; monitor after purgation for persistent rapid pulse, bloody/purulent stools, ongoing pain or delirium — these suggest heat-toxin or blood stasis and require changing therapy. Contraindications/precautions: avoid or modify in yin-deficient heat, chronic deficient diarrhea, pregnancy, extreme weakness or dehydration.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方劑：大承氣湯。君藥：大黃；臣藥：厚朴、枳實；佐使：芒硝。作用與主治：大黃瀉熱攻積、破結下行、泄腸熱以通便；厚朴行氣寬中、消脹助行大腸通滯；枳實破氣散結、推動積滯下行；芒硝入腸潤下、軟堅散結並助瀉且緩和大黃耗津。用法劑量：臨床常用較重大劑量急攻，但必先辨證為真實腸內燥結（腹滿按痛、舌乾苔黃黑、脈滑數且便秘）方可速下；證輕用小承氣或和劑緩攻；濕重或小便不利、腹脹伴便溏者可合五苓散或先用和劑。變方與注意：譫語、神志昏亂或熱甚仍以攻下為主；若瀉後見脈數不解、血便或膿血便、腹痛持續，宜改用清熱解毒或活血化瘀方並另行檢查瘀血熱毒。禁忌/慎用：陰虛津傷、久瀉體虛、孕婦、極度虛弱或脫水者禁用或改方減量；用藥前後須密切監測舌、脈、小便與腹診，勿盲用或過度攻下以免耗傷津液產生危險。 / Formula: Da Chengqi Tang. Chief: Da Huang (Rheum). Ministers: Hou Po (Magnolia bark), Zhi Shi (immature bitter orange). Assistant/Envoy: Mang Xiao (mirabilite). Actions and indications: Da Huang drains heat, breaks accumulation, directs stagnation downward and clears intestinal heat to produce bowel movements; Hou Po moves qi, relieves distention and facilitates intestinal passage; Zhi Shi breaks qi stagnation and propels accumulated obstruction downward; Mang Xiao enters the intestines to moisten and soften hard stool, disperse firmness, assist purgation and moderate Da Huang’s injuring of fluids. Dosage/use: typically given in relatively large, rapid purgative doses after confirming true dry intestinal accumulation (abdominal fullness with pressure pain, dry yellow/black coating, slippery rapid pulse with constipation); milder cases use Xiao Chengqi Tang or harmonizing formulas for gentler purgation; if damp predominates or urine is scanty or abdominal distention coexists with loose stools combine with Wu Ling San or begin with a softer formula. Modifications/monitoring: in delirium or severe heat obstruction still prioritize purgation; after purgation, if rapid pulse persists, bloody or purulent stools appear, or pain continues, switch to detoxifying (heat-toxin clearing) or blood-invigorating formulas and evaluate for heat-toxin or blood stasis. Contraindications/precautions: avoid or modify in yin-deficient heat, chronic deficiency diarrhea, pregnancy, extreme weakness or dehydration. Assess and monitor tongue, pulse, urine and abdominal signs before and during treatment to avoid overuse that may exhaust fluids and cause serious complications.

syndromes.name: 小承氣湯證 / Xiao Chengqi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 小承氣湯證為陽明腑實較輕之型，主症為下焦或小腸積滯，以少腹（關元一帶）脹滿、微煩為主。常見病程是在傷寒或太陽病解表後，經吐、下或發汗後仍有腹脹不舒；舌苔偏黃或黃濁，脈滑而虛或滑數，常見小便利但大便初硬後轉溏。證屬裡實但津液未盡，宜用較和緩之瀉下劑以試觀察能否小便利、出矢氣而漸通；若舌乾無津、腹脹痛劇或小便少、脈實數，或濕熱甚重者，應改用大承氣湯或合五苓散等以處理濕熱並猛攻燥結。用藥原則為君（大黃）、臣（厚朴）、佐（枳實）合用，劑量較大承氣湯和緩；臨床常先少量試服，觀察大便、小便利與矢氣情況，能小便利且症緩則可加量；若見津傷、口舌乾燥或腹痛劇烈、尿少、脈實數者則禁用或慎用小承氣，改用更攻或兼治濕之方。臨床亦注意辨別濕熱、濕重或已轉燥實之不同階段，以決定加減或換方。 / Xiao Chengqi Tang pattern is a milder form of Yangming organ excess characterized by accumulation in the lower bowel or small intestine, localized to the lower abdomen (around Guanyuan). It often follows febrile disorders (such as shanghan or resolved taiyang disease) after sweating, vomiting or purging; typical signs are lower abdominal/suprapubic distention and slight vexation, yellow or yellow-dense tongue coating, a slippery pulse that may be weak or slippery-rapid, sometimes frequent urination, and an initial hard stool that later becomes loose. Because there is interior excess but body fluids are not yet exhausted, a gentler purgative is indicated to test whether small defecation or passage of flatus occurs and to mobilize stagnation. If the tongue is dry with no fluids, abdominal pain is severe, urine is scant, or the pulse is full and rapid—or if damp-heat predominates—escalate to Da Chengqi Tang or combine with formulas such as Wu Ling San to address damp-heat. Therapeutic principles: use the trio of Da Huang, Hou Po and Zhi Shi in milder doses than Da Chengqi Tang; start with a small trial dose, observe stool, urine and flatus, then increase or change formula according to response. Avoid or use great caution when yin/fluids are depleted.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主方：大黃、厚朴、枳實為君臣佐藥合用（劑量較大承氣湯和緩）。用法：先少量試服，觀察小便利、矢氣或大便鬆化情況，若有小便利再按需加量。臨證若濕重、小便少或腹痛劇者，考慮改用大承氣湯或與五苓散合用；若舌乾、口渴、津液竭者禁用或慎用，避免傷陰。臨床應辨別濕、熱、燥之程度以加減藥量與合方。 / Main herbs: Da Huang (Rhei Rhizoma), Hou Po (Magnoliae Cortex), Zhi Shi (Aurantii Fructus Immaturus) used together as the principal trio, but in milder doses than Da Chengqi Tang. Administration: begin with a small test dose and observe for small defecation, passage of flatus, or loosening of stool; if a clinical response occurs, increase dose as needed. If damp predominates with scant urine or severe abdominal pain, consider switching to Da Chengqi Tang or combining with Wu Ling San to address damp-heat; if the tongue is dry and body fluids are depleted, avoid or use Xiao Chengqi Tang with great caution to prevent further yin injury. Adjust dosing and formula according to the stage and severity of damp, heat and dryness.

syndromes.name: 二陽併病 / Two Yang combined disease
syndromes.description: 太陽證已罷，但出現潮熱、手足汗出、大小便不利及譫語，為二陽併病，宜攻下以大承氣湯。 / After the Taiyang pattern has ceased, tidal fever, sweating of hands/feet, difficulty with defecation and delirium indicate Two Yang combined disease; treat with purgation (Da Chengqi Tang).
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 大承氣湯 / Da Chengqi Tang

syndromes.name: 三陽合病 / Three Yang combined disease
syndromes.description: 太陽、少陽、陽明三經同時受病，表證與裏實並存，表虛裏實或濕熱內結，表現為腹滿、身重、不能轉側、口不仁、面垢與譫語等。 / Concurrent involvement of Taiyang, Shaoyang, and Yangming—exterior signs with interior excess or damp-heat accumulation—manifesting as abdominal fullness, heavy body, inability to turn in bed, loss of taste, dirty facial complexion, and delirium.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 視證而用攻下（如大承氣湯）或清補津液（如白虎湯） / Treat by purgation if interior excess (e.g., Da Chengqi Tang) or replenish fluids/clear heat if spontaneous sweating (e.g., Bai Hu Tang)

syndromes.name: 麻子仁丸證 / Ma Ren Wan pattern
syndromes.description: 脈浮而濇、小便數、脾約致小腸燥屎結聚，屬小腸燥結之證，主以潤腸通滯為治。 / Pattern of small‑intestine dryness and impaction with a floating‑slippery/rough pulse, frequent urination, and constrained spleen leading to dry hard stools; treatment focuses on moistening the intestines and gradually unblocking.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 麻子仁、芍藥、枳實（炙）、大黃（去皮）、厚朴（炙，去皮）、杏仁（去皮尖）。 / Hemp seed (Ma Zi Ren), White Peony (Bai Shao), Immature Bitter Orange (Zhi Shi, fried), Rhubarb (Da Huang, peeled), Magnolia Bark (Hou Po, fried, peeled), Apricot Kernel (Xing Ren, depitted).

syndromes.name: 梔子柏皮湯證 / Zhizi Baipi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 用於身黃發熱、尿量正常或通利、無明顯腹脹且表裏無實證者；清三焦瘀熱以除黃。 / Pattern treated by Zhizi Baipi Tang: for fever with whole‑body jaundice where urination is not obstructed and abdominal distention is absent; clears heat‑stasis in the three jiao to resolve jaundice.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 梔子、炙甘草、黃柏 / Zhizi (Gardenia), roasted Gan Cao (Licorice), Huang Bai (Phellodendron)

syndromes.name: 麻黃連軺赤小豆湯證 / Ma Huang Lianqiao Chi Xiao Dou Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Ma Huang Lianqiao Chi Xiao Dou Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 用於傷寒後表寒未解或表寒束熱、身發黃且無汗者；亦常用於濕黏瘙癢等皮膚病。 / Pattern treated by Ma Huang Lianqiao Chi Xiao Dou Tang: for post‑shanghan presentations with constrained exterior cold and jaundice without sweating; also used for sticky damp pruritic skin disorders.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 麻黃、赤小豆、連翹（炙）、杏仁、大棗、生梓白皮、炙甘草、生薑 / Ma Huang (Ephedra), Chi Xiao Dou (Adzuki bean), Lianqiao (Forsythia, roasted), Xingren (Apricot kernel), Da Zao (Jujube), Zibuipi/Sangbaipi (Catalpa/Morus bark), roasted Gan Cao (Licorice), Shengjiang (Fresh ginger)

syndromes.name: 朮附湯證 / Zhu Fu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 用於內有寒濕滯留者，發汗解表後裏濕未去的寒濕證。 / Pattern treated by Zhu Fu Tang: for retention of internal cold‑damp, especially when exterior has been released by sweating but interior damp/cold remains.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 朮、附子等 / Atractylodes (Zhu), Fu Zi (Aconite), etc.

syndromes.name: 少陽中風 / Shaoyang wind attack / Shaoyang wind attack
syndromes.name_zh: 少陽中風 / Shaoyang wind attack
syndromes.description: 少陽兼有太陽表證，表邪進而傷津液，出現耳聾、目赤、胸中滿而煩等症，誤用吐下或發汗易傷氣血。 / Shaoyang pattern with concurrent exterior (Taiyang) signs; exterior pathogen damages fluids causing hearing loss, red eyes, chest fullness with vexation; improper vomiting, purging or sweating can injure qi and blood.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 小柴胡湯、柴胡加龍骨牡蠣湯（視有無驚悸或心悸而定）。 / Xiao Chai Hu Tang; Chai Hu Jia Long Gu Mu Li Tang if palpitations/fright occur.

syndromes.name: 桂枝加芍藥湯證 / Guizhi plus Shaoyao Decoction pattern
syndromes.description: 太陰腹滿時痛、舌苔多為白，因脾腫而需收斂者可用本方以芍藥加重收斂止痛。 / Pattern for Taiyin abdominal fullness with intermittent pain and white tongue coating due to spleen swelling; the formula emphasizes increased Shaoyao to astringe and relieve pain.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方中：桂枝三兩，芍藥六兩，甘草二兩（炙），生薑三兩（切），大棗十二枚。煎法如書。 / Formula (Chinese): Guizhi 3 liang, Shaoyao 6 liang, Glycyrrhiza (roasted) 2 liang, Shengjiang 3 liang (sliced), Jujube 12 pieces; decoct as directed in text.

syndromes.name: 桂枝加大黃湯證 / Guizhi plus Da Huang Decoction pattern
syndromes.name_en: Guizhi plus Da Huang Decoction pattern
syndromes.description: 用於腹部大實痛、拒按有實證者，藉大黃下攻泄實。 / Indicated for severe, solid abdominal pain with guarding (excess pattern); Da Huang is used to purge and relieve obstruction.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方中：桂枝二兩，芍藥三兩，甘草二兩（炙），生薑三兩（切），大棗十二枚，大黃一兩。煎服法如書。 / Formula (Chinese): Guizhi 2 liang, Shaoyao 3 liang, Glycyrrhiza (roasted) 2 liang, Shengjiang 3 liang (sliced), Jujube 12 pieces, Da Huang 1 liang; decoct and administer as directed.

syndromes.name: 太陰中風 / Taiyin wind-attack (Taiyin Zhongfeng)
syndromes.description: 太陰中風見四肢煩疼，脈見陽微陰澀，常見於病程欲愈或殘留氣機抵抗時。 / Taiyin wind-attack presenting with limb aching and vexation and pulse pattern of slight yang and rough yin; often appears in convalescence or when residual qi is opposing the pathogen.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 依證而治，無單一固定方，重在扶正理脾、調氣血。 / Treat according to presentation; focus on supporting the upright qi, regulating the spleen and harmonizing qi–blood.

syndromes.name: 四逆湯類證 / Sini Tang class patterns
syndromes.description: 四逆類方用於中焦陽虛、寒盛致下利、四肢逆冷及自利不渴等太陰寒證，重在溫中回陽、逐飲。 / Sini Tang-type formulas are for middle-jiao yang deficiency and cold causing diarrhea, cold extremities and diarrhea without thirst; focus on warming the middle, restoring yang and resolving retained fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用乾薑、附子、人參等溫中回陽藥物，代表方包括四逆湯、通脈四逆湯、真武湯。 / Commonly uses Ganjiang, Fuzi, Renshen and other warming herbs; representative formulas include Sini Tang, Tongmai Sini Tang, and Zhenwu Tang.

syndromes.name: 少陰中風 / Shaoyin wind attack
syndromes.description: 少陰中風為少陰證的一種表現，本來脈應沉微而細；若見脈陽微且陰脈浮起，為陽氣回復、病勢欲愈之象。 / Shaoyin wind attack: a variant presentation of Shaoyin pattern where the pulse is typically deep and fine; the appearance of a slight yang pulse with a floating yin pulse indicates return of yang and impending recovery.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 參照少陰病之治法，以溫中救陽為主，如炙甘草湯、小建中湯、四逆湯等。 / Refer to Shaoyin pattern treatments: warming the center and rescuing yang, e.g., Zhi Gan Cao Tang, Xiao Jian Zhong Tang, Si Ni Tang, etc.

syndromes.name: 麻黃附子細辛湯證 / Ma Huang Fuzi Xixin Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Ma Huang Fuzi Xixin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰病初起反現發熱，脈微沉細而沉者主用。本方以溫補裏陽、升散下陷之陽、並促利小便以通腑中濁寒為治機。麻黃發汗兼利尿以排出臟腑濾過性病邪（在某些體質下不發汗而走小便）；附子溫腎壯心、恢復下元陽火，使心腎陽氣復振；細辛上行，導引附子之陽上達中焦並制約附子走散於表，令內寒轉為內熱而不外脫。適用於少陰證剛得時出現“反發熱”有表象但實為裏寒、下焦陽弱而尿化不暢或脈沉微欲寐之證。臨床上如得二三日後津液已傷或有微汗、表虛，當以麻黃附子甘草湯（去細辛、換炙甘草）微發其汗、保津；若裏寒兼有實滯、大便不通，可改用大黃附子細辛湯以通腑。用藥注意不可在津液已傷（口乾、目乾、少尿或舌燥）時濫用麻黃以致耗傷津液；亦忌外熱實證及陰虛內熱者。必要時並配利水健脾或補血養陰之劑以調整。 / Used for Shaoyin disease at onset when fever reemerges and the pulse is deep, thin, and submerged. The pattern: internal cold with collapse or sinking of yang; the formula warms and restores yang in the interior, raises and disperses fallen yang, and promotes urination to expel accumulated cold-damp. Ma Huang induces sweating and also promotes diuresis to help eliminate pathogen from the viscera (in some constitutions it causes urine rather than sweat); Fuzi warms the kidney and augments heart yang to revive the lower-source yang; Xixin ascends and guides yang upward and restrains Fuzi from dispersing to the surface, so the interior cold is converted to internal warming without exterior collapse. Indicated when Shaoyin is newly contracted with reemergent fever and signs of interior cold with impaired lower-jiao yang and a deep/thin pulse. If the disease has progressed 2–3 days with injury to fluids and only slight sweating, substitute Zhi Gan Cao (Ma Huang Fuzi Gan Cao Tang) to induce mild sweating and preserve fluids; if there is cold accumulation with fecal obstruction, use Da Huang Fuzi Xixin Tang to open the bowel. Cautions: avoid heavy use of Ma Huang when body fluids are already depleted (dry mouth, dry eyes, scanty urine, dry tongue) because it may further exhaust jingye; unsuitable for pure exterior-heat or yin-deficiency heat patterns. Combine with drainage, spleen-support, or blood-nourishing formulas as indicated.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥：麻黃二兩（去節）、細辛二兩、附子一枚（炮，去皮，破八片）。炮製與煎法：先以水一斗先煎麻黃，減二升，去上沫，再納諸藥同煎，煮取三升，去滓，溫服一升，日三服。變方要點：若病得二三日、津液受損、僅需微發其汗，去細辛改用炙甘草，為麻黃附子甘草湯；若寒實便秘需通腑，用大黃替代麻黃為大黃附子細辛湯。禁忌與注意：已有津液不足（口乾、目乾、舌燥、少尿）或陰虛內熱者慎用或禁用；用藥需觀察小便與汗出，以免耗傷津液，並視情配合補血、健脾或利水藥。 / Herbs: Ma Huang 2 liang (nodes removed), Xi Xin 2 liang, Fuzi 1 piece (prepared, peel removed, split into eight). Preparation: Add one dou of water; first decoct Ma Huang, reduce by two sheng and remove scum, then add the remaining herbs and boil down to three sheng; remove dregs and take one sheng warm, three times daily. Variants: If the illness is 2–3 days old with injured fluids and only a need for slight sweating, remove Xi Xin and substitute Zhi Gan Cao to make Ma Huang Fuzi Gan Cao Tang (mild sweating, preserves fluids). If there is cold accumulation with fecal obstruction, substitute Da Huang for Ma Huang to form Da Huang Fuzi Xi Xin Tang to open the bowel. Contraindications/precautions: avoid when body fluids are already depleted (dry mouth/eyes, scanty urine, dry tongue) or in yin-deficiency heat; monitor urine and sweating to prevent depletion of jing-ye; combine with blood-nourishing, spleen-strengthening, or diuretic herbs as clinically indicated.

syndromes.name: 麻黃附子甘草湯證 / Ma Huang Fuzi Gan Cao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Ma Huang Fuzi Gan Cao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰病得之二三日，外有微發其汗而無明顯裏證者。此證本屬裏寒、腎心陽虛，但因有微表而不宜用純利小便之法，反需固中益津、緩復脈機。麻黃附子甘草湯用麻黃發汗、通氣并助利以驅內寒，炮附子溫補腎心之陽以復中陽，炙甘草益津斂汗、補脈並制麻黃之散奔，令藥性停於中焦以固表而不致過度利水耗津。適用於得病二三日後有微汗、神倦欲寐、脈微細沉但未見明顯裏實或大汗脫液者。禁用於津液已竭（口渴甚、舌乾少津、便秘小便赤少）、真實熱證或表虛汗多者。方用藥量與炮製、煎法按經方：麻黃二兩（去節）、炙甘草二兩、附子一枚；以水七升先煮麻黃一二沸去沫，納諸藥煎取三升，溫服一升，日三服。 / Shaoyin disease after 2–3 days with slight sweating and no clear interior signs. The pattern is essentially interior cold with insufficiency of kidney/heart yang, but because there is a mild exterior manifestation one should conserve fluids and stabilize the pulse rather than provoke diuresis or strong dispersal. Ma Huang Fuzi Gan Cao Tang uses Ma Huang to release the exterior, move qi and promote diuresis to help expel pathogenic cold; prepared Fuzi (aconite) to warm and reinforce kidney and cardiac yang and restore central yang; and honey-fried (roasted) Gan Cao (licorice) to nourish and preserve fluids, stop excessive sweating, harmonize the formula and restrain Ma Huang from driving yang and fluids downward into excessive urination. Indications: 2–3 days into Shaoyin disorder, slight sweating, somnolence/desire to sleep, pulse fine and deep without clear interior excess. Contraindications: exhausted fluids (marked thirst, dry tongue, constipation, scant/amber urine), true interior heat, or profuse spontaneous sweating or clear fluid loss. Follow Zhang Zhongjing’s preparation: Ma Huang 2 liang (remove nodes), Zhi Gan Cao (roasted licorice) 2 liang, Fuzi 1 piece (prepared); decoct with 7 sheng water, boil Ma Huang briefly and remove scum, add other herbs and boil down to 3 sheng; take 1 sheng warm, three times daily.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：麻黃二兩（去節）、炙甘草二兩（炙）、附子一枚（炮，去皮）。功能主治：麻黃發汗利水、外散寒邪並助通氣；炮附子溫補腎心陽、回陽固脈；炙甘草補津斂汗、調和諸藥並制麻黃走下走失。用法：以水七升，先煮麻黃一二沸，去上沫，納諸藥，煮取三升，去滓，溫服一升，日三服。注意：若見津液已竭（口渴舌乾、便秘、小便赤少）、或實熱證、或自汗甚多者勿用。與麻黃附子細辛湯比較：細辛上升助回陽上托，炙甘草則保津補脈、抑制過度利小便或走泄。 / Formula: Ma Huang (Ephedra) 2 liang (remove nodes), Zhi Gan Cao (honey-fried/roasted Licorice) 2 liang, Fuzi (prepared Aconite) 1 piece. Actions/roles: Ma Huang—mild diaphoresis, mobilizes qi and can promote diuresis to help expel interior cold; Fuzi—strongly warms and rescues kidney and heart yang, restores central/yang qi and supports the pulse; Zhi Gan Cao—nourishes and protects fluids, restrains excessive sweating, harmonizes the formula and moderates Ma Huang’s tendency to drive fluids downward into diuresis. Preparation/dosing (per the text): decoct with 7 sheng water, boil Ma Huang briefly and skim scum, add remaining herbs and reduce to 3 sheng; take 1 sheng warm, three times daily. Cautions: do not use if fluids are exhausted (marked thirst, dry tongue, constipation, scant dark urine), if there is true interior heat, or with profuse spontaneous sweating. Difference vs Ma Huang Fuzi Xi Xin Tang: Xi Xin (Asarum) raises yang and directs Fuzi’s warmth upward; Zhi Gan Cao instead preserves fluids and stabilizes the pulse when slight sweating is present and diuresis must be avoided.

syndromes.name: 黃連阿膠湯證 / Huang Lian E Jiao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Huang Lian E Jiao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 得病二三日或數日後津液已傷，出現心中煩躁、不得臥寐者，屬少陰病津虧而夾有裏熱毒火、腸胃濕熱或感染之表現。主症為心煩失眠、心悸倦怠、面色無華、口乾舌燥或潮熱，常見於術後、失血或長期消耗後之煩躁不寐。方以清腸胃熱毒（黃連、黃芩）並養血安神（阿膠、雞子黃），以白芍酸斂固攝，使所補之血不外散，從而寧心安神、解熱解毒、補陰養血。 / After several days of illness the body fluids (jinye) are depleted, producing vexation and inability to sleep. This is a Shao Yin pattern of injured fluids with emerging interior heat/toxin, often involving intestinal inflammation or heat. Main signs: irritability, insomnia, palpitations, fatigue, pale or depleted complexion, dry mouth and tongue or intermittent flushing. Commonly seen after surgery, significant bleeding, or prolonged consumption. The formula clears intestinal/inner heat and toxin (Huang Lian, Huang Qin) while nourishing yin and blood to calm the heart (E Jiao, raw egg yolk); Bai Shao astringes and consolidates the restorative effect so the replenished blood is retained, achieving tranquilization and resolution of inflammation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥：黃連四兩、黃芩二兩、芍藥二兩、雞子黃二枚、阿膠三兩。方義：黃連、黃芩清熱解毒、注重腸胃內熱炎症；阿膠、雞子黃大補陰血、養心安神；白芍酸斂固攝，收攝所補。炮製與服法：先以水五升煎黃連、黃芩、白芍，煮取二升，去滓；用小火納阿膠烊盡，稍涼後納生雞子黃攪勻，溫服七合，日三服。臨床適應：術後或失血後之煩躁不寐、津液耗損伴腸胃內熱或感染所致的心悸失眠。 / Formula: Huang Lian (Coptis) 4 liang, Huang Qin (Scutellaria) 2 liang, Bai Shao (White Peony Root) 2 liang, two chicken egg yolks (raw), E Jiao (donkey-hide gelatin) 3 liang. Actions: Huang Lian and Huang Qin clear heat and resolve toxicity, especially intestinal/GI inflammation; E Jiao and raw egg yolk strongly nourish yin and blood and calm the heart/spirit; Bai Shao is sour/holding, consolidating the restored blood to prevent dispersion. Preparation and administration: decoct the first three herbs in 5 sheng of water down to 2 sheng, remove dregs; over low heat dissolve the E Jiao, cool slightly, then add the raw egg yolks and stir until integrated; warm and take ~7 he (approx. portion) three times daily. Indications: post‑operative or post‑hemorrhagic vexation and insomnia with depleted fluids and concurrent intestinal/inner heat or toxin.

syndromes.name: 附子湯證 / Fuzi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 證義擴充：附子湯主治典型少陰裏寒、陽氣虛衰導致的內寒痠痛證。病因為腎陽與中焦運化乏力，水濕內停、血行不暢，致四肢失溫、肌肉骨節痠痛、手足厥冷、脈沉而無力。臨證常見面色黯淡或蒼白，形體倦怠，或伴有腹脹納差、夜尿增多或水腫。與表證的麻黃類方比較：麻黃湯或麻黃附子細辛湯多見脈浮緊、惡寒重、皮膚觸痛（表寒），而附子湯脈沉、為裏寒；與真武湯比較：若以水濕下注、小便不利、浮腫明顯，方中多以茯苓為重且以生薑代人參，為真武類證。適應：裏寒虛寒、陽不外達、血行受阻所致的虛寒痠痛。禁忌：有明顯陰虛內熱、燥熱口渴、實熱證或表證尚盛者慎用或不用。 / Expanded pattern: Fuzi Tang treats a classic Shaoyin interior-cold pattern with collapse/insufficiency of yang leading to internal cold pain. Pathomechanism: kidney yang and middle jiao transportive power are deficient, water-damp accumulates, and blood circulation is impaired, producing cold limbs, muscle and joint soreness, cold extremities and a deep weak pulse. Typical findings include pallor or sallow complexion, fatigue, poor appetite or abdominal distension, increased nocturia or edema. Differentiation: compared with Ma Huang formulas (Ma Huang Tang or Ma Huang Fuzi Xixin Tang), those show a floating tight pulse and prominent exterior cold/skin pain (exterior pathogen), whereas Fuzi Tang has a deep pulse indicating interior cold. Compared with Zhen Wu Tang, if urinary difficulty, marked edema and lower-body water retention predominate, the prescription emphasizes Fu Ling and uses Sheng Jiang instead of Ren Shen (Zhen Wu pattern). Indications: internal cold from yang deficiency with damp-water retention and impaired blood flow causing generalized aching. Contraindications: obvious yin-deficiency heat, internal dryness or pure excess-heat or strong exterior signs.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥與用法擴充：附子湯（方中藥量典據經文）：附子二枚（炮，破八片），茯苓三兩，人參二兩，白朮四兩，白芍三兩。右五味以水八升煎取三升，去滓，溫服一升，日三服。各藥作用：附子（炮附）猛烈回陽、溫補裡陽、壯心腎陽並回陽救逆；茯苓利水滲濕、健脾寧心，助水濕運化並通利小便；白朮健脾祛濕、固表止汗，協助脾運化水濕；人參補中益氣、健脾生津以恢復運化功能（方中以人參扶正以利水去濕而不耗元氣）；白芍養血柔肝、緩急止痛、收斂固澀以使補益不外散。臨床調整要點：若小便不利、明顯水腫或水停下焦，當將人參換為生薑並增重茯苓、調整白朮用量，即近於真武湯；若有明顯表證或反發熱，或需發汗利尿以解表裡，則選用麻黃附子細辛湯或麻黃附子甘草湯；不宜用於陰虛內熱、乾燥燥症或純實熱證。炮附子必經炮制（去皮、破八片）並慎用於陰虛火旺者。臨用注意：方中白朮重於茯苓以重健脾運化（與真武湯茯苓重之處不同）；方中不加甘草以免使陽散走表，影響回陽聚中之效。 / Herbs and usage (expanded): Classical formula (from the text): Fuzi 2 pieces (processed, broken into 8 pieces), Fu Ling 3 liang, Ren Shen 2 liang, Bai Zhu 4 liang, Bai Shao 3 liang. Decoction: decoct 8 sheng of water to obtain 3 sheng, strain, take warm 1 sheng, three times daily. Actions of individual herbs: Fuzi (processed Aconite) strongly warms and restores interior yang, revives collapsed yang, and strengthens heart and kidney yang; Fu Ling promotes urination, drains dampness and supports the spleen, assisting water metabolism; Bai Zhu strengthens the spleen, expels dampness and secures the exterior to aid transportive function; Ren Shen tonifies qi, strengthens the middle jiao and generates fluids to restore transportive power so the body can resolve damp; Bai Shao nourishes blood, softens the liver, relieves pain and contracts/contains so tonification does not scatter. Clinical modifications: if urinary difficulty, marked edema or lower-water accumulation predominate, replace Ren Shen with Sheng Jiang and increase Fu Ling (shift toward Zhen Wu Tang pattern); if there are prominent exterior signs or fever with surface involvement, consider Ma Huang Fuzi Xi Xin Tang or Ma Huang Fuzi Gan Cao Tang instead; avoid use in yin-deficiency heat, internal dryness, or pure excess-heat. Notes on preparation and cautions: Fuzi must be properly processed (pao, peeled and broken) and used with caution in yin-deficient heat. In Fuzi Tang Bai Zhu is heavier than Fu Ling (emphasis on strengthening spleen); do not add Gan Cao indiscriminately here because it may drive the warming effect outward and dissipate the intended interior restoration.

syndromes.name: 桃花湯證 / Tao Hua Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 裏寒下血，或下利便膿血者用之；以收澀固腸止血、溫中。 / Used for interior cold causing bleeding downwards or dysenteric stools with pus and blood; astringes the bowel, stops bleeding and warms the middle.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：赤石脂一斤（半研末半全用），乾薑一兩，粳米一升。 / Formula: Chi Shi Zhi 1 jin (half powdered), Gan Jiang 1 liang, Japonica rice 1 sheng.

syndromes.name: 大黃附子細辛湯證 / Da Huang Fuzi Xixin Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Da Huang Fuzi Xixin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 寒實內停、大便不行、舌苔白、脈遲緩者用以通腸下滯、溫里行氣。 / For cold-excess with intestinal obstruction and constipation, white tongue coating and slow pulse; purges stagnation, warms the interior and promotes movement.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：大黃三兩，附子三兩，細辛二兩。 / Formula: Da Huang 3 liang, Fuzi 3 liang, Xi Xin 2 liang.

syndromes.name: 豬膚湯證 / Zhufu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰病兼有下利、咽痛、心煩，為陰虛內熱、熱上擾下泄之證，豬膚湯可補津助胃以止利、利咽解煩。 / Shaoyin pattern with diarrhea, throat pain, and vexation due to yin deficiency and upward-rising heat; Zhufu Tang supplements fluids and supports digestion to stop diarrhea, relieve throat symptoms, and calm vexation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 豬膚、白蜜、白粉（米粉） / pig skin (Zhufu), white honey, rice flour (white powder)

syndromes.name: 甘草湯證 / Gancao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰病二三日的單純咽痛，甘草湯以甘草解毒、利咽止痛。 / Simple throat pain in early Shaoyin disease; Gancao Tang (licorice decoction) detoxifies and soothes the throat.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 甘草 / licorice (Gancao)

syndromes.name: 桔梗湯證 / Jiegeng Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 咽痛兼有痰飲或化膿傾向者，桔梗宣肺化痰、利咽，常與甘草合用。 / Throat pain with phlegm or suppurative tendency; Jiegeng opens the lungs, resolves phlegm, and benefits the throat, often combined with licorice.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桔梗、甘草 / Jiegeng (Platycodon), licorice (Gancao)

syndromes.name: 苦酒湯證 / Kujiu (Bitter Wine) Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 咽中生瘡、不能言語或失聲者，苦酒湯含嚥以消腫、斂瘡、去痰。 / Throat ulceration with aphonia or inability to speak; Kujiu Tang is held in the mouth to reduce swelling, restrain sores, and remove phlegm.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 半夏、生雞子（蛋清）、苦酒（醋） / raw Banxia (Pinellia), egg white, bitter wine (vinegar)

syndromes.name: 半夏散及湯證 / Banxia San and Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰兼表證且咽中痛者，半夏、桂枝、甘草等藥以兼能解表、化痰。 / Shaoyin with concurrent exterior signs and throat pain; Banxia with Guizhi and Gancao releases the exterior and transforms phlegm.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 半夏、桂枝、甘草 / Pinellia (Banxia), Guizhi (Cinnamon twig), licorice (Gancao)

syndromes.name: 白通湯證 / Baitong Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陰病下利、里寒外熱、上下不通者，白通湯溫經散寒，通達上下以止利。 / Shaoyin disease with diarrhea, interior cold and exterior heat, and obstruction between upper and lower; Baitong Tang warms the channels and disperses cold to restore communication and stop diarrhea.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 蔥白、乾薑、生附子 / scallion white, dried ginger, raw aconite (fuzi)

syndromes.name: 白通加豬膽汁湯證 / Baitong plus Pig Bile Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Baitong plus Pig Bile Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 利不止、厥逆無脈、乾嘔煩躁等危重逆證，白通湯加豬膽汁與人尿以回陽開結。 / Severe reversal with uncontrolled diarrhea, cold reversal with absent or faint pulse, retching and agitation; Baitong plus pig bile and human urine is used to revive yang and open obstructions.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 蔥白、乾薑、生附子，加豬膽汁、人尿 / scallion white, dried ginger, raw aconite, plus pig bile and human urine

syndromes.name: 通脈四逆湯證 / Tongmai Sini Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 下利清穀、里寒外熱、脈微欲絕或脈不出者，通脈四逆湯通內外、回陽出脈。 / Diarrhea with undigested food, interior cold with exterior heat, and a faint or absent pulse; Tongmai Sini Tang opens the channels, restores communication between interior and exterior, and aims to revive pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 炙甘草、生附子、乾薑 / prepared licorice (Zhi Gancao), raw aconite (fuzi), dried ginger

syndromes.name: 厥陰中風 / Jueyin wind-attack (Jueyin stroke)
syndromes.description: 厥陰絡及經氣受風邪侵犯所致之中風型態，常見脈象變化為微浮或不浮以判定復原與否。 / A wind-attack affecting the Jueyin channel, presenting as a stroke-like pattern; pulse changes (slightly floating vs. not floating) help assess recovery.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常以扶正、活血、回陽為法（章中提示陽回可自愈），臨證可用當歸四逆類劑量調整。 / Therapy focuses on supporting yang, invigorating blood, and restoring circulation; formulas like Danggui Sini-type decoctions (in larger doses when severe) are mentioned.

syndromes.name: 當歸四逆湯證 / Danggui Sini Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 以溫通經脈、活血通脈、回陽止厥為主的方證；在厥陰寒厥或肢端冷痛（如凍瘡）可用之並加大劑量。 / A pattern treated by Danggui Sini Decoction to warm and unblock the channels, invigorate blood, and restore yang; used for Jueyin cold reversal and peripheral cold (e.g., chilblains), with dose escalation in severe cases.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 當歸四逆湯：當歸、桂枝、細辛、通草等，以溫經活血、回陽為法（臨證依方）。 / Danggui Sini Decoction: herbs such as Danggui, Guizhi, Xixin, and Tongcao, aimed to warm channels, invigorate blood, and restore yang (modify per case).

syndromes.name: 蚘厥 / Yao jue (parasitic-induced syncope)
syndromes.description: 證候：因脾胃虛寒，寒濕內勝以致生蟲，蟲上衝入膈、擾心神而見時煩（時作時止）、噁心嘔吐、得食即嘔、常自吐蚘（吐出蟲體）、唇上見白點、腹痛及腹內蟲動感；兼見久利或寒利帶膿血。屬厥陰/少陰中以胃寒生蟲、腸胃津液不足之表現。治則以溫中驅蟲、止利、回陽補脾為主，方藥首推烏梅丸，並應禁食生冷、滑物、臭食、發汗之法。 / Pattern: Parasite-induced syncope (Yao jue) arises from stomach and spleen coldness and deficiency allowing parasites to proliferate. Parasites ascend into the diaphragm and disturb the spirit, producing intermittent vexation (on and off), nausea and vomiting, vomiting of worms, white spots on the lips, abdominal pain and a sensation of worms moving; features include vomiting after eating and chronic cold dysentery that may be accompanied by pus or blood. Pathomechanism: stomach-cold with impaired middle Jiao fluids and weakened resistance. Treatment principles: warm the middle, expel/kill parasites, stop cold diarrhea and augment middle qi; chief formula is Wumei Wan. Avoid raw/cold, greasy or foul-smelling foods and inducing sweat.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 烏梅丸（主方）：烏梅三百個、細辛六兩、乾薑十兩、黃連一斤、當歸四兩、附子六兩（炮）、蜀椒四兩（炒去汗）、桂枝六兩、人參六兩、黃柏六兩。為十味，異搗篩合治。製法：以苦酒（或傳本作醋）漬烏梅一宿，去核，蒸之；取五升米與蒸熟之烏梅同擣為泥，與藥末相合，入臼中與蜜，杵二千下，丸如梧桐子大。服法：先食（飯前）服，每次十丸，日三服，稍加至二十丸。禁忌：忌生冷、滑物、臭食及發汗。功能主治：溫腸胃、殺蟲、止利、補中氣；主蚘厥、久利及寒利帶膿血。 / Wumei Wan (chief formula): Wumei (乌梅, smoked/black plum) 300 pieces; Xixin (细辛, Asarum) 6 liang; Ganjiang (干姜, dried ginger) 10 liang; Huanglian (黄连, Coptis) 1 jin; Danggui (当归, Angelica sinensis) 4 liang; Fuzi (附子, processed Aconite) 6 liang (pao/processed); Shujiao/Chuanjiao (蜀椒, Sichuan pepper/Zanthoxylum) 4 liang (stir-fried to remove sweating effect); Guizhi (桂枝, cinnamon twig) 6 liang; Renshen (人参, ginseng) 6 liang; Huangbai (黄柏, Phellodendron) 6 liang. Preparation: pulverize and sift the ten herbs together. Soak the Wumei in kujiu (苦酒, bitter wine) overnight (some traditions use vinegar), remove pits and steam; cook 5 sheng of rice, mash rice with the steamed plums into a paste, mix with the powdered herbs in a mortar, add honey and pound (~2000 pestle strokes) into pills about the size of a wutong seed. Administration: take before meals; start with 10 pills three times daily, gradually increase to 20 pills if needed. Contraindications/precautions: avoid raw/cold foods, slippery/greasy or foul-smelling foods, and avoid therapies that induce sweating. Actions/indications: warms the middle, exterminates parasites, stops cold diarrhea, tonifies middle qi; indicated for parasite-induced Yao jue (蚘厥), chronic cold dysentery and cold diarrhea with pus or blood.

syndromes.name: 藏厥 / Zang jue (visceral syncope)
syndromes.description: 內臟（藏）氣虛或陰陽不和導致持續或間歇性厥冷、煩躁、脈微等表現，常伴無暫安或神志不寧。 / Visceral syncope due to visceral qi collapse or yin‑yang disharmony, presenting with persistent/intermittent cold extremities, agitation, faint/feeble pulse, and restlessness or disturbed consciousness.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治法依臟屬及寒熱虛實辨證，用補益或溫陽扶正之方。 / Treatment depends on organ involvement and cold/heat, deficiency/excess differentiation, using tonifying or warming‑yang formulas to support the root.

syndromes.name: 當歸四逆加吳茱萸生薑湯證 / Danggui Si Ni plus Wu Zhu Yu & Shengjiang Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 當歸四逆加吳茱萸生薑湯證
syndromes.name_en: Danggui Si Ni plus Wu Zhu Yu & Shengjiang Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 在當歸四逆基礎上加吳茱萸、生薑，適用於內有久寒或胃寒引起的手足厥冷兼嘔吐噁心，既需回陽又需疏胃散寒。 / Danggui Si Ni Tang modified with Wu Zhu Yu and fresh ginger for chronic internal cold or gastric cold causing cold extremities with vomiting and nausea; combines rescuing yang and dispersing stomach-cold.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 處方（簡述）：當歸、桂枝、芍藥、細辛、通草、炙甘草、大棗、吳茱萸、生薑。 / Typical herbs: Danggui, Guizhi, Shaoyao, Xixin, Tongcao, Zhi Gancao, Dazao, Wu Zhu Yu, Shengjiang.

syndromes.name: 麻黃升麻湯證 / Mahuang Shengma Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 寒寒熱熱錯雜，上熱下寒，兼有咽喉潰爛及腸中虛寒下利的寒熱夾雜證。 / Pattern of mixed cold and heat with upper heat and lower cold, often with throat ulceration and intestinal deficiency-cold producing diarrhea.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥：麻黃二兩半、升麻一兩一分、當歸一兩一分、知母、黃芩、葳蕤各十八銖、石膏（碎綿裹）、白朮、乾薑、芍藥、桂枝、茯苓、甘草、天門冬（去心）等十四味；水煎服。 / Herbs (summary): Ephedra (Mahuang), Cimicifuga (Shengma), Angelica (Danggui), Anemarrhena (Zhimu), Scutellaria (Huangqin), Pao-fu-ling (Weirui), Gypsum (Shigao), Atractylodes (Baizhu), Dried ginger (Ganjiang), Peony (Shaoyao), Cinnamon twig (Guizhi), Poria (Fuling), Licorice (Gancao), Asparagus (Tianmendong); decoction as described.

syndromes.name: 乾薑黃連黃芩人參湯證 / Ganjiang Huanglian Huangqin Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 乾薑黃連黃芩人參湯證
syndromes.name_en: Ganjiang Huanglian Huangqin Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 中焦虛寒兼有虛熱與腸胃津傷，表現為食入即吐、嘔吐、津液耗傷。 / Pattern of middle jiao deficiency-cold with false/empty heat and injured fluids of the stomach, presenting with immediate vomiting on ingestion and fluid depletion.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥：乾薑、黃連、黃芩、人參各三兩；水煎服。 / Herbs (summary): Dried ginger (Ganjiang), Coptis (Huanglian), Scutellaria (Huangqin), Ginseng (Renshen); decoction.

syndromes.name: 白頭翁湯證 / Bai Tou Weng Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 症候：主症為熱性下利，里急後重、排便不盡感（里急後重）、腸鳴腹痛，糞臭或糞中帶膿血，伴明顯口渴，舌質偏紅、苔黃，脈數或洪大。病機：腸中熱毒鬱結，熱迫津血，傷及腸絡而成血膿下行，故見膿血下利並兼消耗津液。辨別要點：屬實熱熱利而非寒利（熱利者口渴明顯）；若並見大便秘結或燥屎，屬裡實熱結，應以承氣類攻下而非止利；若伴裏虛寒或陽氣虛弱，則不宜清熱大劑，當以扶陽溫中為先。病程變化：病勢轉虛、心下濡者見虛煩宜轉用清熱和解或補益方（如梔子豉湯）；并發譫語或大便實滯者應改用攻下劑（如大承氣湯）。 / Clinical features: heat-type dysenteric diarrhea with tenesmus and a sense of incomplete evacuation, intestinal rumbling and abdominal pain, foul stools or stools containing pus and blood, marked thirst. Tongue often red with yellow coating; pulse rapid or surging. Pathomechanism: accumulation of intestinal heat-toxin injures fluids and blood and damages intestinal vessels, producing bloody and purulent dysentery and fluid depletion. Key differential points: this is heat dysentery (prominent thirst) rather than cold diarrhea; if there is constipation or dried hard stool, the pattern is excess heat with bowel accumulation and requires Chengqi-class purgation rather than astringent heat-clearing. If there are signs of interior cold or yang deficiency, avoid large cold-clearing formulas and choose warming/supportive therapy. During recovery, if vexation with soft epigastrium (xu fan) appears, switch to formulas that clear residual heat and harmonize (e.g., ZhiziChitang); if signs of severe constipation with delirium, use DaChengqiTang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥：白頭翁湯——白頭翁二兩，黃連、黃柏、秦皮各三兩。煎法：以水七升，煎取二升，溫服一升，必要時再服一升。功用：清腸中熱毒，涼血止痢，斂腸止血，收澀止下。加減與辨證應用：凡為腸中熱毒所致之血膿下利、口渴津傷者為主證。若見大便秘結或燥屎者，屬裡實熱閉結，應改用承氣類攻下（如大承氣湯）；若病人有裏虛寒象、陽氣虛弱或全身虛冷者，忌用本方清熱大劑，應擇扶陽溫中方（如四逆湯類或補陽方）。臨床注意：辨清是否有大便實滯或胃腸虛寒，並注意補液與糾正脫水；兒童、孕婦與陽虛者慎用。 / Formula: Bai Tou Weng Tang — Bai Tou Weng 2 liang; Huang Lian (Coptis Rhizome) 3 liang; Huang Bai (Phellodendron Bark) 3 liang; Qin Pi (Fraxini Cortex) 3 liang. Preparation: decoct in 7 sheng of water to yield 2 sheng; take 1 sheng warm, repeat another 1 sheng if needed. Actions: clears intestinal heat-toxin, cools blood and stops dysenteric diarrhea, astringes the intestines and arrests bleeding. Indications and modifications: indicated for bloody, purulent heat dysenteric diarrhea with thirst and fluid depletion due to intestinal toxic heat. If there is constipation or dried hard stool (intestinal accumulation), this indicates excess interior heat and requires Chengqi-class purgation (e.g., DaChengqiTang) rather than an astringent heat-clearing formula. If the patient shows signs of interior cold or yang deficiency, avoid this cold-clearing prescription and select warming/supportive formulas (e.g., SiNiTang or other yin/yang-restoring prescriptions). Clinical cautions: assess for fecal impaction, correct dehydration, and use caution in children, pregnant patients, and those with marked yang deficiency.

syndromes.name: 白頭翁湯治熱利下重證 / Bai Tou Weng treatment for heat diarrhea with bearing-down
syndromes.name_zh: 白頭翁湯治熱利下重證
syndromes.name_en: Bai Tou Weng treatment for heat diarrhea with bearing-down
syndromes.description: 臨床應用白頭翁湯以治熱性下利伴下重、便臭、便膿血等；方主清熱止瀉、斂腸止血。 / Clinical application of Bai Tou Weng Tang for heat diarrhea with bearing-down: clears intestinal heat, stops dysentery, restrains bowel and controls bleeding.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 白頭翁、黃連、黃柏、秦皮等，清熱燥濕，止瀉止血。 / Bai Tou Weng, Huang Lian, Huang Bai, Qin Pi: herbs that clear heat, dry dampness, stop diarrhea and control intestinal bleeding.
